Costar Shane West plays a bad boy who gets himself in trouble and is forced to do community service. This includes acting with Moore in a school play about shy lovers. Predictably, West falls in love with Moore even when she warns him not to. Then her secret comes out (it starts with a "c"), and he loves her even more, enough to ask her to marry him. The film is a tender tale of the redemptive powers of faith and love, and forgiveness. It is frankly very moving for such a hokey plot. Peter Coyote and Darryl Hannah costar as parents. Hannah is almost unrecognizable under a dark wig and little makeup. A must-see.

title: best movie ever
review: i loved the movie a walk to remember, from the very first time i watched it, all those years ago, right up until today and for a long time into the future it has, is and always will be my all time favourite movie ever of all time....i have never seen a more beautiful and compatible couple on the screen in a teen film, as mandy moore and shane west....and i think they were the absolute perfect choices for their roles. every time i watch it i cry, even though i have watched it, probably over a hundred or even more times...all my friends are the same, and if you haven't watched the most beautiful movie ever, i suggest that you watch a walk to remember, you will never forget it.

title: what I think
review:
All in all, as a movie, it does well on its own. A bit sappy but good nonetheless. This Nicholas Sparks (I've recently come into his books) adapted film wasn't quite the tear-jerker that "The Notebook" was, but it pays its due to his book I suppose.

However, it doesn't really follow the novel at all. (I watched the movie first as I wasn't really into Nicholas Sparks; actually I'm still unsure) SPOILER ALERT! (I suppose, but more so for the book, if you haven't read it yet.) They did cover the wedding scene in the Special Features on the DVD so I won't go into that.

Jamie never has a list of things she wants to do (the one most outstanding is being in two places at once). Her father writes a play called "The Chrimstas Angel" which gives Jamie a MUCH more wholesome look than in whatever the play is in the movie. Landon doesn't kiss her then and he only realizes he's in love with her after spending time with her at an orphanage she has devoted her life and work to helping.

And although Landon's best friend Eric makes cracks, he accepts Landon's decision and makes the comment that he's finally "growing up", which shows something different than the punching scene in the movie.

Jamie never lets Landon in her home and the father disallows too much unsupervised contact between the two. AND they never work on the lines from the play together.

Jamie doesn't have that awareness of being "special friends" where no one can see; she's just her own person doing her own thing and helping others. And the reverend announces the fact that Jamie has leukemia to the congregation and everyone starts to feel guilty and at one point Eric breaks down because he doesn't feel someone like Jamie deserves this outcome. (Bible-toting do-gooder; AND there's a specific special reason why she carries a tattered Bible everywhere) Basically, READ the book. You'll find it's quite different from the movie.

Oh and Landon's ex-girlfriend barely gets any mention except for when she gets drunk and pukes all over the bathroom and herself and Jamie and Landon help her clean up and go home. There's no jealousy or resentment.

When Mandy Moore (Before she filmed) had "A Walk to Remember" as a favorite book, I assumed she'd want to stay true. The movie is completely different, but like I said, it holds its own.

title: A Movie to remember! When simplicity is all! (dvd)
review:
This movie is so good, that it made me live its exact story while watching it.

Indeed, it talks about how a bad feeling can turn into something beautiful & unforgettable by the power of love.

So, when I picked the DVD, I thought "Another boring teen movie!". But, when I put it on my player, the title song (Cry) struck me. It is all I asked for music: easy listening & moving, so I can't put it outside my head. Then, I watched the bonuses (I know: every people tells I should invert my habit). I found Mandy Moore to be a lively actress, as well as Shane West (a good Anakin he may have been). Then, I watched it. And frankly, it didn't caught me until it answered two of my questions:

1.Will the gift of his pink shirt be used in the continuity of the storyline?

2. How this storyline could evolve as it kept going stronger & happier?

The answers I received was so respectful & surprising, that I was won over. At this moment, I liked this movie and couldn't put it down until I watched its end!

Now, with a little time, its simplicity gave me a feeling of my "Must Do Dreams". Those families live in a community, they lead simple life, express simple feelings, which are for me all definitions of Happiness.

In conclusion, one of the few "adaptation" which gave me the desire to read the original book!

title: hey people can someone help me out?
review: hey u guys I'm just really curious does any one know how the poem goes..you know the one in Jaime's mom book that she gave Landon...it was about love and hows it patient n kind..stuff like that..if you know it please reply thank you!! hugs and kisses... oh and by the way i love that movie it was so beautiful it made me cry so0o much.....oh and if anybody knows the poem just write it in the reply for me OK i will greatly appreciate it...when i heard it i was like Aww thats so0o sweet..damn it i wish i had a boyfriend...but its OK i guess ..wow I'm going to be quiet now no one really cares about what i want wow..so yea..to tell you the truth i keep on writing because this thing keeps telling me that i have to have at least 10 lines how annoying.

title: the beautiful letdown
review: though there are a lots of flicks like this, this one definitely hit the jackpot! i'm not and never a fan of mandy moore and often times, i dislike her songs but i guess in this movie, she touched me in a way no movie has.. i mean talking abt her character. In that film, i was just intrigued by the fact that she has a movie coming out (and the fact that Shane West is hot), not knowing this could move me in a different way. I'm not a religious person but i believe her character exemplifies that of God. Built in his own image and likeness.. I am so amazed of h0w mr. Sparks made that novel. i used to read a lot of novels but this one, is definitely a winner! Each song fits every scene.. i so love it. I totally love Switchfoot and i thank the whole production for including them in the soundtrack listing.. and finally, one thing that made me cry ( I'm not a cheesy person) was the scene of being two places and marrying thing.. it was just so.. speechless.. breathtakingly beautiful..

title: Bloody Fantastic
review:
I have seen this movie about 1,000 times and I even own it. I absolutely love this movie. The movie is not just some teen flick, it's for all ages. The movie captures a rebel and a Christian girl coming together for love and support. And it's not just about how it's a really good tearjerker, it tells a story about love so strong it could last through anything, even death. The fact that the movie is based on a Nicholas Sparks book made me want to

see this movie. I've read all of his books and have been hooked on them ever

since. Jamie, is based on Nicholas Sparks' sister, it is not a true story, not all of it. I don't see how some people don't like the end of it. I mean did you just not want her to die? I didn't want her to die, but that's what helped Landon make his life better, he did it for her, and himself. Since I'm a hopeless romantic, this is one of my favorite movies: a classic love story. I hope everyone gets a chance to see this movie. It helps you realize

whats important in your life, because it sure helped mine.

title: Sweet
review:
A Walk to Remember isn't exactly the best film ever. The characters aren't perfectly layered and developed (the cool guy who gets into trouble, and the virginal sweetheart who can sing, for example). The storyline isn't flawlessly transitioned (I had trouble figuring out how long this all took place until the end). And yes, Mandy Moore is the lead.

But I don't care. Realistic or not, it's an incredibly sweet film and I loved it. It's how we feel romances should be, not how they are. That's what's so daydreamy about it, and that's what I liked.

If you're a romantic, this one's for you and you'll probably get a little emotional. If not, you'll walk away feeling like this was the most horribly predictable tearjerker ever. It's up to you.

title: Should have hated it...but...
review:
Everything about this film had the earmarks of what I can't stand in films. Tough, cool, James Dean type, hanging out with the wrong crowd, meets epitomy of virtue, and sways him to goodness through religion and her talent as a singer. Then the clincher...SHE'S DYING! And everyone gets together because of her and in her death there's a bright new day.

But dammit, it worked. The script was crisp, the cinematography and editing were superb, and the performances were first rate. And then there was Mandy Moore. I couldn't get my eyes off of Ms Moore, not because of her beauty, and that's undeniable, but her acting was star caliber. She took a part that was wide open to failure, and with skill and sincerity, triumphed. I was extremely impressed. I call this the Gilligan Phenomenom, where a hackneyed plot and mediocre scripting is eclipsed by stellar performances. This film falls into that category. For a film that was a hair away from being ridiculous, the results were surprising good.

title: the best
review:
I thought this movie was soooo beautiful!! everyone who hasn't seen it yet go and watch it because it's worth your time. Who knew that Mandy Moore was such a good actress after seeing this movie I was very impressed by her acting but her songs are very good as well that song Cry ooow soo beautiful I even cried at the end and that doesn't happen very often. It's such a shame that she hasn't breakthrough jet in the Netherlands because she is soo wonderful. Besides it's a good movie it has a great soundtrack as well. But really it doesn't happen that often that a teenage drama is soo good.

I loved it it's one of the best movies i've every seen.

title: My most absolute favorite movie!!
review: When I first heard that Mandy Moore was going to be in a movie based on a novel by Nicholas Sparks, I immediately ran out to buy the book. And I just couldn't put it down! It's a love story so much like the others, but so simple and real and sad that it somehow surpasses the rest. The movie gave me the exact same feeling. It's so simple, yet filled with so much emotion that you just have to watch it over and over again. Mandy Moore gives an unbelievable breakout performance as Jamie Sullivan and is so genuine and pure that you just can't help but love her. Shane West did a brilliant, totally believable job as a rebel whose life is turned around completely by this love that he has for Jamie. This movie makes me cry every time I watch it and not only because its sad, but because of the pure love in it. These two characters have such a chemistry that jumps right off the screen and into your heart. And seeing Shane West, one of the bad boys in Hollywood, cry uncontrollably in the arms of his father will get to you every time. I honestly recommend this movie to everyone and guarantee that everyone will come out with this wonderful feeling AND...about a box worth of wadded Kleenex!!!

title: cool movie
review: This is a great movie. Everyone should go see it. I love it. I own it. Go Watch It! Everyone will love it. If you see or own this I recommend going or getting The Prince&Me. I own that one too. They are both alike. and I also recommend 13 Going on 30, and 50 First Dates. They are all so good. I love them all. Please go see or get them all. They are the best movies ever. They are the bomb of all movies. I hope you all go see them. I have A Walk To Remember on DVD. It's Full Screen. They are all romantic movies. All my family loves all them movies. I think everyone will love or like them cause I do. I really do. Go see them. they are good for kids. No Swear words in The Prince&Me

title: Awesome movie, weak ending
review: You have to be kidding me. I really started to love this movie as I watched it, it was an excellent love story/tragedy, and it made me very emotional for most of the 2nd half of the movie... and then came the ending. There was nothing wrong with performances, Moore and West are excellent, but they cannot save the last 5 minutes of the movie. For those of you who haven't seen this movie, expect something very anticlimactic. For those of you who have seen it, there was a possibility for closure that was probably filmed but left out. It's obvious that everyone in the movie can pull off what would be needed to seal the deal, so why not? I can easily compare "A Walk To Remember" with a video game where you are totally hooked, but after a few hours the game randomly says "you win" and shows the end credits. Cut the last 5 minutes off of the end of the film and leave it to my imagination... 10/10. As is, 5/10 for a cop-out finale. Very disappointing overall.

title: I love it!!
review: I love this movie. I'm watching it all the time. 6 or more times a day. Shane West and Mandy Moore are great. My friend loves this movie too. We both think that Shane West is super, great, handsome, perfect and his voice is ........ how to describe it...... beautiful!! Mandy Moore is very good too, she's very good actress and of course singer also. This film shows us that you don't have to be super, beautiful girl to someone fall in love with you. It also shows us that love comes sometimes very unexpected and sometimes for someone who you always thought that you wouldn't ever fall in love with. You can't control your feelings when you love someone, you can't be afraid to show them. That's what this film is to me, what it shows me....

title: Get a box of tissues ready
review: the first half of this film contains everything that a chick flick lover wants. Rebel popular guy (Shane West grrrr) falls for church going nerdy type (Mandy Moore). Then tragedy strikes and you find yourself shouting noooooooo - you want it to carry on it the same way that it started but unfortunately it doesn't. If you don't reach for the box of tissues by the end of then there's something wrong with you! Shane West is sexy and all the blokes will love Mandy Moore. The music isn't too bad either and in case not many people know Shane West's band do a song on the Soundtrack. Also if you want lots of extras then the DVD is for you too

title: Simply Moving!
review: This is one movie not to miss. From what i've known its a very non-descript movie. But I saw it very recently on HBO and its simply a great movie. The performances are so moving that it almost brought a tear to my eye. A very vivid portrait of what a true love story can be like is shown with good expertise. Also backed by a decent background score and a movie soundtrack. Shane West appears at his arrogant best in the movie. And Mandy Moore as the simple small town belle is very convincing. A very moving love story with such varied emotions throughout. A very nice movie to watch on a quiet Sunday afternoon with someone really special. Must watch at least once!

title: Pretty decent
review:
The thing I liked most about this movie was Mandy Moore's character, Jamie. This may sound odd to most people, but she is a perfect model of the kind of girls I always thought were the sexiest and coolest in high school. Old fashioned, religious, conservative, pretty, quiet, intelligent, constructive and active in extra activities, I was in love with 'Jamie' for the entire film.

The drama is somewhat predictable but that's ok. Landon drives an awesome early Chevy Camaro, and it is cool to see Jamie being driven around in that beautiful car. There's a few typical scenes of the "cool kids" pulling a mean prank, making fun of people, the reformed kid turning sides, and more cliches you'd know this film would have. But still, it's a decent hearttugger and the song Mandy sings during the play is very good.

title: almost perfect , some weaknesses though .
review: hello !!! I'm amina(Sarah lyna); 23 years old , a post-graduate student preparing a master degree in American Literature , a writer, teacher of foreign languages and music in my spare time .I've seen the movie 6 times , and I've cried as much all the times I've seen it. I've noticed a touch of realism in the movie , but there are instances where we feel 'surrealism' as well as , illogic incidents . There 's , for instance , a sudden love for Jamie on the part of Landon . He knows her from the primary school , and it's only at the end of the academic year(at high school ) that he speaks with her . There should be a gradual love , especially given the fact that , together with his friends, he constantly pokes fun at her . As regards acting , Shane West was better than Mandy Moore(especially concerning his facial expressions) ! The latter , however , was excellent at singing , especially while performing ONLY HOPE , which I found a very nice 'ballade'. The music of the movie , in general , was harmonious with the scenes and the events . I think that in this romance ; it would have been better to include the scene of Jamie's death for she's the very person who changed Landon's life .Without this scene, the movie seems lacking something important in its plot. That's briefly what I wanted to say about the movie . If you'd like to discuss more about it with me ,

title: This movie was the best!!!!
review: This movie "A Walk to Remember" is the best movie I've ever seen. I watched it over end over again. From now on, this is my favorite movie of all time. The love in this movie is overwhelming. I wish love like that existed in real life. The actors played the roles perfectly, having no flaws at all. The story was one of the greatest ever told in a motion picture. Again, I have never seen a better movie. The director must be so proud of the movie they created because it is just so spectacular. I have always loved Shane West movies, but the particular one takes the cake. The soundtrack in this movie is so beautiful and touching. Just listening to the music itself, especially the Mandy Moore songs, makes you want to cry.

title: A very pleasant film
review:
I have just seen this on DVD and would like to add my comments to those already placed.

I rarely cry at a film; however this is one that I do not mind admitting to crying at. I felt that the film was very tender, quiet and sensitive, as surely the plot requires. I felt the acting was more than apt for the quality required: if anything the cast were let down by a, perhaps, stilted script, which could explain the `jumpy' stages of the relationship.

I have read a few negative comments here and would like to say that not all movies have to break the `expected', that is if the plot is a well worn one, why does it have to be different? Why can it not just be another pleasant story around a previously done outline? Why for a change can the `bad guy' not change in to a good guy: it does happen! Why is it when this happens some people do not see it for the value that it brings? Something to hope for at least.

This film is certainly entertainment value on its own merits and is pleasurable to watch and definitely worth a look at.

title: This is a PHENOMINAL movie.
review:
I love watching movies. I love em, I love em alot.

This is possibly THE BEST LOVE STORY I have EVER seen.

As far as performances and storytelling, this was top notch for a low budget film without super well known stars.

I have never heard of Mandy Moore before this film, and I didn't even see this film at the theatres. I came across it by chance.

I was blown away. Very good writing, very good performances.

The few routine elements that were easily foreseen were minor and blended well together in here. This is far from a standard teen love story.

This is a story that should be a classic. I would place it in the same category as Casablanca...something very romantic and tear jerking at the same time...but for a newer generation.

As far as pop-stars performing in films, when you add all the Britney Spears, Whitney Houston's, Madonna's, Mariah Carey's, Hilary Duff's and everybody else, Mandy Moore certainly supercedes them with her role this movie.

This is the best teen movie I have ever seen and also one of the best I have come across in general. This topped Titanic for any romantic quality.

The casting was fantastic and setting was also superb.

This movie is certainly worth the price tag that it is billed and would recommend it for either a date movie or for just viewing on your own for any age group.

As for Mandy Moore's musical career, I don't care for her work, but her performance here is of high calibur and believe that she should stick to film rather than trying to be the next Britney Spears.

Infact Britney should be taking acting tips from Mandy Moore. This script had such depth that even I cried...and that NEVER happens.

title: A Movie for anyone with a Heart
review: No matter how many times I see this movie, I never grow tired of it or don't watch the whole movie. I actually listened to parts of the movie while I worked around the house. SOMETHING told me to tape this movie and watch it in it's entirety. I feel the movie seldom lags and keeps your attention if, for no other reason, you must find out what Jamie and Landon are heading for. Surely the outgoing, popular and free spirited Landon will bypass Jamie eventually. But it never happens. That's because Jamie & Landon share an unknown common ground brought on by the fact that they have known each other and been in the same class since Kindergarten. I feel Jamie has had her eye on Landon for a big part of her life and she wants to get to know him better. Landon, on the other hand, sees no need to know her and be put out of the in crowd. He is satisfied with his life as a loose footed free spirit. Jamie says things that Landon is both curious about and even enamored by. She is very down to earth and she slowly leads Landon down "her" path. Plain but still a beautiful person, Jamie unveils a new her when singing her song in the school play. Remember, SHE wrote it. You can see Landon falling over himself in his attentive looks and feelings as Jamie sings "The song". I find it to be beautifully sung and wonderfully choreographed. Jamie has tipped the scales by being herself and Landon and even some of his friends sees a glamorous and outright drop dead beauty singing her true feelings. Landon wastes little time attempting to be with Jamie again. His remark "I can't just be your friend" tips his hand and leads him to her with no regrets. This movie deserves universal credit for the scenes and music continually fitting the mood. I have watched the movie 25 times or more and purchased the soundtrack. "Only Hope" is a fitting title for her song because it explains so much about the two of them needing this relationship. The movie never tries to make Jamie look hot or sexy. She remains herself but her inner beauty comes out more in every scene. The Wedding is the culmination of alot of misunderstood relationships made stronger by the bond between Bride and Groom. It is still the most well done and beautiful wedding scene I have ever witnessed. They arrive at the altar sure of their Love no matter how long they have to share it. I'm a 56 year old male who thinks this movie will go down as one of the most underrated movies ever. I never heard of Mandy Moore and consider her acting in stride with some of the big names. It's a near perfect movie with a wonderful and lasting conclusion. I want to share this movie with the special people in my life. It's a "really feel good" movie. I rate it a 10 (or higher).

title: A movie that lifts you up with every scene
review: As disappointed as I am to see the so called "experts" comments (those who review movies as a living), I can only say it's one of the best I've ever seen. With a Moral and Spiritual background, it shows how a "Plain Jane" can win over anyone who is willing to take the chance to know her and believe both in her and in what she believes. Excellent acting with wonderful scenes, topped off by the most beautiful Wedding scene I have ever witnessed. It leaves you drained, sad and yet happy. I have watched it numerous times and it gets better every time. I love a good high school movie and this one tops them all. It really has substance. I give it an A+. Well done to all.

title: Not Another Teen Movie
review:
I don't usually like this type of movie. That is, the teenage romance that tries to have underlying messages about how we all have a soulmate and that these two people are very lucky because they have found each other so early and now if they'd just realize it.

The premise is something you would see on Lifetime if you had chosen to stay home instead of going to the theater. In essense, the plot is the same as everything you see on made for TV movies but the plot is not what's so special.

Both Mandy Moore and Shane West giving either career best or career making performances. They take the cheap story thrown at them and they develop a chemistry between their different characters that people of all ages can appreciate.

I read the book about year after having seen the movie and I still think they did a good job adapting the novel. The movie contains all the needed parts of the book and does not drastically change anything. The humor in the book is tossed out in favor of a more somber and serious tone but that's good because it helps to set it apart from all other teen movies.

***/****

title: This movie is the first that ever made me cry since Titanic
review: Of all the movies I have watched, not one has ever made me cry since Titanic. This one did. A Walk to Remember is one of the best films I have ever seen in years. A simple love story that is based upon the book by Nicholas Sparks(even the book made me cry). This is certainly not a movie to miss. It will touch everyone's hearts with the true meaning of love. Shane West and Mandy Moore did a great job in the film.I've waited so long for a movie like this. It'll make you want to watch it again and again(I watched it 11 times so far). I promise that no matter how many times you watch this movie, you will never get bored of it like you do with other movies. This movie changed my life and I will always remember it as the best movie I ever saw!

title: Beautifully Done
review:
A Walk to Remember is a beautiful romance story about how two high school teens, total opposites of each other, find love.

Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore) is the minister's (Peter Coyote) daughter, a sweet, "good" girl who has very few friends and only wants to live life the best she can. Landon Carter (Shane West) is a hot teen in Jamie's school who gets in trouble and is sentenced to doing community service. When Jamie agrees to help him with his lines for the school play, they learn to find love and friendship...but Jamie has a terrible secret, and soon it threatens to tear them apart forever.

This story about love and faith was excellent, although it doesn't quite follow the book written by Nicholas Sparks. If you like love stories with some drama, I highly recommend it.

title: I seriously was crying...
review: This movie was AWESOME!!One of my best friends in 8th grade told me about this movie and how is it was so awesome. So I rented it and went through two boxes of Kleenex that night!!! Mandy Moore gives a touching performance and Shane West is totally hot!!I loved it so much I went out and bought it cause it was so great. This movie should be added to the "1,001 Movies You Need To See Before You Die" list.  Yes, boys, it is a chick flick. But this is a movie to watch with your girlfriend on a Friday night date, and REALLY watch together. You will discover many new things about your relationship. The book was okay, but I think the movie was better. The book was a little hard to follow because it's pretty different than the movie. But still, I give it a 10/10

title: A warm and natural romantic movie.
review:
Shane West stars as the local playboy, Landon, the popular guy, who has some moral issues and is quite a bad boy, he messes up from the start and is forced to take extra special classes, sort of a community service for his wrongs, here he gets to know the geeky and unpopular Jaime (Mandy Moore), at first Landon refuses to talk to her and avoids her at all costs, but slowly Jaime gains on Landon..

The geeky girl inspires the popular guy for a 180 degree change, the stereotype hollywood story have its prints on this movie, but compared to all the other teen movies now a days this movie is after all different, it does not try to be funny with stupid jokes, it's natural and realistic and deals with more than just love, there are many other things to be considering in this movie, there's a lot of moral questions which are put up to question, but this movie is very warm and is told with great patience.

The strength of this movie is definetely that it tries to be a serious romantic movie that will make you feel and think rather than the usual dumb crap that Hollywood spits out, there is never any doubt this is a Hollywood story, but it still manages to engage it's viewer and i must admit i at several times were at the verge of dropping a tear, or even two.

The cast is very well done, shane west and mandy moore have a great chemistry througout the movie, and i think it's good to see that Mandy Moore can more than just sing, but actually also act, multi talent i guess, at least she does a fine job in this movie.

Now one thing i really loved about this movie as well was that it does not rush into romantic sequences, i loved all the weird small moments where Landon tries to act cool towards Jaime, especially the scene in the bus where he's a cold hearted b*****d i liked, it's good to see that it had no rush reaching it's initial goal.

Now as i made this sound all very well, and it is a good movie, but there are some flaws which i kinda disliked, for a starter i think it all became a lil bit typically hollywood when everybody made up with their wrongs towards each other and it ended with everyone happy and smiling, and the end is also a pretty poor attempt on making the perfect ending, in my opinion it should have ended with Shane West's voice over while looking at the fall weather.

However, even though this movie has it's parts of typical hollywood scripts, it also has many parts where it stands out, and among them are the story itself, i think this is one one of the better romantic movies from USA lately, it's nice to see that not all romantic movies have to be dumb now a days, that there still is a market that focuses on touching ones heart, so even though many parts of this movie has been seen before, i can not deny that it touched my heart a lot, and it was a very moving and well told story, i think it should have a lot of credit for that. lately it's not many movies that really can touch my heart i think, but this did a fine job doing that, which is brilliant, i love it when a movie reaches inside.

8/10

title: It was great!
review: i thought this movie was great! it is one of my alltime favorites. Shane West is soooo hot and made a good couple with Mandy Moore. i just love it and the song cry. My favorite part is when Landon and Jamie go on a date. it was really romantic. i also loved when landon defends jamie when his "friends" make a poster of her that says virgin mary. i thought what he did was totally right. the guy deserved it. if i would rate this movie i would give it a 10(excellent). i loved everything but the ending. i think that it should not end with jamie dying. it should end with them living happily ever after. if they would change that, the movie would just be the best.

title: Sentimental and it feels good.
review:
I read a lot of critics' reviews of this movie and noted that most of the critics hated it. They cited the flaws of the movie as its over-sentimentality, its predictable plot, its implausible characters, and its lack of sex. All I can say is what an awful life to be a movie critic. If a movie can only be good without sentimentality or with sex in it, then we have truly descended into a dark hole as a society. Only those moviegoers hardened by relentless violence and cheap thrills on-screen can possibly be said to be completely lacking in sentiment, and those viewers will not like this movie. This movie IS sentimental, and without apology. In the end, it is how a movie makes you FEEL that counts the most, and A Walk to Remember will make you feel something - it will make you feel GOOD! It's a good story, a heartwarming story, with some pathos added. It may very well clear your tear ducts, and hopefully that is nothing of which we need to be ashamed.

Some viewers may find the plot somewhat predictable, and in one way the movie is reminiscent of 1970's Love Story (which the critics back then lambasted as well, but the public loved it). As for implausible characters - who among us cannot relate to these characters? Every high school in America has its `in-crowd' and its social outcasts. Too often a high school student can either be popular or studious, but not both. This movie is the touching story of two young lives that manage to build a love across the chasm between the two social orders, and they do it with dignity, respect, charm, and a tenderness that we should all wish we had shown in our high school days. Shane West and Mandy Moore do a very creditable job of portraying the main characters. This movie has flaws - chief among them being the overabundance of the various forms of the word `sh#t.' Also, in the interest of keeping the movie in the usual time frame, as well as keeping the story moving along, the transformation in Landon as he spends time with Jamie is compressed to a couple of short scenes. This area might have been expanded without injury to the movie overall, but I think most viewers understand the necessary time compression in a movie.

Overall impression: This movie is a breath of fresh air. The actors are true to their characters, and the characters are heartwarming and real. A very touching film. 9/10

title: A movie to remember
review: This movie is one of the best films I have ever seen. I would recommend this movie to anyone who doubts Moores  acting ability. Mandy Moore shines in the spotlight, and Is a natural in front of the camera. Shane West is the perfect leading man. This movie will make you laugh, cry, and smile all at the same time. Adam Shankman is a great director and really brings Nicholas Spark's novel to life. The one good thing I like about this movie is even though she's a preacher's daughter It's not a religious movie, It's about a boy finding faith, faith in himself, and a girl questioning hers when she comes face to face with it. It is just an all around excellent movie. Definitely a movie to remember.

title: What a movie!!
review: I as well spoke negative about this movie, just for the fact that Mandy Moore was in it. The whole "teeny boppers" in movies just turned me off. I caught it the other day on HBO after numerous co-workers (mainly guys) told me that it was a great movie. And I must admit, I under estmated Mandy's acting. I thought this was a great movie. I can't wait to run out and add it to my DVD collection. The plot and all was great. I cried the last hour of the movie. What a tear jerker, but I highly recommend seeing this movie. I wish I could go into details, but that would give away the movie! A must see with the girls or your signifant other. Great movie, good acting. A++++++++++++, two thumbs up and 10 stars!!  SEE IT!!

title: Oh my gosh, it wasn't nearly as bad as I thought it would be
review:
Whoa... it was not half as bad as I thought it would be. Knowing it was slammed by critics I thought I was in for a really sappy cliched movie. And it was sometimes, but not nearly as bad as I thought it would be. Mandy Moore was not annoying in her first role as Jaime Sullivan, neither was Shane West. So despite some very cliched teen moments, this movie is worth a look, if only once. Plus, I watched the movie first so that affects this. But for those who are like me and watched the film first, READ THE BOOK afterwards. Movie was ok, but book was GREAT.

Movie: 7/10 Book: 10/10

title: Emotional Outlook on Two Teenage Lovers - Spoilers
review:
The movie "A Walk to Remember" tells an interesting and emotional narrative. It is based on the 2002 novel by Nicholas Sparks and was released that same year as a film. Both the author and the director, Adam Shankman, want their audience to understand that there are horrible events which happen in life. People need to believe and retrieve all good thoughts of bad mishaps. A tagline of "A Walk to Remember" is `It all comes down to who's by your side, Look at every event in life as a miracle always wanted.' This film had opened my eyes to different opinions. The narrative of this movie tells a romantic love affair between two young lovers. The movie of "A Walk to Remember" takes place in North Carolina, where two teenagers named Landon Carter (Shane West) and Jaime Sullivan (Mandy Moore) fall in love after he gets in trouble and is made to do community service. Landon is the type of guy who makes fun of Jaime; she is the type of girl who would do anything for him. Landon asks for Jaime's help to perform well in the spring play. Little did he know he was going to fall head over heels for Jaime: he did not see it coming. The practices went on, and the play was being presented to the school. Jaime had been playing a singer for Landon in the play, and he had looked as if she had weakened his whole body.

At the end of the play, he kissed her in front of the entire school. Landon then decided to ditch his cool but rude and heartless friends for everlasting love with Jaime. There was a problem when Landon and Jaime started to go out because her father was the Reverend. He did not care for Landon in the beginning. Jaime had sadly broken bad news to Landon that she had cancer. She did not know how much longer she had to live. He was heartbroken, but stuck by Jaime's side the whole way. Landon had given Jaime her dreams. They were married by her father. She had died three months later. Landon will never forget Jaime, the love of his life and the one who will always inspire him.

The movie "A Walk to Remember" is my favorite movie and I believe always will be. I believe that the story of this movie tells a beautiful narrative of two young teens falling in love. I love romantic movies, but that is not the only reason I love this movie. I think Mandy Moore performed a wonderful role of playing Jaime Sullivan. This story is very unique because a popular boy falls in love with a not-so-popular girl. This idea makes this film very exciting to me. Love will be able to happen to any two people who feel something special between them.

title: Different, but touching
review: I read the book first, not before the movie came out, but before I saw the movie. I have to say it was quite different. Not bad different though, actually it was a great different. The plot was very well down and very sweet, just loosely based. Mandy Moore is so excellent in this part and Shane West shows a side he never portrays. The soundtrack is very good, with songs from Switchfoot and the staring actress herself, Mandy Moore. Overall this is an wonderfully done, beautiful film. A Romance and a tear jerker. It's like a less wet Titanic. Love it!

title: beautifull movie
review: This movie touches your heart as no movie else can. It shows the changing power of love. West and Moore make a lovely chemistry. What could be more romantic than 2 young students totally different falling in love? specially when one of them is going to die and the other would change all for her.Besides you can see the importance of the father-son relationship, the wonderfull voice of Mandy and just how perfect she is.

title: Marvellous!
review: This movie is a touching story told in a very romantic way.I must say I almost cried at the end.A high school "Mr.Cool" gets into trouble when nearly killed his schoolmate by misleading him to high-jump in shallow water.The penalty for his levity meets him with the puritan daughter of the local Father.When getting to know each other they fall into love that's deep and pure - something that never happens with their coevals.As their love keeps growing everything seems perfect.A perfect love story but also dramatic rising of the characters to reveal how love can change people to good.

title: Actually Good
review: This Movie was very  Good i Only wanted to Watch it Because Mandy Moore was in it and i  liked her in The princess Diaries. Well  She was fantastic and So was Shane west they really  made an impression. I loved this movie and i cried in the end i don't normally cry in movies. Well i give it a 10/10

title: ExcellentÃ©!
review: This an excellent movie which touched me!!! Just a great movie! Totally recommend this to all you softies! Hihi, you people might not like this movie if you are into more horrors etc. This is more of a romantic and dramatic movie! But I LOVED IT! Kun

title: A Great Christian Romance
review: I loved this movie because it is the first movie I've ever seen that I would categorize as a Christian Romance.  The two teens in this movie are so beautiful and work very well together.  I think this is a must see inspirational film.

title: the best drama i have ever seen
review: the first time a walk to remember came out, i myself was very skeptical about the movie being good. i thought that the movie was going to be so boring. i didnt see any type of significant plot. i thought it was going to be another "teen love drama". then, my mom's friend let me borrow the dvd after like 4 months of the release of the dvd (i know...i am very late on movies).i popped it in cuz i had nothing better to do and to my surprise, it was extremely good. no movie has ever made me cry that much. after like 10 minutes of the movie being done, i was still sitting there crying my eyes out. mandy moore is such a good actress and a wonderful singer in the movie and was very convincing. her and shane west make a great duo and convinced me 100%. i could watch this movie 10,000 times and every time i watch it, it still makes me cry. it's a movie that deserves every kind of academy award possible. no other movie can compare to it and i still get this weird feeling in the pit of my stomach every time i see it. everyone rent...no BUY the movie!!!

title: Finally, a romantic teen drama.
review: I have watched A Walk to Remember too many times to count and every time I watch it, it's so touching and enjoyable. The movie is based around two different social standing people who begin to fall in love. Shane West and Mandy Moore play the leading roles as two teenagers who ultimately fall in love. From all the movies I've seen with Shane West in it, this is his most powerful role yet as he fits the character he plays and he just seems right for the part. Mandy Moore has made a breakthrough with this movie as I'm sure a lot of girls can relate to Mandy Moore's character. (Jaime) If other people were chosen for the leads in this movie, I don't think that their performances would have been as powerful as Shane West and Mandy Moore as they seem to have a really good relationship on and off screen and it shows in their performance. This is my favorite movie as it teaches teenagers about real life and the obstacles throughout life. It is also just a really romantic teen drama that can be watched over and over again and always be enjoyed.

title: Some tearjerker with a **spoiler**
review: I saw this movie with a guy that was a guy friend that didnt want to see this movie. Plus he set his watch an hour ahead so that we would have to leave the theatre so i would make it home in time. We left after the first 15 mins and i did want to see what happened. I waited till it came on movie and rented it waiting to see what happened between west and moore. **SPOILER**  I could not believe that she had cancer after all she was the preachers daughter, and it didnt seem to be able to happen to her. But to be completely honest with you, i cried when they got married and knew that she dying. i found it so sad that after all she had been through that she wouldnt be able to truly live on her own and experience the world how she wanted to. i found it cute that he filled all that was on her list and couldnt believe she could turn bad boy/popular crowd into a sap that wanted to look for stars in the graveyard. i found that really stupid. i thought there were some moments which were predictable and pointless to the movie, which is why i didnt grade this one as a good movie, but as an average movie. mandy moore did do a good job though in her first starring role, but she didnt have me fooled when she was all goody-goody and that was a minus for me. (B- C+)

title: A Surprise
review: After debating on to buy this or not, I finally went ahead and took the plunge. As it starts , I sit there going naaa....then the pick gets a better--then the bombshell hits when Mandy Moore says something that for those who never saw, I will not spoil. Despite what happens the ending gives a uplift and you see you 1 event can make you a better person. And for that reason I gave it it 8 out of 10.-magictrain California

title: Uncomfortable for a Good Reason
review:
One minor spoiler

Considering the junk you see in movies now-a-days, I place this one at the top of the list for anyone to watch as far as young love stories go. I was impressed with Mandy Moore's performance and the rest of the cast. The setting was impressive as well. It was overall a nice, wrapped up, predictable picture. There were however, a few flaws I found with this movie. Like others, I haven't read the book so I don't have the accuracy or the comparison to draw off from. I think that they plopped her illness in at such a bad time. It was like "lets set these two different people together, get them to fall in love then BAM! lets make her sick so he can really appreciate her, then lets go into mush overdrive". There wasn't any hint of her illness to me, so I felt that it could have been handled better.

I found the morality of this movie a rarity but wonderful to see. I've watched this movie more than once and I feel the same unease I feel afterwards. This movie showed me that we should treat people like bowls of water filled to the brim. Handle with care. Don't assume. Be kind. This movie was uncomfortable for a good reason.

title: More Peer Pressure
review:
It's pretty good, with some draggy spots and the predictable outcome. It would be a good film for family night (WARNING: some swearing, slight violence) with teens/pre-teens, as it would give you a good starting point to talk about peer pressure and the junk that can go on in schools. Beaufort was a lovely background for the film. I'm surprised that more filmmakers do not use the Carolina coast more often.

One "goof" in the film was the post-date trip to the Virgina border. The movie implied that they did that the same night of the first date, but for them to just reach the border would take at least 2 hours (or longer) ONE WAY. I don't think the Reverend would have been too pleased to have his daughter back home after 2 am.

title: Book is better.
review:
This is an extremely boring remake of the wonderful book, "A Walk

To Remember" by Nicholas Sparks. Mandy Moore and Shane

West are decent in their roles, but there is little here for them to act

do, actually. The movie actually takes very little material out of the

book, so the two barely resemble each other. If the movie had

stayed true to the book, it could have been a real winner. Sadly,

this piece of tripe falls flat.

title: Though I might not remember it, it was still pretty good
review:
I doubt it will go down as a memorable film (unless Mandy Moore becomes a huge hollywood actress..and even then maybe not)it was pretty good.

Now I'm a guy so I hate chick flicks with a passion. But this one was tolerable for me. I thought it took some cheap shots like with the cancer thing and the marriage...but hey its a great movie to watch with your girlfriend because you'll look all sensitive and its filled with cute girls so the guys won't be disappointed.

Mandy Moore is really good though...she may just have a future in this. The only thing bad about her performance was that she upstages everyone else. I think the movie itself serves more as proof that Mandy Moore can really act, since the plot and script didn't offer much but she did a lot with it. Plus Mandy is good looking, but not in an over done hollywood way.

all in all a chicks film (gets a 5 thats high for a chick flick). But hey Mandy gots potential

title: I hated it.
review:
This is the worst movie I have ever seen. The plot is so boring and

treads along slowly. Mandy Moore is not really that much of an

actress in this film at least, all she seems to do is stand there

while her lips quiver. It's a terrible romance movie and nothing

exciting happens. I guess it might be good for a sleepover......or

maybe a cereal box promo....whatever!!

title: Faithful Finale
review:
Shane and Mandy are very different people and the play allows them to retain their individuality while faling in love. Shane becomes a romantic and her response is careful. The thread which weaves their lives together is his becoming the kind of giving person she already is - he is forced into a new way of living - she is already there. I think this kind of positive tale is something possible for a lot of people who might consider similar changes to their fairly useless lives.

The ending lacks being overdramaticized and lets those involved show their best. This is a really enjoyable film.

title: Pleasant surprise
review: My sister had bought "A Walk To Remember" on video a few months ago, and I sat down to watch it today, thinking it would be a predictable, mindless teen movie. But I was completely wrong. " A Walk To Remember" is a beautiful film, helped enormously by amazing performances from Mandy Moore and Shane West. Moore in particular is so tender and sweet in every scene she's in, it was a real change to the image of a Britney-type-teen pop star that I had (wrongly) had in my mind. The beautiful North Carolina locations added to the pleasure of watching the movie, and there were many tear-jerking scenes towards the end, most notably the final wedding scene and the moment when Landon visits the Reverend four years later. A lovely film, and certainly more than the teen movie people might think of it as.. I'd recommend it for all ages.

title: Worth watching if you like that sort of thing
review: If you are into trashy american high school stories (TAHSS) then this is definitely one to watch. If you aren't then don't - simple as that - don't expect it to be anything other than what it is, as some commenters have moaned about in their reviews. Teenwolf, St. Elmos Fire, Back to the future (etc) it is, War and Peace it aint. Personally i loved it (even at 32 years old!) - the twist to the story was a nice touch, though the ending was a bit predicatble once you knew Overall a nice TAHSS.

title: Great book ... movie not too bad!!
review:
I got this DVD out because I read the book years ago and loved it and while I did enjoy this movie, (a nice easy watch and I was pleasantly surprised by how good Mandy Moore was. The other main cast members, Peter, Darryl and Shane were in fine form as well) the storyline suffered a little in the transition to the screen...

Potential SPOILER ****

The movie sidestepped a number of points in the book which I think made it so poignant - for example, the significance of the play to Jamiee and her father (re: her mother and their faith)- the angel being sent as a sort of saviour to the man in the play, just as Jamiee became Landons saviour, and he became hers, when Jamiee states she'll pray for Landon - in the book like she also prayed for him to come to her, so that she could experience love before she died; Jamiee helping with Landon's lines and his walking her home, and becoming involved in her fundraising for the orphanage is where in the book he learnt a great deal more about Jamiee (and himself) and began to fall in love - hence the title a walk to remember!

Regardless, I have to say I still think it was a sweet story and worth checking out for that wintery afternoon of video watching.

title: Everything I'd heard was true...
review: Yes, it's predictable. Yes, it's unoriginal. Yes, there are plot holes you could drive a truck through. You know what? It still gets me every time. Mandy Moore is surprisingly charming and there are some sweet lines sprinkled in among the goofiness. A total guilty pleasure that makes me cry every time.

title: I thought there was something wrong with me after i saw this...
review: I had gotten such good recomendations for this movie that i rushed out to get it. Then i saw it and it was bad. Shhane West looked mad during the whole movie even when he was happy. The whole falling in love thing was not believable. And it did have some of its good points. But the whole bad kid image was lost on me...Really the only bad thing he did was some stupid thing in the beginning and and i just really did not like it...

title: Hopeless romantics
review: AWTR would be my favorite romantic movie. I am one for tragedies, and this hits the spot. I think really anybody could fall in love with it. Mandy Moore actually can act, and did beautifully. She'll go far. Shane West is so adorable as Landon Carter! He made the movie. Now both of them together as a couple is perfect. Any hopeless romantics out there should watch this film...

title: Meaningful movie
review: I saw this not knowing what it was about and hardly a fan of Mandy Moore or Shane West (in fact I didn't know who he was until then). And I was shocked. This movie was wonderful. Sure, it probably didn't have a huge budget and there were many mistakes, but the meaning outweighed it all. I highly recommend it. :) Both Mandy Moore and Shane West did a fanastic job, as well as the rest of the cast.

title: A "good boy gets good girl" story.
review:
On the one hand, this could have resulted in yet another tiresome rehashing of that commonly favored old myth, in which a plain but sincere "good" girl transforms the handsome but loutish "bad" boy through the greater strength of her faith, kindness and patience. Although "christianism" is not precisely the point, Christians will love it, because it addresses all the transformational desires that Christians and co-dependents both find appealing. On the other hand, the "bad" boy is not all that bad. He has made some poor friendship choices, and tries to live down to their expectations, but he also has some clearly redeemable qualities.

That is what saves this from being just another "good girl gets bad boy" story. Even while he tries to "pretend" that he is one of the bad boys, he knows enough to do the right thing. He has a conscience that keeps coming back to trouble his thoughts, and hence it is not so much a problem of transforming "him," but bringing out what is already there. The message of the film is not that just "any" sort of lout can be improved, given suitable conditions, but that if he is already "sitting on the fence," so to say, then the right sort of girl might be able to give him the push he needs. She does in this film, and it results in a beautiful and poignant romance.

title: Excellent, didnt expect it to be so good!
review: From the opening scene until the final ending you are glued to your seat and are woundering how it is going to end.  Ok, so there are a few bits that you think to yourself "been there-seen that", but the way the film comes together will leave you fully entertained. Trust me watch it!

title: First romantic movie I have ever seen is the best romantic movie I have ever seen!
review: This movie is absolutely wonderful...Im an 18 year old guy and I have never really seen a love story movie, my fave types of movies are usually sci-fi and action movies, Honestly When I first started seeing this movie I didnt know what it was about, I thought it was some cheap teen flick. I actually didnt want to see it, But by the end of the movie I almost started crying. This movie is about one boys quest and one girls quest to discover one of the strongest emotions in life and that emotion is love. This movie is wonderful in so many ways, the story is sooo original, the inclusion of the religous aspect of the movie makes it soo much better and the characters who are polar opposites at the beginning of the movie know by the end of the movie that LOVE negates all opposites and makes everything so much BETTER. I actually felt all the emotions that the charcters felt as when Mandy is the social outcast and West gets rejected by his friends for falling for this social outcast. I realize how cruel the world is when I see this hatred and how West's former friends make their life miserable, yet throughout all this love still survives....I just dont have word to describe this movie....It is an absolute masterpiece....Mandy sings beautifully in this movie and this movie is filled with emotion that anyone can feel...More importantly its a story about ever perservearnt love in the most unlikely of places. The ending is quite a shocker and makes the story more heart warming and sad at the same time. But the love that those two had is certainly praise-worthy to say the least and this movie overall is a masterpiece. A classic movie dealing with the wonderful discovery of true love in the most unlikely form. In a word, WOW. See It, especially with a loved one. Its a perfect movie of love. SUPRAMAXX RATING - 9.5 out of 10

title: Best Film of its Time
review: This film was awesome, I am sorry but I totally do not agree with the other commenter. Mandy Moore played an awesome part and is an unbelievable actress.  Shane West also did a wonderful job.  My 11yr old sister was diagnosed with cancer and this movie totally hit home.  It was awesome.  I give it an A+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

title: I was totally surprised...I was blown away
review:
OK, let me first say that I am not the target audience for this movie. I'm 31, male, and try very hard to keep my emotions under wraps. It takes a very special movie to get any kind of real emotion out of me. In other words, I pretty much don't cry at movies. I saw A Walk to Remember on HBO last weekend. I put it on basically as background as I was working, but it totally sucked me in. By the end I was balling my eyes out.

I had previously dismissed it as a typical teen chick flick. But it's so much more. It's a story of how one person's life can completely alter another's life. It's a story about finding faith, finding love, and holding onto that love through life's toughest challenges.

Not to say that it's perfect. It certainly has its flaws (many of them, actually). But taken as a whole, it is one of those stories that can truly change you. As Landon says to his mother, "Jamie makes me want to become different, better" This movie does the same.

title: Get the DVD now!
review:
I was moved to tears when i first saw this film, i have seen this film about 5 times strangely enough, not because i totally wanted to see this film just for myself, but to show friends. I think each time I watch the film i notice little things that could be cut, and I think ultimately this movie leaves you feeling wonderful, but at the same time you get the feeling if they had took a some scissors and glue to the script and re-shaped it just one more time to make it a little bit more compact around the time Jamie(Mandy Moore) got sick the movie's pace would have felt a bit more even.

I thought the movie was coherent nonetheless, although after hearing alot of other peoples opinions, it seemed like it definitely could have had one more makeover, script-wise. Fortunately, the finished product is something that is worth having in your DVD collection for anyone into a moving story. The gentle pacing of the movie might put some people to sleep Ive noticed, but, as far as movie making goes, you can watch this one a couple of times if you want to appreciate a fairly even rhythm of direction and script goes about. Like the movie's title, the film "walks", and sometimes runs (to the heavens). Seeing Mandy wooed by Shane West reminds me of all the great things about relationships and this film is just a great thing to be reminded of the beauty of human life. Thats quite a nice thing for a movie to do this. Also on the DVD you will get to hear Mandy, Shane, and Adam Shankman do the commentary (there is another with Sparks and Janszen that I didnt have time for). The commentary was fun to hear, of course at this point if you're listening to the commentary on this DVD it means you are one of the few big fans (my guess at least). I would love to see another production with Shankman at the helm, and I hope we see more of West and Moore in future films.

title: The Best Ever Romance Ever
review: I think that this is the best romantic film that i have seen in a long time. It is just so devastating that just as they have both found their loved ones they have to lose each other. It broke my heart to see them get married knowing that they wouldn't be able to spend the rest of their lives together. But as he said he will always miss her, her love is like the wind he can't see it but he can feel it.

title: The best movie ever about faith and love
review: I've already comment about this movie before, but I had the chance to see it again, and I wanted to say a little more than the first time. This is definite my favorite movie and it's one of the best about faith and courage, it teaches you that you need courage to live and have faith that you're going to get whatever you dream about. This movie has opened my eyes, and now I see things different, I'm even going to start my own list of things I want to get done while I live (he,he). I think the director made a great job, because all the acting is great, specially Mandy and Shane, they had a great chemistry in the film and is one of the things that keeps your ayes on the screen. I have hope now that boys like Landon can change, but they need to be around the right people and of course, they have to want to change or it wouldn't work. I guess all I want to say is I loved this movie, even when it made me cry a lot!!!!!!

title: oh dear
review: this film manages WITH EASE to make my top 5 of the worst films i have ever seen. my goodness some ppl must be desparate for work to sink to those depths. could they have squeezed anymore corny lines into it if they'd tried?! more like a puke to remember

title: I think that everyone must see this film
review: This movie tells a great story.  I love it.  Every time I see it makes me cry.  Mandy Moore and Shane West are great.  I love how the characters display their nobility in the film.  Great Movie.  Everyone must see it! It has impacted me greatly, because these things happen in real life.

title: Teen Romance Par Excelance!
review:
But it's much more than that. It's also a story about faith.

I usually don't like chick flicks, but this has become one of my favorite movies of all time. Jamie and Landon (two people who could not be more different) fall in love. Okay, we've seem this much before. But there is much more to it.

Jamie is a person of deep faith. Landon has no faith, but gains some watching Jamie face crisis. I'm sure it was no suprise to find out that it's a tear jerker. Jamie faces a death to Leukemia, but never looses her faith.

There is a reason Shane West is listed first in the credits, even though Mandy's performance is clearly the one that sticks out. A Walk To Remember is LANDON's story and shows how he was effected by Jamie.

The writing was excelent, the performances perfect, and it was completely believable.

Compare this to Endless Love (a movie Brooke Shields did when she was just a little younger than Mandy) and you will see what I mean. Don't miss this one. You will regret it if you do!

title: This an awesome movie ~! ~! ~! ~!
review: I love this movie!!! Its one of my favorites even though it is predictable and a bit mushy at times its cute. And for everyone who thinks its about christianity its so not. Just because her dad is a reverend doesnt mean its a christian movie. Its also nothin like the book by Nicholas Sparks. The only thing that is the same is their names. I love Mandy Moore and Shane West and I think they make a very good couple and think they should date in real life. This movie also has an awesome soundtrack. I like everything about this movie.

title: the movie won me
review: I went to see this movie thinking it was going to be as bad as the other singers' movies (you know what movies I'm talking about). I was expecting to find a movie based in the story of a new singer... just a girl with lots of dreams that with a lot of luck gets a record deal and become a huge artist... but it's not. I really liked the fact that is based in a book. It's a real movie... you even get to forget that the main character is Mandy Moore... BUT: it's the typical movie for girls... it's a little sappy... so don't come to me saying I didn't warned you about this :P

title: Sweet Movie with a GREAT Moral Taught
review: Hey, maybe "A Walk to Remember" isn't perfect, but it sure got my emotional juices flowing.  I didn't go to see it in the theaters, even though I was interested, but I finally watched it when, by a fluke, my sister-in-law left it at our house.  I completely loved it!  I didn't expect much from Mandy Moore, but she excelled at this part and was able to fit the plain, awkward character very well.  Shane West is, of course, adorable, and his turn-around is very believable.  Not only is it a great movie for hopeless romantics like me, but it is a great movie because the girl doesn't make herself worse for the guy, but the guy makes himself better for the girl. There are so many horrible influences in this world, and the fact that this movie focuses on the GOOD influences is just awesome.  I do not normally cry at movies, but I was bawling by the time this one ended.  There are some very sweet moments, and while the "Only Hope" scene where she sings seems out of place, I thought it worked well.  For those who love good, old-fashioned coming-of-age stories without all the crap "teen movies" seem to incorporate, this movie is a must-see.

title: Mandy Moore she's perfect.
review:
I cry each time i watch this movie. I am 32 years old and this movie makes me cry everytime. Well the story is very decent and naive. Shane West is great actor but as far as Mandy Moore... well She's perfect. The script is great too. I guess we can all be better than who we are and i guess it's also easier when someone believes in us. I am not so lucky in my life and maybe that is why i shed tears every time i watch this movie.

Anyway, i do recommend this movie and not only for the good story in it but also for the great songs. My favorite scene is the one that in the year drama play she's changin into an amazing beautiful girl and not only that, she sings even better... AMAZING! Enjoy and if you already seen the movie and read my comment i hope i got thru.

Thanks, IKA

title: Brought some full on emotions out in me.
review: I watched this movie on the big screen early 2002, and just had to go out and purchase the dvd, it was that good! Mandy Moore is a truely beautiful actress and terrific singer. As alot of other people have said, the movie portrays a innocent somewhat old fashioned love story where two people come together, without all the modern influences of drugs, alcohol etc and turn each others world round with their each individual qualities.  It takes quite a movie to get me going, but this one surely did, highly recommend this if you are a romantic at heart..

title: A Movie to 'Remember'!
review: "A WALK TO REMEMBER" - Shane West, Mandy Moore, Daryll Hannah and Peter Coyote- ***1/2 out of **** -- "A Walk.." is the story of a girl who falls in love with a rebel. At first they don't but as the movie moves along they somehow fall in love. This movie really shocked me. I was expecting the stereotypical teen flick but i was suprised. This movie has heart. It is also depressing. Mandy Moore delivers an Awesome debut performance. Shane West is also incredible in this movie for all types of people.

title: Great movie!
review:
i've heard it all, go ahead and say what you will but this is a great movie. i love it! it is one of the few romance movies i enjoyed.

and to those who say "its a chick flick" it may be but swallow your pride and watch it. most guys forced to watch it by their g/fs like it...even if they dont want to admit it (you know who you are)

title: My Favorite Movie
review: I thought this is a terrific movie.  The story is great with a positive message.  There is a terrific song sung by Moore in the movie.  The acting and directing is great, too.  Very suprising since Moore is a singer.  I watched it twice in the theatre because I couldn't get enough of the beauty. I also thought it was refreshing to have the actress as the stronger and more mature character for a change.  Lastly, it is a movie all genders can enjoy because it's not a romantic or love story.  It is more a coming-of-age story and there are no cheesy lines.

title: THIS MOVIE IS A GREAT MOVIE, AND A REAL TEAR JERKER
review: I recommend this movie to everyone. It is not just another teen filick this movie actually has a story line and it is a very touching movie that even made my husband shed a tear. Mandy moore gives a awesome preformance she unlike other singers who try to act actually can. A must see!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Not at all what I expected.
review:
I wasn't intending to view this movie. I assumed it was just another vehicle for an up and coming pop diva. In fact when I tuned in to it, on the Movie Network, the opening credits had just past. I didn't realize what I was watching until I was hooked.

Mandy Moore gave a fantastic performance for her first lead. I was immediately captivated and awed by her presence. The story is a simple formula of unwanted love, opposites attracting, but as usual finds a way to blossom. I am glad I stumbled across this movie. It inspired me to purchased the sound track and I still consider it a favorite. I am looking forward to future endeavors by Miss Moore.

title: My all time fav
review: If anyone doesn't like this movie, that is their problem i think that it is the best love story i have ever seen i wish that i could find a guy that sweet and that i could have as much faith as Jamie she was really strong and i think everyone should at least try to be that strong once in their lifetime!

title: "Surprise, Surprise! Movie I was sure I would hate, I loved"
review:
There have been so many films made about teenage romance where we get the usual bland cliches and stock characters(boy from wrong side of tracks falls for nice girl or vice versa), that I had sincere doubts

about even watching this film. One of the greatest joys in movie

watching is finding a film you are sure you will hate, and discovering a true gem. A Walk To Remember is just such a movie. Sincere, honest, portrayals by Shane West and Mandy Moore elevate this film to a level where most movies of this type only dream of reaching. Not only is this a story of romance, it's a story of finding those things in life that are most important to us, and experiencing them to the

fullest while we can. Excellent performances, a great script that remains true to it's characters throughout and avoids the usual cliches and stereotypes the would certainly doom such a venture as this. If you're looking for an emotional ride, get out the handkerchiefs and enjoy! and watch this one!

title: Sad, but good movie
review:
I was expecting this movie to be like the classical teen movie, but it wasn't. Mandy Moore and Shane West performed great, they really have a connection and that helped to make the movie look real. Mandy Moore showed us that she can do very good things.

This movie is really sad and has a tragic end (if you want to know, watch the movie because I am not telling you.) It made me cry a lot (Did I say a lot???!!!) I give it *****.

title: Fantastic Performances by West & Moore
review:
Mandy Moore comes to this role with little in the way of acting experience. In fact, the screen credits actually list an "Acting Coach for Ms. Moore." She likely won't need one much longer; if her performance in this film is any indication, Moore has a promising career ahead. Every emotion she is asked to portray as her character, Jamie Sullivan, she does so stunningly. Watch Moore cry and see if you just don't want to reach through your TV screen and hug her. She's THAT good.

Shane West is every bit her equal in conveying emotion on-screen. They make a compelling couple, as West's bad boy character falls in love with the straight-laced reverend's daughter, played by Moore.

Teen girls will surely find this movie a real tear-jerker. If you're a sap for sad love stories, this movie is a winner. Even if you're not, delight in witnessing two very good young actors.

title: Good team work produced a great movie
review: As a 40 year old man, I have seen this movie 23 times -- in a week. I did not know who Mandy Moore was when I got the dvd. It touched me so deeply that in one day I watched it for 7 times. The performance of Mandy is a real surprise on me. The makeup and dress did make a beautiful Mandy to be an ordinary, plain looking girl who has a faith in God and confidence in herself. She was so believable and so real. I loved the movie not only by the two actor and actress but also the whole team. The screen writer did a good job to transform a novel -- verbal communication to be a movie which is a non verbal communication in a such of rewrite instead of substracting. Good job. Mandy's singing was great. I can not imagine if another young pop singer can do the same as Mandy did in this film. I can not say Mandy is perfect in the film neither Shane. But the chemistry between these two as professionals was great in this movie. I could not say enough about it. Now I became a big fan of Mandy.

title: A Walk To Remember, A Perfect 10
review:
Just to start I have to say that all the critics who gave this movie are way off the mark. They do make small but unrefined points. Every once in a while you get a critic that, excuse me, must have their thumb up their ass. I have read more than 316 different reports of A Walk to Remember. An overall rating that was given D+, 6.5/10, and 2.5 stars out of 5 stars. I have read articles by out-of-date critics who say stuff like Mandy Moore was only used to bring in an enormous fan-base. First off, you couldn't be more off. Using Brittany Spears for Crossroads was a, pardon me, big f***ing mistake. Brittany Spears has virtually no acting talent in comparison to Mandy Moore. Mandy Moore gave life to Jamie Sullivan. She portrayed the preachers daughter flawlessly. The chemistry between her and Shane West was amazing. They complimented each other in a way I haven't seen since Humphrey Bogart and Ingrid Bergman in Casablanca. The way you could see they worked off eachother like their first meeting when she goes to see him, working on his car. I won't deny it, the directing coices for the movie could have been better. Adam Shankman moved the movie along to fast. Not resting on any certain spots to let the movie really sink into maybe the younger audiences. I think that whomever decided to make the movie PG was correct for the box office sake. Although the movie only did 40 million at the gates, I believe the movie would not have done as well if the younger 10-12 year olds could not see it. The biggest flaw that I saw with the movie I noticed, as well as several tens-of-thousands of people, was not in the theaters. The major problem came with the DVD. If you watch the DVD with commentary from Mandy Moore, Shane West and Adam Shankman, you will hear Adam Shankman say there will be deleted scenes on the DVD. This proved to be very incorrect. For as much as twenty dollars at some stores for the movie, what you get is...

A Walk to Remember-Movie(Widescreen)----- I hate widescreen! A Walk to Remember-Commentaries(2) 1. Mandy Moore, Shane West and Adam Shankman 2. Novelist Nicholas Sparks and Screenwright Karen Janszen A Walk to Remember-Movie Trailer Mandy Moore Music Video of "Cry" "Very" Limited Actors Filmography

I do not believe that this was enough for the fans of the movie. I know I want to see the extra footage, outtakes and interviews with the cast and crew.I along with several thousands of people have begun petitions for completed versions of A Walk to Remember. We really want to see the deleted footage, behind the scenes, outtakes and the PG-13 version of the movie. Why Warner Bros. won't put it out is beyond me and again, several thousands of others.

title: a tale of a wild boy with wild ways and a young girl dying for three dreams to come true and only these two will help their dreams come true
review:
i thought this movie was amazing, it is truely a film that touched me deep

down inside, without going on i thought the two main lead characters were extremely great, miss mandy moore proved she is more then a pretty face with a beautiful voice she is an actress. and yet again shane west picked another great movie to star in (perhaps because he found out who the leading lady would be) i cried i laughed but most of all i felt what the characters were feeling. A beautiful film ,,,,if only there could be a sequel. I give you 10 out of ten for a job well done, if only people would stop making these teenage flicks. mandy moore did a beautiful job as a beautiful character. i congradulate you all

title: Favorite Movie
review: What a great movie. This PG rated movie was one of the bests i've seen in a while. I saw it 4 times in theatres, and god knows how many times out of the theatre. It is about a popular, sexy(ooo yes shane west is sexy) guy that becomes inspiried by the unpopular, reverends daughter, played by mandy moore. He falls in love with her, but there is a reason why he shouldn't have fallen as deep in love with her as he did... but it happens. He gives up all his friends for her, and the ending is very sad...this is one of the very few movies i cried while watching. if you havent seen it, go rent it...PLEASE

title: unexpected breakdown!
review: OK, I didn't expect anything from this movie, other than a bubblegum teenage romance.  All I have to say is this.... I was blubbering like a freakin' loonie!  I don't what the heck came over me, it just was a very human, personal story that touched me deeply.  I started laughing hysterically because I was crying sooo hard!!!  haha!  This one made me feel really good about life.

title: An unexpected gem
review:
***Outstanding film of it's genre***
