okay, that in itself may not be saying much, since it's genre, teen movies, are not exactly the breeding ground for trans-generation, gender-bridging classics.

the story is also nothing new. it doesn't break new ground in any way, there are no stunning revelations, it doesn't throw in any plot twists whatsoever.

however, i think that is what makes it an amazing movie. in spite of all those handicaps, Adam Shankman, who is well known for, well, absolutely nothing at all, has created a movie that will tug at your heartstrings, and affect you emotionally. that's all to it.

if there's one thing that wasn't good enough, it was the soundtrack, which lacks a defining tune. Forest Gump has it's defining tune, Titanic had "My Life Will Go On", Armageddon's "Dun Wanna Miss A Thing", i mean, heck, even a movie as mediocre as Crossroads had "I'm Not A Girl, Not Yet A Woman".

just a couple more things i'd like to add.

1. while it's understandable that 60% of females gave it a 10/10, but it's interesting that an amazing 30% of males felt the same way.

2. i dun normally rate films so highly. fluff like, say, Saving Silverman, routinely get stick from me. otoh, such praise is usually reserved for films like Shawshank Redemption, or Amelie (Le Fabuleux destin d'Amélie Poulain), or American Beauty, or Life Is Beautiful (La Vita è bella) all gems in their own way.

i think that just about sums it up. as far as teen movies and idol vehicles go, it's just about the best there is. as a movie, it is a gem that shines brilliantly in it's own way.

title: 9/10 stars - A great film to remember
review:
***USUAL DISCLAIMER - MAY CONTAIN SPOILERS***

This film had more good than bad. First, the bad. The acting suffered somewhat. West did well but Moore could've been better. Her quiet distemper in the film perhaps hid this fact to other viewers which, in reality, is good. Hannah looked horrible, though Im no fan of hers, but my belief is that she was supposed to. If this is true, it was a full blown success. The glossing over of Dr. Carter's relationship with his son was a bad idea. More overall depth to the film could've been added, had it been explored a little further.

That said, now the good. It was a good moral story. The old Hollywood cliche that Christians are inherently evil was not a factor in this film lending it more truth in the real world. A message that the world should hear. The plot was held well. Many look at the film and feel that its main focus was a `delinquent' boy falls for a sweet dying girl. This is, IMHO, a misconception. It was so much more than that. Jamie's faith forced a change in Landon. A very positive life long change. It was more than the loss of his delinquency. It was the power of love, faith, forgiveness, and most important of all, peace. Peace within ourselves. The understanding that life isn't perfect. Bad things happen to good people but resentment keeps wounds fresh and in the end, the wounds will not heal.

Another tiresome Hollywood cliche, thankfully left out, was sex. The abstinence lent the film a freshness that few films can achieve.

Overall, it was a film I will not forget. I give it 9 stars out of 10. The -1 star is for the lack of direction in the acting.

title: the best film ever not a tipical teen flick
review: it is the best film i have ever seen. the actors Shane West and mandy moore played and got into the charactors very well and no-one could have done a better job. i loved the song and scene where only hope was sang by Mandy Moore. and i also like that scene because Shane West was in it and that was when they fell in love.

title: The second movie that almost maked me cry...
review: Ok. I love War, and Brutality movies.thats why the first movie that made me almost cry was Platoon. I rarely like this "young love stories". almost the same plot...almost the same ending..always the same disapointing of felling that something was missing. But this movie made me belive in Love...this movie realy touch me in a way that no other movie dit it. Talking about the performance on this movie,only her father makes a disapointing proformance. Aboout the hostiry himself, 5 stars. This is defenetly one of my life's movie.

title: A Moving & Compelling Story
review:
I saw this movie because it received a lot of buzz. I don't normally see a movie on word-of-mouth, & still don't know what convinced me to initially see it, but I'm eternally grateful to have experienced this rare & precious cinematic gem!

The chemistry between Shane West and Mandy Moore is amazing. While you maintain that they are teenagers, you're convinced that they discover true love. I truly applaud Mandy Moore's performance. Peter Coyote & Darryl Hannah deliver superior supporting roles.

I literally cry every time I see this movie. To see the beauty, depth & sacrifices of love.... I can't describe it with words. I implore you to lower your guard and forget what you think you "know" about chick flicks or teen films. "A Walk To Remember" is a must-see! I dare you to see this movie & not be moved.

Final Note: The music so beautifully supported the film, especially during the performance of "Only Hope".

title: WONDERFUL! Put me in one of the best moods i've ever felt!
review: Fantastic movie! If you haven't seen it then you are missing out on a lot! Different and wonderful love story. I think it should be in the top 250 best movies of all time on this site. If you are in love then this is the best movie out there for you to see.

title: Targeted to the men who voted this movie badly...
review: the best romance movie i have ever seen...it was a real pleasure to watch this movie, more movies like this should be made.  good for all ages to watch.  this is for you men from 34 - 40 years old who rated this movie badly, you need to watch it again, and learn from it. this is what every woman dreams of having in a relationship!!

title: Whoda Thunk...
review:
that Mandy Moore was a good actress? She puts most singers to shame. For once a singer didn't play the spotlight role where they are the epitomy of coolness, etc.

Mandy plays Jamie, a high school senior and a preist's daughter who is perceived by her classmates as weird, dorky, and uncool. She keeps to herself and doesn't bother anyone, yet they feel happy to make fun of her at their leisure. Landon, played very well by Shane West, is the popular guy who everyone loves. Well he gets in trouble and is forced to tutor kids and act in the school play as punishment. There he gets to know Jamie and they differ on almost everything, or so they think. They begin to develop a relationship (predictable, yes but acted very well) and fall in love. I won't reveal everything that happens, but it is a touching story that brought a tear to my eye, an eye which very rarely gets teary from movies.

The acting is superb. Mandy and Shane have very good chemistry and Peter Coyote (Mandy's father) plays the overprotective father very well.

The music of the film is also well done. Using Mandy's primary talent in the context of the play was nice to see, as it wasn't forced in there just for her. The song she sings in the play, "Only Hope", is beautiful.

All in all, I really liked this movie. I didn't know anything about it; I just happened to notice it was on my TV when I turned it on and just couldn't turn it off. This is a very good teen movie among many that are the same ol' same ol'. Definitely worth at least one look.

8/10

title: A diamond in the Rough
review:
I'll start off by saying that I'm 25 years old so I'm a little above the target age group for the movie. Even so, I have found a new favorite movie. I am a sucker for the romance stuff and although there wasn't enough time to fully develope the characters, I thought Mandy Moore and Shane West made up for that in chemistry. They were in tune with each other throughout the movie which made it easy to get totally engulfed in the emotions of the characters they were portraying. The storyline was good also, but it was the leading lady and man that brought this film to life. I had barely paid attention to Mandy Moore because I am not a big fan of the teen singers usually (some of them make me wince). Needless to say I own the sound track to the movie now and she is one of my new favorites. She had the class to do a movie like "A Walk to Remember" instead of portraying the typical "cool" teen in other movies that have no substance and guide our youth in the wrong direction.

I was sitting in front of a group of teenagers (13-14 years old) in the theater and overheard them talking about some pretty vulgar stuff, very disheartening to hear. I walked out of the movie glowing from the fact that those same girls just took in a message of love, kindness, and faith in a genre that usually reinforces drugs, sex, and other very negative, yet influential aspects of characters. Teen years are tough and teens often times believe what they see, real or not. They saw characters they could relate to in Jamie and Landen and the life choices in this movie are the stuff life is really about. In closing, excellent job done by all of the cast especially Mandy and Shane and I loved the movie!

title: What? Me? Cry? NEVER!
review:
Okay. I bawled like a little kid who just lost his teddy bear.

So I have a sensitive spot! So what? Sue me!

Every so often, I despair at never seeing anything of decent quality come out of modern Hollywood (other than SFX-laden blockbusters). Then something like this comes along and smacks me upside the head.

title: Beautiful...
review: I will start by saying I have read the book, which is a wonderful novel by Nicholas Sparks. With that when I saw the move I was blown away by Mandy Moore's portrayal of Jamie Sullivan. Casting was terrific. She was whom you saw in your head when you read the book and her voice was the one you heard while you read the dialog. Shane West was great as Landon, although they could have made him a little more tougher, but still great no less. Peter Coyote as Jamie's father was great as well. The movie is touching in so many ways. Predictable, yes and no. You knew what was going to happen but all the while hoping that it didn't, but that's the best part with movies! I cried and sobbed liked a little girl. All of the actors in this movie were phenomenal and I look forward to seeing more Mandy Moore movies. She is not only a lovely singer but and equally wonderful actress. His is a great movie and I urge all of the romantics to take a look at it, if you don't like it you get to hear Mandy's angelic voice as her singing is featured more then once in the movie.

title: a feel good tear jerker
review:
A Walk to Remember is a formula romantic tear jerker drama that works. Director Shankman, takes us on an emotional journey or love and friendship. Both the lead actors(Moore and West) in this teenage drama pull off their roles and make the movie entertaining and heartfelt.

West plays the bad boy who turns his life around as a result of his relationship with Jamie. Mandy Moore in her first starring role does a really good job. You forget she is a pop star. She is one to watch to star in movies to come. Moore and West at first don't like each other because Moore is a loner and West hangs in a clique of the popular kids. Soon he gets in trouble and has to be in the high school play as part of his punishment. West and Moore enventually get close and fall in love.

Moore keeps a secret that when revealed sends an emotional spike into the movie. There love is big and true. The dad doesn't approve but eventually accepts west. The movie is touching and leaves you satisfied. This is a movie worth watching for those romantic at heart.

title: Boooooooooooooring!
review: There's absolutely nothing original or surprising about this movie. Why I invested any time in watching this on cable, I haven't a clue. I don't fit into this film's demographic. I'm a 23 year old male. I guess I just think Mandy Moore is a cutie pie. Anyway, a lot of people will find things in this movie that aren't there. Some Christians will think this is a powerful Christian movie with the central theme of faith and redemption and so fourth. Parents will appreciate the fact that little Mandy didn't jump into bed with the guy right away. Some people will rave about the soundtrack. It made me fall asleep.

title: A good movie with a good message.
review:
This review contains spoilers. I am commenting on the content of the movie: how the movie handles cancer and the commentaries on the DVD. I am sorry, but my experience with cancer might be able to shed a little light on the contents of the movie. If this spoils your viewing pleasure I apologize in advance.

This is a review of A Walk to Remember. First let me express my sympathy to Mr. Sparks His sister must have been a beautiful woman to inspire such a wonderful book and movie.

I was only familiar with two of the actresses in the movie: Daryl Hannah and Mandy Moore. Their transformations in the movie were amazing. I am used to seeing both actresses blonde, especially Mandy Moore. I always imagined her looking like Brittney Spears, I was pleasantly surprised.

Ms. Moore?s mannerisms helped bring Jamie to life.: looking down at her feel, stooped shoulders, quiet voice, the lisp when she spoke, all added life to Jamie. I could almost see a bit of her in people from my high school.

The topic of cancer was well handled by the movie.

Many people with cancer want to keep their illness a secret from everyone. They do not want to be defined by the cancer, they want to live as well as they can for as long as they can. They want to be known by their names not their disease. So the characters keeping their illness hidden is very commen.

Also, people who are dying tend to retreat from the world, and the movie got this right. For someone who is dying a chance at romance could be very scary; this represents a very strong connection to this world that many terminally ill people could not face.

The father's reaction to the cancer is common in one respect and uncommon in another. First his desire to protect is common among caregivers, especially if the terminally ill is a relative. But his actions, after the relapse, is unusual. Many caregivers justify their actions by saying ?they are keeping he/she alive?; the idea that they could be overprotective does not occur to most. It takes a lot of courage to think ?maybe I have been overprotective?. The character shows even more courage by saying it.

I have noticed something else about terminal illness; next to each sorrow there is grace that can affect many people. In the movie the cancer is a catalyst for many positive changes, and this can also be true in real life.

How do I know all this? In 1999 my father died of cancer after a year of struggle. The year of 2002 saw more: in March one of my aunts died of cancer, in September by Grandfather died of old age and I was down-sized, in October Benjamin died. He went to school one day, had an afternoon nap, and never woke-up. He was six. And in late October, a friend of mine was diagnosed with thyroid cancer.

I have two complains about the movie. First the pace of the movie is too fast. There does not seem to be enough time to develop the characters, hence the changes in the characters seem a little rushed.

Secondly, the commentaries on the DVD surprised me. The one with the screen writer and the author was very interesting and informative. It was also added something to the story and was respect full of the story. I learned a bit about what the screen writer did to make the story and I learned a bit about how the author wrote the book. Again, let me express my sympathies for your loss Mr. Sparks, I have been through something similar and it hurts.

The commentary by Mandy Moore, Shane West and the director took something away from the story and was not respectful of the story. It was very cynical and it hurt ... I know that if I was on the outside of the story, if I was an attractive and popular star, I would make cynical jokes about the girl with the funny skirt or the big car or other stuff. Maybe the reason the commentary hurt was because cancer and the loss described in the movie is still close to me. Maybe is was because it was nice to see a romantic lead that worried about being good not just looking good; that an outsider could be accepted, I do not know. It just did not seem to fit with the story.

I recommend the movie because it is well done, but if someone has lost someone to cancer, or has been treated like an outsider, be careful of the commentary by the stars and the director, it can sting.

title: The Chemistry is Electrifying
review: I have seen this movie a number of times and can't get enough of it, the Chemistry between the lead characters (Shane West who plays Landon and Mandy Moore who plays Jamie) is unbelievable it almost seems as though the attraction and relationship has spilled of the screen and into real life, I would reccomend this film to anyone who is an old fashioned romantic at heart. And a warning have plenty of tissues handy, I won't say why as this would spoil the ending of the film.

title: Expert Comment
review:
This movie, "A walk to remember" is a pretty good movie. I think this story written by Nicholas Sparks create an good opportunity to make a first-class movie. Landon (West) hang with the rich and famous. Landon is an aimless teenager; he has no faith in himself, and just hanging around.

But Jamie is the straight opposite; she likes to study and believe in faith. She's also a religious girl with an inflexible daddy.

Well, what can you say? I really liked this movie, and I hope you will enjoy it too =)

title: The Best Love Story
review: I thought this was such a great movie.  Shane West played the self-proclaimed bad boy who does a complete turn around.  This is also the best role Mandy Moore has ever taken part in.  She plays this character so well and really makes their love come to life.  This is one of those movies where you need that box of tissues. The Best

title: It made me cry
review: I love this movie, because it gives teenagers who have never been in love or who have a sense that good does come from love. And that there is always one person in the world for everyone. It made me so happy and so sad all at the same time, and i think that is what movies are made to do. They are made to make you have a rollercoaster of emotions. I think that this movie deserves an 8 or 9!!!

title: A modern day love story starring Mandy Moore!
review:
A WALK TO REMEMBER

STARRING: MANDY MOORE, SHANE WEST

Jamie is the quiet girl in the typical high school. Landon is the outgoing, popular typical guy in high school. When Landon gets in trouble in school, he has to join into all extra-curicular activities that Jamie joins. Typical of the guy, he finds it all to be a waste of his time and boring until he joins the school plays and learns more about Jamie then he thought he would and soon falls in love with her.

Its a story about love, the obstacles people will overcome to be with each other no matter what it has to do. Love and religion take a strong part in this movie, being that Jamie's father is the church priest and Landon's known for being the crazy boy in the school. Landon soon changes his friends and his ways all in the name of love.

This movie teaches a great lesson to teenagers, which is the reason why they love and cherish it so much. It shows that you could fall in love it the person you least expect it to be.

I give it ***1/2 out of *****

title: It's wonderful~~Everyones a critic-Go watch this NOW!:)
review: I love this movie. I watched it in the theatre when it first came out and thought it was moving. It wasn't until they released it on video that I became really into it though. There is a walk to remember message board by the way I attend. This movie is great and Shane West is attractive. I read the novel by Nicholas Sparks and there are remarkable differences but isn't it that way most of the time? In books of course the characters are portrayed differently because in the movies they have to make them believable and somewhat entertaining. Not drab. The soundtrack I highly recommend as well. It has turned me onto Switchfoot. I think Mandy Moore did a fine performance. This is not a typical teen flick. I am on the verge of 23 and love it. I need not summarize the plot, the spoilers did that already. This is similar to here on Earth but I think it is much more believable and "real"

title: Predictable
review:
Nicholas Sparks, best-selling author, wrote the novel A Walk to Remember a few years ago, but was only adapted into a film this year (2002).

Although the movie is based on the book, there are few similarities between the two. It seems they've just kept the names, the plot (which involves a severe illness, but I won't spoil it), and the poem, read near the end of the film, about love, and the many ways it works.

A Walk to Remember surrounds the characters Landon Carter (Shane West), a troubled teen who drinks, talks back, and breaks school rules; and then there's Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore), a priest's daughter; she's very religious, a bit of a loner, and her ambition is to witness a miracle.

Of course, we all know what's going to happen--some of us will know directly from the first scene, but I'll just summarize the rest of the story as best I can without spoiling anything.

Landon falls for Jamie, after spending time with her to practice lines for a school play, due out in Spring. He realizes (eventually) that he doesn't care if his friends, the 'cool crowd' if you may, tease him for being with a girl of Jamie's stature.

It is definitely a sweet love story, filled with tear-filled moments that make you want to cry, too. Overall, out of 10, I give this a 6.5.

title: A bit of a tear jerker
review:
This movie definitely took me by surprise. Before watching it, I thought it was going to be just another chick flick, but I was so wrong! I am a very heterosexual male who enjoys a good violent action and hilarious comedy movie. This movie hit me like a ton of bricks in which I shedded a few tears.

Mandy Moore and Shane West gave excellent performances! And Mandy Moore still looks amazing even when she is dressed like a very conservative Christian girl. She is one of those beautiful actresses and singers who do not need to wear make up or have their hair done to look gorgeous.

This movie sends out a great message and I would reccomend it to anyone. I also reccomend to everybody to keep your eyes wide open because you never know when your miracle could pass you by.

I give it a 10/10.

title: BEST TEEN MOVIE WITH SUBSTANCE
review: What can you expect from a movie that stars a teen pop singer - Mandy Moore? To my surprise and delight - a well written story with a message that delivers good morals and principles, true love and friendship, confidence and security in the midst of peer pressure - above all, excellent acting from its' lead actors. There should be more movies that present positive messages to a fastly decaying generation of teens. Note: Not just for teens, adults may be surprised to find themselves captivated with many chuckles, deep thoughts about life and death, and boxes of tissues for their river of tears. 8/10

title: Surprisingly good
review:
When I first realized the premise that this film offers, I felt that this film is none others than parts of that big fat and overdone teen flick. I know it sounds cliché as well, but I must admit that I was wrong. This film surprisingly good. Good plot, good characterization, good directing and many other good things as a film can be (esp. for a teen flick).

The film it self is such an inspirational thing. We'll get back from the theater with relieving something that life is so precious to waste and we must run it more useful. Believe me, you wouldn't disappoint about this.

P.S.: Mandy Moore is such a bag of talents and by this film, she's one of my favorite babes ^_^.

8/10

title: Not like any teenage movie
review: This film really took me by a surprise. I never expected to see a great cast to perform so very well. Both Shane West and Mandy Moore have the strength and determination to idolise their fans and think of how any teenager can experience love and commitment to another. The characters of Landen and Jamie have a close bond as they develop their friendship and begin a remarkable journey of love until the sadness of Jamie's illness. These two characters share the meaning of love and loss, their miracles is bound to happen and their moments together are passionate and admirable. Based on the novel by Nicholas Sparks,'A Walk to Remember' really is a truly gifted book that celebrates the minds of two adult teenagers taking in the life that only revolves around them for such a short period of time. I would absolutley recommend this to any age.

title: For Better or Worse--To Death Do Us Part
review:
***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** One night in a town called, Beauford, North Carolina a couple risk taking teenagers decided to dare another teenager into jumping in some water at a cement factory. The boy wanted to be like the risk takers, but it got out of hand. When the boy jumped, he got hurt. The cops showed up, and the teenagers started to scram, and left the boy there to die. On Monday at Beauford High, the principal punished Landon Carter who got caught. He was to tutor a young student at a poor school, and participate in the Drama Clubs Spring Play. Jamie Sullivan was known as an out cast, because she wasn't like everyone else. Everybody, including Landon, would make fun, of her. But, when Landon was punished, they were brought together, and he asked her for some help. They started to work together, and he started to see her as a real person, and even fell in love. One day at school, his friends cut out her head from a yearbook picture. They put it on a picture of a girl in a bathing suit. They past it around school, and when Jamie saw it she got up set. When Landon saw it, he grabbed her, and left school, and took her home. He quit talking to his friends. They went on a date to a restaurant. Then they walked by the ocean where she told him her dream to be married where her mother and father was married. Afterwards, he told her that he loved her. She got upset, and told him he couldn't love her. He was hurt and didn't understand why until later, when she told him that she had cancer. He got upset and didn't come around for a couple days. When the other kids found out, they were so sorry for what they said, and felt sorry for her. He decided that he wanted to make her dream come true. He bought rings, and then asked her to marry him, and she accepted. They were married, and got to spend one summer together before.

The intention was to teach us that cancer is not something anyone can see or get from others. The director was also trying to show a person who has cancer that they should be brave, to love or hurt someone, and live life to its fullest. When I heard about the movie, I couldn't wait to see it, because Mandy Moor was the lead actress, and I love her music. I wasn't disappointed at all; she was an excellent actress in this movie. I would, recommend this movie, to everybody, young, or old. It made me think, laugh, and cry. The ending really hit home for me, and now, I catch my self wanting to watch it every time I rent movies.

title: A Film to Remember
review:
Now I'll be the first to admit I'm a sucker for romantic movies. I shed a few tears at movies such as "Bridget Jones' Diary" and "My Best Friend's Wedding". But no movie has ever touched me to the degree that this movie did.

Mandy Moore as Jamie Sullivan does an excellent job. It's so hard to believe that this is the same Mandy Moore on MTV singing "Candy" (I think that was the name of the song). Wasn't her hair blond back then? Anyway, she did a great job with her role. Shane West as Landon Carter also did a great job in this movie. I haven't seen him in any other movies, but I like what I saw of him in this one, so it looks good. =)

Now some people may say the plot is very similar to "She's All That" (i.e., "bad" boy meets "good" girl, being around "good" girl inspires "bad" boy to change, boy and girl end up together). Well, there IS a "bad" boy and a "good" girl and the boy does change from being around the girl, but it is a gradual process.

*******MINOR SPOILER******* Yes, the boy and girl DO end up together, but this movie has a twist, so don't assume anything. *****END SPOILER****

The soundtrack to this movie is amazing. I bought it the day it came out. "Only Hope" is my favorite song on there. (It's also done very well in the movie).

The message this movie conveys is amazing. It shows that you shouldn't take life for granted and that you should live each day to the fullest. Above all, it shows you to have faith, no matter what.

As I said before, this movie has touched me more than any other movie ever has. At the start of the second half of it, I was crying. By the end of the movie, I was BAWLING MY EYES OUT. I've cried at movies before, but not to that extent. Yes, this movie had that much of an emotional impact on me. I urge anyone, guy or girl, whether or not you are a hopeless romantic (though it certainly helps to be one), to see this movie. It may not have the same impact on you, but I hope, at least, that it will make you think.

I give "A Walk to Remember" a 10/10

title: I cried
review: I cried the two times I saw this moving movie. I love it (and Mandy naturally O:-) She is very talented, I will impatiently wait for her to appear in another movie...

title: Nice Little Movie
review: A walk to remember is a nice sad little enjoyable movie. The acting was solid but nothing spectacular. Shane West, I have to admit, is a fine actor and he isn't too bad looking either. Shane West plays Landon, your usual popular guy who slowly starts to fall in love with jamie sullivan[ mandy moore] an outcast disliked by everyone. Mandy Moore did an okay job, at least she was better then britney in crossroads, but back to a walk to remember, it's a nice movie but when finally landon and jamie fall in love but then there is death waiting in a corner, ruining everything. I had tears in my eyes after the movie finished but however the story has been used one too many times. Sweet November, Autum in New York, it's all the same thing. I would give A walk to remember 8/10

title: Amazing and inspiring movie.
review: A walk to remember really did change my prespective on life. The acting was remarkable and very realistic. I cried a lot while watching this wonderful movie. Mandy Moore and Shane West are an aswem team. Their chemistry in this movie was very realistic. Mandy should continue acting in teen movies, she is truly an amazing actress!

title: Better than expected, still not exceptional
review:
I had no interest in seeing this movie when it first came out. It was only after I read the book by Nicholas Sparks that I decided to watch it. The movie was ok, but there were several changes from the book (for instance, Landon's parents are divorced, rather than his father always travelling). The acting was less than impressive-- Mandy Moore has a wonderful voice, but she really only shone in the two scenes in which she used it. In many of the scenes, she was sarcastic and not as pleasant and forgiving as she was in the book; I felt that it hurt her character when she acted like that (and when the script gave her those lines). Shane West was not bad, but it was hard to see that he was falling in love with her: it seemed more like, "Well, the script says I have to kiss her now, so I guess I will."

3/5 stars

**SPOILERS** At the end, Mandy Moore didn't seem weak or close to death as she should have, it just looked like she was walking slowly. They didn't even bother to change her makeup to a shade paler.

title: Worth Watching
review: I was expecting a teeny-bopper sort of movie, but what I got was a beautiful story of love. I was very moved by this movie, and have to admit that I wasn't expecting much from Mandy Moore. On the contrary she  stole every scene she was in, although Shane West wasn't too shabby either. I've already decided to name my next child (if it's a boy) Landon, because the name just struck me when I first heard it in this movie! I may sound silly, but just watch it if you haven't seen it, and keep an open mind. I wouldn't go in expecting an oscar winner, but if you believe in true love you will like it.

title: The epiphany of love & loss...
review: Nicholas Sparks' novel was "A Walk To Remember" will definately go down as on of the finest pieces of literature I have ever read.  I originally couldn't wait for the movie and when I heard there was a book on it, I figured I'd give it a whirl.  But unlike Sparks' previous best seller Message in A Bottle,  They actually made a good movie out of the book.  I have seen the movie at least a dozen times and it still hasn't ceased to pull at the strings of my heart. I only hope I can find a love like that of Holden and Jamie.

title: This site is really good!!!
review: "A walk to remember" a movie that will make you cry, it's one of my favorites.Shane West and Mandi Moore were excellents!!! I have seen the movie more than ten times and it doesn't make me bored ,it makes me feel like different...i don't know how to explain it :) but I am serious this is one of the best films about romances! GOOD JOB MANDI AND SHANE!!!

title: Brought me to tears
review: When I first heard about this, I thought it was going to be a stupid movie (come on, it stars Mandy Moore) but I was pleasantly surprised. Compared to movies like Glitter and Crossroads, this movie is great. This is a film that has heart. Yes, some of it is quite preachy but it's something we can all relate to. We've all been picked on in high school and had our troubled times. Shand West and Mandy deliver a movie that shows you can break through from that though. I don't know if everyone will be able to relate to this movie but if you do, prepare to be in tears. Excellent.

title: Very Beautiful
review: A very, very beautiful movie I won't forget for the rest of my life. I enjoyed it so much for like something sweet I needed in my daily life. Regardless of what kind of great love story should be, I just simply like this one. Landon and Jamie are great young lovers, through their eyes, and through their heart. Regardless of how the story is so simple and so predictable, definitely they are creating one of the best loving images.

title: THE BEST MOVIE IN THE WORLD
review:
OK well i would have to say that this is one of the best movies in the world. Mandy Moore and Shane West do a fantastic job in and i love them so much.

Now heres my story... i saw this movie with two of my good friend and i dont think i have cried that much in a movie before. i have been waiting it to come into the video stores in Australia i alway go in there just to see when it is coming out. It was my birthday and one of my friend gave me the A walk to remember poster and i was soo happy. Then i was at a friends house after they had all come back from there holiday and they had dvds from Bali and what was one of them.... A walk to remember i took it home so excited, with me and have not stop watching it ever since i got

Shane and Mandy do such a awesome job and everything that happens in it is soo good i love this film a 10 out of 10 well done guys

title: The BEST love story of all time!
review: I have seen this movie hundreds of times in the short time it's been out! Mandy Moore does a perfect job as Jamie Sullivan. Plus, Shane West an incredible job transforming the character of Landon. This story is an amazing reminder of how powerful love can be. I would highly recommend it to everyone!

title: Brilliant
review: When I went to the cinema to see this I thought it would be the normal chick flick with the predictable ending but I was wrong. It gave fresh breath to the romance film. The twist in the story really brought it alive. I also thought the two young actors Mandy Moore and Shane West were brilliant in their roles. Especially Mandy Moore as the plain jane daughter of the minister. It is unlike any of the teen movies I have seen over the past years.  I would recommend this film to anyone it was certainly a breath of fresh air.

title: this movie is the best!
review: this movie is so the BOMB!!! Shane West is a really god actor, as is Mandy Moore for being a singer. Very good story line/book. The music is really good. The acting is great and it's an all around great movie.

title: **** out of 5
review: Sometimes when you look at the stars they all look the same but once in a while you will see one that has something so much more beautiful than all the rest. Not just physical beauty but that certain way it glimmers in your eye as it passes, for one second, enchants you in a mysterious way and you don't know why but there is no doubting its presence. You may loose sight of this star or never see it again but every time you look up into the sky, somewhere deep down inside you will always come back to that one star. Landon is one of the popular kids, but one night after a dare goes horrible wrong he sees himself in deep trouble, forcing him to help children on weekends and join the drama club. But through his punishment he is able to see something in Jamie that he has never noticed before and it just so happens that she sees something in him as well. The label romance is synonymous for cliche so don't expect anything new here and it has that "teen movie" feel to it that kicks the dramatic intensity down a notch and throws in a tad of sexist humour but there is still something very satisfying with the finished product. The film features everything we love to hate: the lead actor who gets by on his looks and not talent, the often amateurish scripting, the sappy tissue box sentimentality and the far to obvious symbolism, in this case the different tastes in radio stations shows the split in personalities and they play that shows the "hidden feelings that both Jamie and Landon have for each other. Maybe it is Many Moore who actually possesses a great degree of acting talent as the shy choir girl who only needs faith to survive. The huge problem here, along with almost every other teen movie, is that instead of having a major point of development we have many. Landon's reputation, an absent father, a strict preacher and a hurtful secret, but instead of dealing with all of these separately, filmmakers touch on them slightly then cover them up with to much sentimentality (and it's not only teen movies, can anyone say Life as a House?) which gets laid on a little thick at times, often leaving the viewer feeling a little empty at times. But there is an original concept that we are shown in that in that love is a very natural thing. How you ask, well by comparing it to nature. Love is like the sunset or even the wind "I can't see it but I know that it is there." We are shown that like the stars or the sunset that we don't know why or how love happens, but we know the world just wouldn't feel right without it.

title: If you watch one movie in your life, make it WALK TO REMEMBER !
review:
Did you ever get to see "Walk to Remember" ? I hope so, it's probably the BEST movie I've seen in my life, and I've seen a LOT of movies.

I just love this movie, and wish there was a REAL girl/woman like Jamie out there. I don't think there could exist such an UN-selfish and giving person. I love how her caring helped Landon to change for the better. What a great love story for ALL ages ! And what a great story about being who you want to be, and not being what society wants you to be, and not giving in to Peer-Pressure.

Great movie for ALL Ages, with several themes, and...a GREAT Love story for ALL ages. Good for teenagers, adults, Family, and church groups. It is a REAL love story, not a sex encounter, and the language is pretty clean. This is what love Really is !

This movie is inspiring, moving, and it will touch your heart (if it's beating). These 2 characters, Jamie & Landon, are role models for all ages !

Rent or buy it, and see it if you haven't !

Dave in Dickson, TN

title: If you watch one movie in your life, make it WALK TO REMEMBER !
review:
Did you ever get to see "Walk to Remember" ? I hope so, it's probably the BEST movie I've seen in my life, and I've seen a LOT of movies.

I just love this movie, and wish there was a REAL girl/woman like Jamie out there. I don't think there could exist such an UN-selfish and giving person. I love how her caring helped Landon to change for the better. What a great love story for ALL ages ! And what a great story about being who you want to be, and not being what society wants you to be, and not giving in to Peer-Pressure.

Great movie for ALL Ages, with several themes, and...a GREAT Love story for ALL ages. Good for teenagers, adults, Family, and church groups.

This movie is inspiring, moving, and it will touch your heart (if it's beating). These 2 characters, Jamie & Landon, are role models for all ages !

Rent or buy it, and see it if you haven't !

Dave in Dickson, TN

title: An addictive movie!!!
review: When I bought the video, I only vaguely heard about this movie being quite watch-worthy and knew nothing about the cast ( except for Mandy Moore ) and the storyline. Honestly, didn't expect much of this film except that it might be categorized as one of those forgettable teen movies. And BOY, was I wrong... Even though I have to admit that there are lots of holes in the script and editing, everything is forgivable thanx to the exploding chemistry of the two leads ( West and Moore ). Moore was awesome, but, West is the one who stole the show!!! He acts with his eyes ( especially the falling-in-love scene during the play ). He is an excellent actor and I will definitely watch him in the future... Moore and West should get together in a near future for another project, perhaps a happy-ending one this time around. I've watched A Walk To Remember over 30 times now since I bought the video last month. And I just don't know how to deal with this addiction...

title: A Love story that beats "Romeo & Juliet"
review:
Through all my life, I've been watching so many movies, so much love and pain I have seen that Romance became my favourite style and ... every time when I saw a romance movie - it looks like something touches my heart. I am not so good in English, so I can't explain what I am feeling after watching this movie but I want to tell you one thing - when I saw "A Walk To Remember", I was complete in tears, feeling my eyes burning like on fire and crying because of the deepest thrill of the Life - The pain of Love !!!

You just....must see this movie !

Regards: CiNEMANÂ®

title: Touching and Moving.
review: Here on Earth was 2000's romantic teen drama, but this 2002 one outbeats any I have seen before. I laughed, I cried. This movie had powerful impacts on me---and I am guy! I thought that it was sad because it was so tragic. I encourge you to see it.

title: This movie made me remember about the important things in life: LOVE, HOPE, FAITH
review:
I wasn't even going to rent the DVD because I've read the book and somehow the movies always turns out so much different than the book, but there was really nothing else available at the video store so I rented it. AND IT WAS THE BEST THING THAT HAS HAPPENED TO ME IN A GREAT WHILE.

Sometimes there are movies that just touch us and this movie was it for me. It touched me in such a way that I can hardly explain. It brought back the true meaning of love, hope, faith and kindness into my life even though it wasn't a true story. Sometimes with all the harsh events that we have all been faced with lately, your heart tends to harden but I am so glad that I watched this movie for it made my hard heart melt. And it made me believe that God does create people out there to show us that He loves us and that angels do exist. God uses people to provide us with hope and love (and in the midst of this harsh, cynical world, I had forgotten that) but I am so glad that A Walk to Remember made me remember that.

I hope that Warner Bros. would be kind enough to create a DVD with the deleted scenes because I'm sure the other scenes would do the same: makes us remember that love does exist and yes, it does conquer all...even your worst enemies.

title: Truly a movie to remember...
review:
When I first went to see this movie, I said to myself "Ok, this is just going to be another one of those chick flicks." I was bored one day and so with nothing to do, I decided to watch, for the simple reason for that Mandy Moore was in it. Now let me just say that she took my heart. What a performance.

A walk to remember is a movie everyone should watch, like it or not. It proves how even those who are viewed as and/or sterotyped as a rebel that hope still exists. I must say also that Shane West portrayed the average teenager in schools today very well. At first, he cared deeply about what others thought of him. It's only after getting to know Mandy's character that he begins to know and understand himself. My favorite part was when he questions her faith and she responded " Without suffering, there would be no compasion." "Ya, but that those to the people who suffer, he said back." All I can say

without spoiling the movie for those who have not yet seen this classic is that by the end, Shane's character does grow to have an understanding of compasion. He proves all those who doubted him wrong and it's only because of one person, and it's obvious who :P A must watch!

title: Amazing
review: The movies was awesome and has inspired me so much. I watch the movie everyday and everyday i like it more and more. I think that Shane West is so hot and someday would like to meet him. This movie taught me to have faith and to shoot for my dreams and thats what i intend to do. i want to become a singer,model, and actress and hopefully I'll do movies that change peoples lives like A Walk to Remember has done for me. sincerely, Sara

title: Formulaic Fiasco
review:
Pop princess Mandy Moore joins the long queue of singers attempting the transition to big screen stardom in the teen tearjerker A Walk To Remember. Despite winning an MTV award for her adequate performance, A Walk To Remember promises to short-circuit Moore's cinematic ambitions in a similar fashion to Mariah Carey and the much-maligned Glitter.

Based on the allegedly best-selling novel by schmaltz-meister Nicholas Sparks (Message in a Bottle) and directed by Adam Shankman (The Wedding Planner), A Walk To Remember is the cinematic equivalent of a midday movie but without the entertainment value offered by the television commercials. It is the type of film that treads such overly familiar narrative ground that most audiences will have accurately predicted every clichÃ©d plot twist and turn after the first ten minutes.

Mandy Moore plays Jamie Sullivan, the sickly daughter of a small town Baptist Minister (Peter Coyote in a performance that is one of the films few redeeming features). With her conservative values and unfashionable dress-sense, the bible carrying Jamie is a constant object of ridicule amongst her fellow high school students. One of her detractors is troubled teen Landon Carter (Shane West). Landon is a middle-class rebel without a cause who is mixing with a bad crowd. As to be expected, circumstances bring the two teens together and before long they share a very chaste romance, much to the disapproval of Landon's friends and Jamie's father. Inevitably, tragedy awaits the two ill-fated lovers and director Shankman launches an all out assault on the tear ducts. The final quarter of this formulaic fiasco will have audiences either reaching for their tissues or more wisely, rushing for the exits.

Aimed squarely at a young female audience, A Walk To Remember has enough saccharine sentimentality and two new Mandy Moore tunes to keep them happy. Those outside that demographic might find some entertainment from guffawing at the abominable dialogue delivered by a cast that should know better. Including the once glamorous Daryl Hannah as Landon's mother. Like many of her contemporaries, Hannah has followed the disturbing trend of overdosing on cosmetic surgery in the lip area and is currently looking eerily similar to Daffy Duck.

Overall, another film to add to the worst of 2002 list.

title: Highschool Movie Gets An A-Minus
review:
From someone who just attended his 10th High School reunion, this film reminded me that the more things change with high school--and especially movies about high school--the more they stay the same. Yet something about this movie is profoundly different and warrants attention.

The leads are believable and both remind me of several friends I knew back then. The dynamics of faith, worldview, and upbringing don't hit you over the head. Shining moments show up throughout. Mandy Moore brings across Jamie as believable, not a caricature of some religious nut. In contrast, the father--think Rev. Moore in Footloose (what did I say about the more things change?)--is pretty over-the-top. Still, there is change even in him, and all good movies are about changes to people. Landon's father's attempts to reach his son are well intentioned and his love for him wins out in the end. The rest of the supporting cast is stuck to the "predictable" that Jamie and Landon are loath to, right down to the ditzy drama teacher.

Most importantly, the movie is surprisingly clean. None of the so-common-its-required sex is present or even implied, just kissin'. Cussing was minimal and served the situation. There's a single-punch fight, but it underscores Landon's desire to protect Jamie.

For me, The Fugitive, Braveheart, and Lord of the Rings are staples. Yet when you need a movie to squeeze your honey with, this is a great choice. Guys, you may need to blame your allergies for your eyes watering.

title: Ya gotta take the good with the bad with this one...
review: Okay, so I wasn't exactly chomping at the bit to see this movie. From the looks of the previews and commercials it looked like a dumb excuse for Mandy Moore to act and sing. Plus, any flick that makes girls swoon and gush at the mere mention of the title ala Titanic pretty much goes to the bottom of my must-see list. But when a trip to the Blockbuster resulted in one of the parents renting this, I figured I would take a chance and watch it one night. First the good, because that's harder to write about in a review than the bad. Mandy Moore CAN act, as it turns out, much more so than Britney Spears and Mariah Carey. She pulled off the mousey bookworm character nicely, allowing herself to look like an actual outsider, which is more than I can say for Britney when she was cast as a 'geek' but still paraded around in Banana Republic gear. The male lead, Shane West, was also decent, though kind of limited in his range of emotions. And while the central love story was a bit cliched at times, it won me over in the end. Now for the average, since upon consideration there is nothing truly bad about A Walk To Remember. I didn't like the fact that many of the scenes and characters came right out of Not Another Teen Movie. There was ONE black character, and of course he had to stay stuff like 'bomb diggity' and act all wacky, so when he went into Dramatic Mode and actually tried to show some heart I didn't buy it. His whole character up to that point was a dumb comic stereotype, so why should I bother believing his emotional scenes? And what is it with Hollywood and high schools where the cool kids are so freaking evil? See, in the real world there are social classes in high school, and there is some sort of division, but not to the point where there are plots to totally destroy someone's soul over a lover's spat. Oh wait, never mind. And like I said, with the quality romance many of the Saved By The Bell moments (like the fliers of Mandy Moore's face on a bikini-clad supermodel) seemed bizarrely out of place. All in all, though, this is a good date movie and will definitely put any mushy girl or half-way sentimental fella in Slightly Teary, Almost Crying Mode. Let's just say that if you had to pick from Glitter, Crossroads, or this for your Teen Princess Movie Night, you would be much better off going with Walk. 2.5/4 stars

title: Emma Bromley, 16, UK
review: After reading the book ' A Walk To Remember' ( Nicholas Sparks)i was 100% certain that i had to see the film. So, from crying through the film 3 times i can safely say that it is one of the best movies i have ever seen. Mandy Moore and Shane West were fantastic in it; with Mandy Moore's singing blowing me away.  The film is true to life - giving a real definition of TRUE LOVE. This is not just a teen movie, but a film that MUST be seen by all !!!! Go out and watch the film, read the book and listen to the soundtrack - you couldn't go wrong :)

title: a touching and emotional film
review: There isn't many films that reduce me to tears but this one does! Simple to understand, it still has hidden morals which make the viewer stop and think. It starts off as a typical teen chick flick but develops into one of the best films I have ever seen. Go and see it now. It makes you see the beauty in life.

title: Outstanding movie!!
review:
This is without a doubt the best movie I have ever saw in my life. Mandy Moore is absolutely fantastic. She doesnt portray herself, she does an excellent job of sticking to Jamie's role in the movie. This proves that she is an all around better talent than Brittany Spears because she can act just as well as she can sing. Oh yeah, she looks alot better with the brown hair too!

Shane West does a great job as well. This is the first movie I have ever seen him star in, and I hope he stars in many more movies to come. He proves his love for Jamie, because he does alot of great things for her.

It shows what true love is all about. These 2(West and Moore) could have something going here. Alot of the great movies over the past decade, have involved the same 2 main characters in a sequal. Example: Rush Hour and Rush Hour With Chan and Tucker, and Tommy Boy, and Black sheep with Farley and Spade. These 2, Moore and West if they decide to stick together, which I hope they will do, could become the next big Duo.

To sum it up, this is a harm warming movie. If u havent seen it, what are u waiting for?

title: Tear Dropper Movie
review: I saw "A Walk To Remember" at least a dozen times now, and everytime I watch it, I feel like I am Landon Carter.  I used to always get in trouble and then in school I was matched up with some so beautiful and everything she also was very religious, and she made me different and she also changed my life around, I didn't everything Landon did but I came close.  I feel in love with this girl just like Landon did, but I never got married to the woman, she died before that came around.  But everytime I see this movie it makes me think of my past.  I have to say I have the biggest crush on Mandy Moore, she is such a beautiful young woman, and she is so wonderful to watch.

title: I'll never forget "A Walk To Remember".
review: I absolutely love this movie! Right from the beginning to its sad  ending. I've seen it over a dozen times already. Its definitely become one of my all time faves. And I continue to rave and recommend it to my friends and family. BRAVO! to everyone involve with the film, especially Nicholas Sparks for allowing his beautiful book to be made (even with the changes) and to Shane West and Mandy Moore for bringing beauty, love and "life" to Landon & Jamie.

title: Great Movie!!
review: I picked this movie at random from the rental shelf, not knowing anything about it.  I loved it, went out and bought the movie, the soundtrack, and the book.  Over the next week I watched the movie three more times and read the book eight times.  I suppose there were flaws in the acting and the filming, but as far as I was concerned they didn't distract from the movie. Some of the criticisms I've read seem wierd...such as the punishment Landon received didn't match his offense.  I honestly didn't think about it one way or the other.  I didn't know who Mandy Moore was except that she was Lana in Princess Diaries, so I wasn't expecting anything one way or the other there. I thought she did fine as Jamie.  I thought it was an uplifting movie.  I did think the book would have made a better movie by following the book more closely...same time period, same reason for the play, etc.  I recommend all three...the book, the soundtrack, and the movie.  See the movie before reading the book, though.

title: Awesome Movie
review: One of my all time favorites. I thought it was refreshing to see a teen movie that was not full of sex and drugs. I have read the book and I thought they did a great job of changing it into a modern movie. Mandy and Shane did a wonderful job, I even cried.

title: A Great Movie
review: I just rented this movie, I had heard great reviews of it.  And I have to agree its great!  If this makes any sense at all, its sad but sweet at the same time.  I don't know any other way to put it, its just a great movie. The things Landon (Shane West) done for Jamie (Mandy Moore), if anyone ever done anything like that he would have my heart.  Its just the best movie ever!

title: Truly, touching and Remarkable Film
review: This film touched me in a way that no other film has. This movie has changed me in was that I never thought possible. Your probably going "yeah right", but it's true. Jamie inspired me to be a better person to live life to the full and most of all not change to fit others ideal, be yourself and love who you are. This is a beautiful love story between two of the most unlikely people. Landon Carters, a rebel, cool in his own way gets into trouble and if forced to community service where he keeps running into Jamie Sullivan, daughter of the local Baptist Minster. Her and Carter have known each other from their childhood, but he never really got her. Mandy Moore makes an incredible performance, with true emotion, and displays that she is no Britney Spears and this was no Crossroads. But the best performance can from TV's Once and Again star, Shane West who shone in his role of bad boy turned romantic. The end scene with his father is really moving and shows that he has pure talent and is here to stay. This moving will make you laugh and cry and often both at the same time. Jamie's courage and everlasting faith will inspire you and Landon's devotion and capacity to love unconditionally will lift you to a higher level. This is most certainly not just another teen movie despite obvious misconceptions. The stereotypes of the cool kids and the losers and over extenuated to the point of unrealism like in most teen movies. Also the movie does not end with the prom. Not to mention the fact that they did not overdo the singing, she sung when she had to, but not at every chance she got. And my favourite thing is that Jamie does not change she has beliefs and ideals and she does not compromise them for anyone. She does not get a makeover, she doesn't need to do that, she know whom she is and she likes her. She is confident, but not cocky and she keeps a hold if whom she is even though there are a lot of rapid changes that happen. After reading the book I do not believe that one is better than the other. They are very different which can be a good thing, because the book was set in 1950's and some of the things, which happened in the book, would not have been relevant now. But it still holds on to the themes and meaning of the book. This movie should be commended for its high spirit and values and not judged.

title: Two souls sharing one body.
review:
What a fabulous film! Screenwriter Karen Janszen does it again. This film affected me emotionally, spiritually, and intellectually. But mostly, it affected me romantically. I have never cried more from a film since Terms Of Endearment back in the early eighties.

This is an especially moving story for anyone who believes in growing up, learning about life, and falling in love.

Actor Shane West gives a wonderful performance that is not only believable but worthy of an award.

Actress Mandy Moore is moving, thrilling, and wonderful. She is, without a doubt, the star of the film, the story, and is the heart of the emotions you will feel.

Actor Peter Coyote is fantastic. He gives a great performance and is, as always, an asset to the film and one of the best Actors in the business.

Actress Darryl Hannah gives a forgettable performance and is just not very good. However, luckily, her part is rather small and she doesnt affect the film.

This film is perfect for an evening on the couch. But, I warn you. Bring your favorite blanket, get comfy, and keep the tissues handy.

Karen Janszen should be nominated for an academy award for this screenplay and this film should definitely be considered for a Best Movie award. It is a must see! Must own! Film.

title: Refreshingly enjoyable and memorable film
review: I especially enjoyed this movie due to the touching performance by Mandy Moore in her first major acting role. Her lowkey and natural portrayal of Jamie was so sensitive and interesting compared to other teen stars I have seen in typical recent teen movies. Her 2 songs were  very appropriate and fitted in well to the plot. Her rendition of 'Only Hope' was totally captivating. My guess is that she is extremely talented with lots of serious future potential in films. This movie is a shameless tear jerker, but very well done especially considering the low budget and short period of time during which it was filmed. I liked it even more after a second and third viewing and was totally won over by Mandy and Shane West as Jamie and Landon (and the musical soundtrack). Some critics have complained that it is too preachy, but the movie's messages about love and faith have given me a lot to think about and have stayed on my mind unlike most movies that just provide forgettable mindless entertainment.

title: Pygmalion yawn
review: Absolutely extraordinary. Fascinating. Highly surprising. Sadly, this is just my reaction to reading some of the other comments than my reaction to sitting through this absolutely forgettable film. Utterly predictable, the script had as much bite as a leaf of limp lettuce. If Danielle Steele had been behind this, you would have expected more (and not Moore, who's making the most of this by using it as an extended video promo for what I presume will be her next single). Dull as ditchwater that's been stagnating for years.

title: Good
review: This movie was better than the book, thats just my opinion. I read the book, and got kinda bored reading it. But i just made myself. I watched the movie today on PPV. I acually liked the movie. I am not a fan of Mandy Moore, but I think she did a great job in this movie and so did Shane West. Overall i give the movie 9/10. I liked the movie enough to own it.

title: I love this movie!
review: I was reluctant to see this movie because I knew it didn't have a happy ending.  After prodding from several people, I sat down to watch it.  After bawling my heart out for 45 minutes, I had to watch it again.  There is something about this movie that touches me and everyone else I've talked to that has seen it (even men!)  I watch it all the time and love it even more every time.  Shane West gave an absolutely amazing performance and I cannot wait to see him in future movies (it helps that he's a beautiful man, too!) Mandy Moore surprised me with her performance.  She was excellent as well. This film deals with subjects such as death, redemption, religion, and love - and does it wonderfully.

title: Potentionally could have been great but....
review:
This movie is a prime example of "Commercialism vs. Artistry"

The story has a ton of potentional, but falls into the typical trap of trying to appease a certain target audience. The sub plots are not developed in the slightest, and The characters seem to have little depth. Really folks, are teenagers these days suffering from ADD this much that we have to have films with the "no Ridilin required" label?

Mandy Moore looks the part great, but let's understand that "looking" the part does not mean one becomes "the part".. For The most part, she delivers an inconsistent performance. Sometimes she is right on,(crying scenes and romantic intimaticy) other times I got the sense she was forcing lines without characterization.

Her Character she plays in the movie seems contrived, even selfish at times. Jamie might try asking Landon "what would you like to do today?" Jeez, as if EVERYONE that is terminally ill needs more patronizing, and enjoys being catered to "hand and foot" Honestly, yes, it is fine and well that Landon wishes to fufill her "wish list" but each and every second? There is a fine line between compassion and patronization.

What is missing here is obvious; "can we get to know you guys first before we see your pain?" "Jamie, tell us about your faith," not that you "have faith."

Well she can't, because it seems like the film makers did not want to "offend" anyone who is not a Christian. This is film making honesty? Jamie is A Christian correct? Isn't The head of Christianity someone named Jesus, then how come his name is never mentioned ONE TIME? Btw, Nice "Head Ornament of Jesus" in Jamie's home. I was not aware that "Southern Christians" had similar little "statutes" of The tortured thorn crown wearing Jesus as Catholics do. This is not a Christian film. Enough comments on how it is.

I have not read the book but I will wager the book goes into Jamie's faith just a tad more than the movie does.

Did we as well need a Mandy Moore Music video here? Her singing skit could not be more contrived unless she was a male midget at a ballpark urinal "tryting to measure up" This is out of character for Jamie, plain and simple.

There is perhaps something worthwhile to this movie. At least it is not the typical teenage flick in the sense that not every teenage idiot is a bad person. They are still idiots, but not "evil idiots".

Is this a tear jerker? Well, I felt sadness to a degree, but a small degree. Folks you want tear jerkers? Try The Green Mile. At least that film has characters clearly defined to love and hate. How about ET?..

I just feel this film was targeted at teenagers who cry if their parents won't buy them a new car, and/or new shoes. JEEZ.

If The film makers just really focused only on a good movie, without caring about just who in the hell might see it, they could have had a really good flick here. They should have gone for Anne Hathaway, who shows a good deal of acting ability and actaully looks 18 instead of 14. like Ms. Moore does. Maybe for The Male lead, they could have nabbed Ralph Machio,(The Karate Kid) he still looks like a teenage idiot, and he is like 50 years old.

Actually, all kidding aside, Shane West does an adequate job.. Mandy Moore? Well, she is certainly a nice looking young woman. Perhaps she will take some acting lessons because she does show potentional. At least she was better than those other 2 "singers" who tried acting. That isn't saying much.

Overall, not a bad film. However, could have been a great film. Peace

I love " A Walk To Remember" and everything about it, especially Shane. This movie is soooo000oooo sweet! Be prepared with kleenex because tears will be rolling down your face in no time. I have watched it approximately twelve times, and I'm not sick of it. In fact, I don't think I'll ever be! You can watch it with most anyone from your friends to your Mom. Just watch it, but beware...its addictive. I thought Mandy Moore and Shane West did an awesome job. I was kind of expecting less from Moore, since she was switching over from singing to acting, but she pulled it off well. I give it 5 stars! And for all you people dissing this film, I know we are all entitled to our opinions, but make sure you have your facts straight before you do. ~I LOVE YOU SHANE!!!!~

title: 10 out of 10 possible spoiler
review:
I am rating this 10 out of 10. Why? Before i answer that, let me give you a short list of other films i would rate this highly. GODFATHER I, II, THE SOUND OF MUSIC, ONE FLEW OVER THE COO COOS NEST, BLAZINGS SADDLES, GLADIATOR, LOVE STORY, THE SHAWSHANK REDEMPTION, MY FAIR LADY, THE STING, GUESS WHOS COMING TO DINNER and APOLLO 13.

Now, anyone over 30 reading this has got to be thinking this guy (46 y/o male) has got to be crazy! 10 out of 10 for a predictable, coming-of-age teen story? What could possibly link A WALK TO REMEMBER with these great films?

It's quite simple: Don Corelone and power, Caption Von Trapp and Maria, Nicholson and his crazy cast, Wilder and Little, Crowe and Phoenix, Mcgraw and O'Neal, Andy and Red, the Professor and Ms. Doolittle, Redford and Newman, Tracy and Hepburn, and Tom Hanks and anybody.

Yes, you guessed it, Moore and West, as Jamie and Landon, have Advanced Placement Chemistry. Their subtle looks and gestures, along with a fantastic musical score, made their falling-love-scenes some of the best every.

If there is a category for best performance of a cover song, Mandy Moore should receive one for ONLY HOPE.. Voice, delivery, body movement, vocal range, she had it all.

A simple story well told!! congrates to Mandy Moore

title: Wonderful
review: I just saw this movie and it's such a touching movie..I can't wait to read the book...I think I cried for hours after seeing it.  It shows that love can always make life worth living for.  As for Mandy Moore and shane West they did an amazing job with the story!

title: Plot holes so big you don't need a telescope
review:
I've just read about 3 pages of comments and am wondering what movie these viewers were actually watching.

The acting was poor, although having seen both West and Moore in other movies I'm willing to bet that bad direction and bad writing were to blame. The plot holes were so big you drive a truck through them. The editing was sloppy and spotty.

Jamie's father sounded like the character was based on John Lithgow's character in Footloose.

"Only Hope" fit the tone of the movie but didn't seem to fit the scene of the play within the movie. It seemed like a lame way of selling a Mandy Moore song (can we say, "product placement"?). And the curtain came down right after that? Plot hole. Truck. Speaking of automobiles, why was Landon always fixing his car?

Part of the movie was sweet and I did cry at the end for the reasons I was supposed to (not just because the movie was so bad or because I was so happy it was over).

Usually I adore cheesy movies. Usually these teen movies are a big guilty pleasure for me and even "bad" movies are often entertaining (I found Crossroads enjoyable despite bad acting and writing). A Walk to Remember just left a bad taste in my mouth. I ended up seeing it twice because the video was popped in the evening after I'd seen it.

I'd like to read the book to see if it's much better.

title: One of the best movies I've seen.
review: Personally, I really enjoyed this movie. I never thought that Mandy Moore could act, but I was surprised. And, as for Shane West, he is hot. I saw the movie and I liked it so much that I went out and bought it. It is one of the best romantic dramas that I have seen. This is my opinion and feel free to disagree but it won't affect me any. I will still say this is one of the best movies I have seen.

title: A walk to remember, is truly a movie to remember
review: When I first watched it, i was crying from about half way through the movie to the very end. It was a great movie. I now have gotten everyone I know to watch the movie. Every single one of them loved it. I watched it on DVD and the commentary was great, but I was a little disappointed that there wasn't any extra footage of deleted scenes. Oh well, maybe you can come out with a limited edition of it or something. Anyway this is a great movie and it is not a chick-flick, it is a story about love.

title: the book is better
review: it was good, but somewhat unrealistic. don't destroy a good character by compromising her. really, it was good, but jamie was a little shady. a strict judge of film or literature would be displeased. so if you are in that case, read the book. it's great.

title: Fantastic
review: I read the book A Walk to Remember and then I decided to see the movie.  I thought it was a fabulous and fantastic movie.  I think that everyone should see this movie because it gives you such a good feeling inside, yet at the same time it can make you cry like a baby.  The love that Jamie and Landon have for each other is true and the actors portray this perfectly. Everyone in the world dreams of finding a love like the one Jamie and Landon had, and I think that part of the movie touches everyone's heart and soul.

title: beautiful
review: All I can say is that I just seen the movie. I never cried so much. Shane West is a excellent actor..and also for Mandy Moore she did a wonderful job as well .(1st time doing a movie) ...Hope to see her in more movies..but them both together did EXTREMELY ESOME; I recommended everyone to see this movie.

title: Solid movie but way overloaded
review: I gave the movie an 8 a few minutes after I saw it... Would change it to 6 or 7 now that I slept a night... Not that the movie is bad, but it was way too overloaded when I think about it... The theme has been in hundreds of movies before and this one isn't the best. But it was nice, the actors gave good performances and if you are able to sit back and don't think about the originality of the story you'll like it. Especially if you like Mandy Moore ;) (which acted much better than I expected). Since I don't want to spoil anything I will just say that esp. the end of the movie was the part that was the most overloaded. Too many plot-lines solved at once... You can all see it coming from the beginning or the moment the matter is first mentioned in the movie. Overall not a masterpiece of film but solid as I said... I was able to enjoy it and that's what's important :)

title: Fantastic film
review: I just watched the film again for the countless time.  This film, as well as the book, is wonderful.  The story is very touching.  It is very nice to see a film without violence, sex and  explicit language. I was very impressed with the two main characters, Jamie and Landon.  Their relationship was a breathe of fresh air and watching the relationship unfold and grow impressive was in today's society.  The actor's that played them were excellent.  Mandy Moore and Shane West had a on screen chemistry that was intense, feeling with compassion and understanding.  Hats off to Mr. Shankman, the Director, good show!!  I was very disappointed in the DVD, because of the editing.  I am hoping, as thousands of others, for a Director's Cut with all the edited footage so that we can further see the relationships and the story.

title: I'm sure it was fine, but.....
review:
...this film seemed to take place in some sort of Babysitter's Club fantasy world, where everyone in the school is fresh out of a Gap commercial. The forced, goofy dialogue is what chased me away running and screaming. I didn't see any of the movie after Mandy's line "On one condition, you must promise you won't fall in love with me." Seriously, she actually has to say that, its in a script that was written by someone and later approved by someone else. NO ONE TALKS THAT WAY! Pure Danielle Steele without all the good stuff.

This movie was a piece of crap.

title: good, but predictable
review:
I liked this movie because everything went the way it should have. They made you want something to happen and then they did it. I think they could have spent a little more time showing how he fell in love with her because one day he's making fun of her and suddenly she's in a pretty dress and he's in love? Just a little too fast for me. I would watch it again.

However, it was very predictable. If you're looking for a plot twist, you're not going to find it in this movie. They could have done a better job at not shouting out what was going to happen next.

title: Mandy Moore proves herself to be one incredible performer in this movie. (SPOILER)
review:
SPOILER

Mandy Moore captivates the audience as Jamie Sullivan, the daughter of a small North Carolina town preacher, who doesn't seem to fit in at the local high school. Jamie is a girl who doesn't care what others think and lives life to the fullest by being a good Christian girl with many ambitions. Her life changes when the popular guy, Landon Carter, due to being punished by the principal, ends up in her drama club and tutoring at the same junior high that she does. Through many encounters on his way to being a better actor in the high school play, they fall in love, though Jamie requested he not do it. The role of Jamie fits Mandy Moore so well and she brings to it a light of innocence and passion. Shane West in the role of Landon Carter, is not too bad himself. He follows Mandy through the movie, taking what she throws at him. Her smile--unmistakably Mandy, so beautiful, so radiant, so full of pure emotion. This movie is everything a movie should be--awesome!!

title: We all loved it!
review:
Our teenage girls, our younger children and my husband and I all thought it was a great movie! It was especially refreshing to see a movie where someone is inspired to be better by someone's example, rather than dragged into a bunch of crap like in many teen movies.

We were especially impressed with the acting. Mandy Moore did a wonderful job, and Shane West was fabulous.

After renting it twice, we finally went out and bought the DVD because our kids kept begging us for it. I much rather have them watch something really good like this instead of movies like the mostly harmless but utterly silly drivel like Legally Blonde, etc.

title: Good movie!
review: I thought this movie was very good. It was the best movie I have ever seen. I suggest that you rent it. Some people who reviewed it badly do not know a good movie when they see one. Shane West and Mandy Moore did a GREAT job. Don't let anyone tell you otherwise. Go rent A Walk To Remember YOU WON'T REGRET IT!

title: great movie
review: it's got your typical teen-movie plot, but it's unlike any typical teen movie. Walk to Remember is extremely well done.....mostly because of mandy moore :P  Is it just me or does mandy moore in this movie remind you of that main character of final fantasy the movie?

title: Well-done movie that can evoke a strong emotional response
review:
I have not read the book, but I was quite impressed by this movie, particularly in how it evoked a strong emotional response. I'm a grown man, but I cried like a little kid!

A powerful theme throughout the movie was that people CAN change. Also, the film seem to flow quite well and it had a sad, but happy ending.

Oh yeah, and the music was great!

title: A Walk to Remember - The best movie this year
review: A Walk to Remember is a GREAT movie.  Both Shane West and Mandy Moore gave a delightful performance!!  I am disappointed the DVD did not have more options like deleted scenes.  That would have been great.  I am hoping they come out with a directors cut soon.

title: Teen Chick-Flick. An Ok Movie.
review:
