Don't get me wrong I have nothing against chick-flicks, I love chick-flicks and this film is a good one. I wouldn't say this film was anything great or spectacular, but it was enjoyable. The only difference between this movie and other typical teen chick-flicks is that this one has a slightly harsher ending. Overall, it was still a good movie.

The actors all did a pretty good job. Mandy Moore did a find job for her role and Shane West was better than I expected. Peter Coyote was good in his role too. I was very pleased to see Daryl Hannah in a film, she seems to have left the mainstream type of films. The rest of the cast was fine too.

If you're into teen love movies, then this is the film for you. I hope you enjoy the film. Thanks for reading,

-Chris

title: Need I but quote Tony the Tiger? It's GREAT!
review:
Maybe I'm just a sucker for cute girls and forthright Christianity in the movies, but I thought the movie was wonderful!!

Mandy Moore is a terrific actress, and I hope to God that she has more success than Britney Spears, because she actually has TALENT.

Also, I would recommend "Return to Me" for those who like this movie.

title: Excellent, touching, charming,... There's more.
review:
If I have ever seen a movie which premise has gotten me accurately to the plot and scared away any prejudice, THIS IS THE ONE. This film escapes from the traditional cliches given to those movies whose main characters are teenagers. The movie is based in the Nicholas Sparks' novel.

The acting is fantastic, even more than I could ever expected; the soundtrack is great, as well; the plot it's capable to take us (no doubt about it) to that walk to remember.

Mandy Moore is absolutely amazing. You definitely will fall in love with her... I know I did. Shane West gives his best performance. There's chemistry and it makes it really convincing.

Basically, this movie is a lot more than I imagined: it's touching, it impacted me, it got into my deepest sensations. I don't want to be too dramatic, but this movie deserves 10/10 because its determination and success to get into us and, at the same time, make us get into it.

title: One of the greatest romantic movies ever made
review: I thoroughly enjoyed every minute I spent watching this dynamic film because it has such a very deeply touching and beautiful story that was so very well portrayed.  This is definitely one movie that I could watch again and again. Very highly recommended to anyone in the mood for a most excellent love story.

title: Wonderful
review: Loved it  :) it was great, got me bawling, great performance, go see it

title: a perfect movie
review: First of all i love to congratulate the director for making a movie like "walk to remember". the movie was such a big hit here in the phillipines.second, to the casts of the movie you've done a good job.Walk to remember is a good movie i love the way mandy(jamie)handle her self......i also love shane's attitude the way he wants to go for a change congratulations once again.....

title: Simply A Masterpiece
review: This has to be about the most beautifully directed movie I have seen for a long time. The questions of whether Mandy Moore could act are silenced, besides being a great singer she was superb in this movie. I'm a guy and never have I cried so much in a movie and I'm not one who cries at all, but I weeped like a school girl in this one. The music was beautiful and the story was just the same, I would recommend it to everyone. I f your going to watch one movie this year this is the one folks.

title: A Few Questions
review: Student life is familiar to all of us (if you're younger than five, you're not reading this!), so why do writers create so many unreal situations that make the film just plain silly?  Why were the yearbooks distributed so early?  Why did the director of the spring play select the players for each role, and why did she choose an "unknown" for the male lead? Do students really write the plays -- with such adult themes?  Why did Mandy Moore's character leave the lunch room to go home?  Do students do that?  How was Shane's character able to drive here and there whenever?  Did anyone attend classes. or did they sit outside all day -- except when they were in that weird-looking lunch room?  I cringe whenever proms are featured in films: no one has a date until the week of the prom, the decorations are being decided that week, and the music/band has yet to be selected.  Isn't someone tapping the writer/director/whoever on the shoulder and saying, "May I offer a suggestion?"  Oh, yes, thumbs down on this goofy film.  Give me "Wuthering Heights" with Ralph Fiennes anyday and everyday!

title: great
review: i think that it is very touching and heart fulling...i think that it is great that someone can get someone to change...i love that they used christian music in the movie.....mandy more is a great atress and she know what she is doing

title: what a beautiful movie
review: This was such a beautiful movie. Shane and Mandy were so good together. the acting was really good. The story was really sweet. I loved every bit of this movie. This isn't like those mushy love movies. I'd seriously give this movie 3 stars out of 4. The movies about a popular teen falls in love with an unpopular girl. I'm a male and I really enjoyed this movie. i recommend this movie to anyone who loves a good decent love story. the music was really excellent too!!!!!!

title: Sweet
review:
This movie is really sweet and pretty cool. It might be a little soppy at times but the movie is sweet. The acting is pretty good, but Mandy Moore is definitely a better actress than Britney Spears. She actually knows how to act, and unlike Britney, she doesn't play herself.

This movie isn't the best in the world, but it has talented actors and actresses and a good story line, although it does seem to have the same plot as heaps of other films. You know, the whole bad boy meets good girl meets Cupid.

This is a good film, so I recommend people watch it. It's sad and quite entertaining.

title: What were you expecting?
review:
You've seen this movie before. Popular boy (this time) and unpopular girl fall in love. Friendships are challenged, other stuff happens. It's true love. Everyone's happy. Something must go wrong and it does. Will the characters be able to go on? They find a way. The end.

I knew what the movie was about. No surprises right? Wrong. I was pleasantly surprised with Mandy Moore, hey she's a singer not someone who's been acting since before she could read. She held her own. I feel she earned her MTV award. But I was impressed with Shane West. He was the movie, in almost every scene. He went from being a jerk to trying to soften up to being the sweet guys that make all the high school girls go, `Why can't my boyfriend be more like that?' and the boys say `Man, that guy makes me look bad even though I paid for this movie.'

Realistic? No. But it's only a movie, I watch them to escape. Real love isn't all fireworks and roses children. I know I'm married love my husband 100 times more than the day I said `I do' same goes for him (I asked tonight). I watch this stuff for the mushy new love stuff. This movie has it. I'd watch it again.

title: True tearjerker, surprisingly strong acting...
review:
I recently rented this movie and was expecting the typical romantic cliche storyline and definitely got that. However, I found the movie to be overall heartfelt and the cliched morals to be so true and not forced. I agree that the movie was far different from the book (which I read before seeing the movie) and I did feel disappointed that a lot of what happened in the book, like the dance, didn't happen in the movie. Yet I was pleased that there are still a number of things that the movie did incorporate from the book. I did find myself surprised at the acting. Although, both Mandy Moore and Shane West's acting is not superior, I thought that overall they did a really good job. They were believable and emotional in their roles. This movie to me was good because it draws you into the storyline and leaves you as emotional as the characters and lets you feel exactly what the characters at feeling at the given moments. When I first saw the whole movie throughout, I started crying when Jamie is ridiculed by Landon's friends and the anger and sadness she was feeling got to me. And from that point on I was bawling throughout the rest of the movie all the way to the end. When Jamie tells Landon she has Leukemia to...Landon's reaction to it to....Landon with Jamie in the hospital to....Jamie's dad breaking down to....Landon finds out his dad is paying for home care and goes to thank him to....Landon saying that although he cannot see their love, he can feel it. A true tearjerker with a heartfelt storyline that is a cliche but definitely well-acted by newcomers Mandy Moore (whom I definitely had doubts of but was proved wrong) and Shane West (whom I have adored since his first season on Once & Again and surprised at his strong acting skills). Another good thing is the songs could not have fit the scenes they were in any better. I have fallen in love with the soundtrack from watching this movie.

The DVD features are not all that great but I did learn that the character Jamie is based on Nicholas Spark's real-life sister...and Mandy Moore, Shane West and Adam Shenkman's catches on bloopers. I just wanted to add one that they failed to mention or maybe even didn't catch. But when Landon goes to visit Clay at the rehab center he's in a beige shirt but walks in with a blue & white striped shirt. But anyways the movie is pretty good and I give it an 8 out of 10 stars. It'll definitely leave you teary eyed at the end.

title: Fair
review: Taken by itself this was a fair film. It wasn't wonderful, but it wasn't terrible. It wasn't your typical 'teen' movie, it contained a substantial story, and better character development, and the actors, even Mandy Moore, were decent. However... Taken in terms of a book adaptation it was absolutely awful. When I watched the film I noticed it "adapted" very little from the book, which I was almost willing to forgive... However when I saw the ending I was completely and utterly appalled. The book ends in the exact opposite way that the film ends. I could not believe that they would change 100% of the ending. The last two lines are the best two lines in the entire book, and they not only discluded those from the film, but they changed the meaning in its entirety. Though this film was not terribly made, and in terms of a "teen" film, it was even good, if you've read the book, be prepared for a major let-down.

title: Wow! The critics really missed on this one!
review:
I read the book and loved it. Had my two teenage daughters read it, they said it was OK but they did read it without stopping?

At first I was a little disappointed that the movie was different then the book, but after a while it caught on. Had my daughters and wife watch it and they loved it.

This was a movie about love and faith. The movie did a good job of showing the trails a young person of faith may go through in school and showed her as the hero.

I think most of the critics have problems with subject matter like this and thats why they beat it up so bad. It really is a movie that is worth watching.

A walk to remember is one of the best movies i've ever seen.  I love how it doesnt make it like Christianity is just some boring religion.  I want to learn to be more like Jamie--like she doesnt care what anyone thinks about her...thats so hard especially when alot of people already dont like you. This movie was full of drama, some humor, and lots of romance and this has become my favorite movie.

title: Absolutely Wonderful, A gem for sure.
review: At first glance, A Walk To Remember looks like a teen movie. It stars Shane West and Mandy Moore, and takes place during High School years. Don't be decieved, this movie is a gem. At the start we learn what kind of backround each character comes from, making them who they are. Before you know it, you are wrapped up in a beautiful,charming romance. Not all young people are shallow, and this movie proves it. Mandy Moore and Shane West's acting is brilliant, along with the supporting cast. I give this movie 8.5 stars out of 10.

title: I LOVE IT!!!!!!!!
review: OMG!! This movie is the BEST!!!!!!!!!! You will just fall in love with the cast!!!! The movie also has a very good sound track!! The book is so good!! I think you should read the book then watch the movie!! Yes, the book and the movie are different, but they are both sssooo good!!!! Mandy Moore was really good as Jamie Sullivan and Shane West was a really good Landon Carter!! The movie is funny, sad , and inspirational . This movie is to die for!! SO GO READ THE BOOK AND GET THE MOVIE ASAP!!!!!! Because if you don't you have no idea what you're missing!!!

title: Lovely!
review:
I should never have put on my eye make-up before watching this movie. I kept tearing up and wiping my eyes.

A Walk to Remember is a love story. Jamie Sullivan, played by Mandy Moore is the Christian girl and Shane West plays Landon Carter, the rabble rousing, anti-authority "cool"teenager she loves.

Landon is embittered by his parents' divorce. His father is a successful doctor who has left Landon's mother for reason's unspecified. Landon is drifting, getting into trouble, one of the leaders of the "in" crowd when he runs afoul of the law. Part of his probation is tutoring after school, doing janitorial work, and acting in the school play. He meets Jamie, who also tutors and is in the play during this probation. Jamie is a committed Christian--innocent but sweet and strong in her beliefs. The sparks between Jamie and Landon start to fly the opening night of the play. Jamie is too shy to say how she feels, but when she sings, her heart shines through and speaks to Landon. He can't help but respond.

Landon's transformation from surly, cynical "cool" guy to loving, goal-driven, caring person is a joy to watch. At first, he finds it difficult to be without his former comrades, but after a while, they become boring to him. Jamie believes in him. He starts to want something more. The relationship never rings false.

The only quibble I could have with this fine film is the way that Jamie dresses. It is entirely possible for a woman of faith to dress fashionably. They have Jamie wearing an old grey sweater most of the movie as if to say that if she wore pretty clothes, she couldn't be a Christian-NOT!!

I highly recommend this film. I've seen it three times.

title: The sweetest story about teens falling in love.
review: I LOVED A Walk to Remember. There were so many different morals of the story. A couple that I liked were that you should always have faith and something to believe in. Also, you should never judge a book by its cover. Always try to look deep in yourself and in others and see who they really are. I don't think they could have picked anyone better to play the parts of Jamie Sullivan and Landen Carter. I could feel the love and passion between the two characters to a point where I cried. I STRONGLY recommend this movie (or book) to anyone who wants to show their boyfriend how to treat a lady, any couple who is madly in love, or, simply, anyone who's a sucker for cheesy, sappy love stories.

title: Just had to say something...
review:
I read the book by Nicholas Sparks right before the movie came out on video. When it did, I had to go to the video store three times before I got to rent it, cuz it was always sold out. But, I finally got it and at first I was so stunned at how diffrent the movie and the book was that I did'nt give it much of a chance. But it had an effect on me.

So I watched it again. And there was a lot I missed. So I watched it again, and still more I had missed. I found the movie to be beautiful and touching and while I still prefer the book (of course) the movie has sooo many attributes.

Yes, I think it is possible for people to fall in love the way the two do in the story. I don't think it was any more filled with cliche's than the cliche's that most teenagers are living with everyday. When your young, some worry more about the way they are appear than who they actually are. And it often takes a lot of time and a few more years of life experiance to realize what being a mature, rational, loving human being, really means. I thought the way the teenage boy morphs into a young man was well written and wonderfully acted. I could gush all day about the job Mandy Moore and Shane West did in this movie.

My only gripe with this movie was that the screenplay so obviously skimmed over the religous aspect of the book. Those who've complained that the movie was too preachy, would be shocked at how the book was actually written in comparison.

I understand that in todays society of political correctness, the screenwriter, most likely, thought it would alienate too much of the audiance to leave in all the spiritual and religious aspects, but that was the biggest part of the book, and at first I felt cheated by the re-write. I think the movie would have been better, in fact, if it had stood by the original story. But, the powers that be have more control over these things than I, so be it.

But, had I never read the book, I would have no complaints. It is a very beautiful movie. I wish I had seen it when I was 17 instead of 27.

title: Excellent movie that presents The Gospel without being preachy
review: Unlike films such as Left Behind, A Walk To Remember presents moviegoers with the reality of what Jesus can do for a life without confusion and end-time prophesy. The movie wasn't billed as having Christian undertones, so it was a pleasant surprise to find the message so prevalent throughout the film. Parents need to be aware of the fact that there is a considerable amount of cursing throughout the film, as well as some suggestive behavior by the teens. However, for kids older than 13, the movie will be a realistic representation of what they see and hear in the mall on a regular basis. Furthermore, it teaches kids (and adults) the importance of maintaining a strong testimony for the Lord, despite peer pressure and condemnation from the world. Overall, it is an excellent film.

title: Still a Good Movie, Disappointing DVD.
review:
Well, I just saw AWTR again, and I have to say that I still enjoyed it.

You will either buy into the love story or not. Mandy Moore is good, but Shane West really gives the better performance. In all fairness, the movie does have some flaws. There were a lot of editing mistakes that should have been corrected. Jamie and Landon fall in love too quickly. I would have liked more scenes between them before Landon declared his love for Jamie. And finally,the movie really deviates from the book. They should have used more scenes from the book, which is superior to the movie. THE DVD IS REALLY AWFUL!!! There are no deleted scenes. I don't understand how a movie that was fairly successful could not produce a DVD with better special features. I highly recommend the movie, but rent or borrow the DVD.

title: The Best Movie Ever!!!!
review: I saw this movie last week...and it is the greatest teen romance movie ever...its so hard to explain how good it is...but its good...im so obsessed with it...i wish they could make more books or movies like this story...i recommend this to everyone that decides to watch it...

title: Cute, touching, but dont expect too much
review: This movie had a very similar plot line to many other teen movies.... infact, it was a lot like "Here on Earth"!!  Although, a walk to remember was better than here on earth because it was more real and touching i went into the theater not having big expectations and wound up thinking it was enjoyable!  it def doesnt deserve any awards, but it was entertaining Plus, Shane is HOT!!!!!!

title: Wonderful
review: I just saw this movie on DVD.  Excellent, the plot was wonderful and the two main characters worked well together. Their evolution is entirely believable.  I would recommend to all!  The music was incredible.  My two teen age girls just loved it!

title: a walk to remember is a tearjerking drama about truelove and dreams...
review: I loved this movie!Although I do have to say that im not the biggest fan of Mandy Moore, I now have renewed respect for her.She played the part of Jamie Sullivan quite well. I was very impressed by Shane Wests'acting .He played a very good and convincing Landon Carter. I am now a huge fan of his, he is one of the best looking guys in the movie industry.I don't usally like movies like Crossroads or shes all that I thought that this movie would be alot like that so i was very suprised and impressed.

title: Great movie
review: This movie is a very touching movie and I think that everyone should now rent it.  The DVD is hilarious with the commentary by Adam Shankman, Mandy Moore, and my beloved Shane West.  I think that this movie really will touch everyone and since I have seen it like 20 times I think that everyone should take a chance and experience it.  The book was great and I think that the director helps captivate the book through the movie.  Although I am a teen and this is a teen romance, my parents loved this movie and so did my younger brother.  This movie isn't just for teens, it is for the whole family.

title: The best movie in the world
review: A Walk to Remember is a kind of movie that you could bring your parents to, but don't want to.  While watching the movie, you'll be wondering why your boyfriend can't be like that.  'A Walk' is a movie about a rebellious teenager who gets in trouble with the law and is charged with, what seems severe to him, is minor punishments.  Landon, Played by hottie Shane West, is the eighteen year old on the wrong path of life who in the end, finds out what true love really is.  Pop sweetheart Mandy Moore takes a break from her singing days and tries acting.  In conclusion, she was great(better than both Mariah Carey and Britney Spears).  Ms. Moore plays Jamie, the sweet and ugly-beautiful daughter of the town's southern baptist church. She helps Landon with his lines for the school's spring play which is one of his punishments.  When the play is over, the most unexpected thing happens, Landon falls in love with Jamie.  When his friends find out, they play a lame joke on Jamie but end up losing Landon as their friend.  This is only part of the movie and the rest is the parts of the story that give the movie away. To sum it up, A Walk to Remember is a sincere film about two teenagers who find love that some people don't find in a lifetime.  I recommend that you see this movie and love it as much as I do. It is a true 10 out of a 10.

title: It is the sweetest movie i have ever watched.
review: I love this movie. I will watch it again and again and not get sick of it. I love Shane West and i think he is so good looking i love him like my boyfriend. I think Mandy Moore is a very beautiful and talented actor and singer and should keep up the work. Also Shane west is a great singer and song writer but about the movie all i can say is it is the best romantic drama movie ever.

title: Titanic? The purr-fect love story? Whatever!!
review: This movie is without a doubt one of the best movies I have ever seen. The love in this movie makes you feel awesome. They made some mistakes(thank you shane west, mandy moore, karen jazen, nicolas sparks and adam shankman for pointing them out!) this movie makes you say "Titanic?Huh? what are you talking about??" They are sooo good. Shane west is awesome, so much better then in oceans eleven. it's much better to see Mandy moore as a star instead of a witch, like in the princess diaries. The singing is superb, and It's sold out everwhere. 20/10 for amazing acting, amazing guys, and amazing clothes. I think you have to be mad to not enjoy this movie.

title: A beautiful movie
review:
Just saw this movie and I have to say I was pleasantely surprised. I dont usualy cry when I watch movies like that but this one made me, just couldnt resist. The story may not be anything too original but the acting and the music is great (they just match together really well). This Mandy Moore girl did a great job if you ask me and she made me wanna watch more movies with her in it. Gave it a 9/10

Guys, girls, and especially couples go see this movie, you wont be disapointed. Guys it will made you do anything for you girl!

title: Get out your hankies...
review: I was pleasantly surprised by this movie.  My gdaughter wanted to rent it and I hesitantly popped it in to the VCR.  After a few minutes I was drawn to the innocence of Mandy Moore's character vs the arrogance of the IN Crowd.  It is a familiar storyline, but something sets it apart. There were 3 generations of us watching and all of us were crying at the end.

title: Tear jerking, but awesome.
review: I agree with the other guy that posted, I'm a tough looking guy, tattoos and all that. I didn't go see the movie in theaters for some reason or another, but I decided to rent it for a date I had the other night. Awesome movie, I'm not a bubble gum pop fan, but Mandy Moore is a very believable charecter and acts her part well. Shane west also puts in a killer performance (for once ^^) which complements both of them in the movie. So we start watching, and around the middle of the movie (I wont say what happens for those of your who haven't read the book or seen the movie) it was ME reaching for the tissues. I don't cry, not a funeral, not at movies, and I ended up in tears for the rest of the movie and most of the night after. I don't really care who you are, if this movie doesn't touch you somehow, someway, you need to take a look at yourself. 10/10 must own movie.

title: Standard, but innocent
review: Surely this film has the best of intentions -- the Drab Girl proves to be wonderful, the Bad Boy with the heart of gold reforms, the Cool Kids regret their cruelty when they begin to reform, faithfulness is promoted as a virtue (how common is that these days?), and astronomy is billed as a great way to pick up girls!  There is some objectionable dialogue (family-oriented readers be fore-warned!), but only one overly coarse scene.  The reasons I didn't particularly enjoy this movie were simply the amazing triteness of the plot, the low-caliber acting skills of the main cast, and the ineffective dialogue.  I'm glad that it is so popular -- there are many, much more harmful films out there -- but I can't help wishing it were generally of better quality.  A sweet, simple story -- but it rivals most high-school productions for mediocrity.

title: Really good, but not like the book
review: A Walk to Remember is a really good movie.  It is nothing like the book,at all, but us a really good movie.  The sadness is really heart-felt in the movie, which I didn't think it would be.  Every thing that happens in the movie has a reason, unlike many movies.  Although really sad, this movie is also funny at some parts too.  I really don't care that the critics didn't like it, and i don't think you should either.  Mandy Moore does a perfect job of being a Plain Jane, despite her good looks, and Shane West acts perfectly like a stuck up rich kid.  I really liked this movie, and I think everyone else would too.

title: beautiful movie
review:
I admit that I had low expectations when I saw this movie. I didn't like Mandy Moore, because I thought she was to "cute". Also, I had just seen Britney Spears' "Crossroads" and was expecting Mandy Moore's movie to be similar.

Seeing this completely changed my idea of Moore. She definately had the acting talent and passion for the role that Britney had lacked. I look forward to seeing Mandy Moore in future movies.

I have to say that I really loved this movie. I love sad romances, and this one had me crying my eyes out.

I hate the way critics dis this movie for the way they picked beautiful Mandy Moore to play plain Jamie Sullivan. First of all, they did a very good job of de-glamorizing Moore, and second of all, Jamie was supposed to be plain, not ugly. The way I saw it, Jamie was not the "loser" who gets stuffed in trash cans and has food thrown at her at lunch, she was just the plain-Jane, invisible loner.They needed to pick a pretty girl to play her because in some scenes, Jamie is supposed to be pretty.

Don't let harsh critics or the somewhat corny title stop you from seeing this movie! You will be missing out on a beautiful story and wonderful acting. I give this movie a 9/10

title: LOVE THIS MOVIE
review: I LOVED this movie! It was an adorable tear jerker. Shane West and Mandy Moore were TERRIFIC, one of the best movies of the year! I give it 100 thumbs up! This is a movie everyone has to see!!! This is a beautiful, love and drama flick, that will just tear your heart out and make you cry.

title: It's great!
review: I really liked "A Walk To Remember". Shane West is a such a hottie and Mandy Moore is a decent actress. This was such a sweet and romantic movie. I totally recomend it. I do think there was too much swearing at the beginning, however. All in all, this movie was great and I really liked it!

title: forget it
review: "A Walk to Remember" by Nicholas Sparks was an amazing novel that warms the heart and soul. The movie "A Walk to Remember" with Mandy Moore and Shane West was the movie it was made into. I wish I could say the same about how great it was and how it left me with the same feelings the book did but I cannot. This movie left me extremely disappointed and feeling sorry for Nicholas Sparks for ruining his precious novel. I know that when directors make a movie out of a novel the words "based on the novel" always are shown but I still cannot see how they could have even said those words. This movie doesn't even take place in the same time period. I knew from the beginning scene something was terribly wrong with this movie. I was so disappointed at who they chose to play the part of Jamie Sullivan. Mandy Moore does not have any acting talent and should stick to being a pop singer. I'm so sorry, Mr. Sparks that they ruined your wonderful novel.

title: A GOOD MOVIE!
review: I am a 32 year old male, 6 foot 2" and 250lbs and this movie brought tears to my eyes! My wife talked me into renting it and watching it and I'm glad that she did! Mandy Moore impressed me with her acting ability and Shane West was not bad. The day after I rented it, I bought it and watched it again! I did not read the book so I cannot compare. All I can say is that it is a great movie and I give it a 9!

title: The Best movie ever!
review: A Walk to Remember is the best movie I've ever watched. For those of you who have seen it and don't like it, you'd rather watch The Fast and the Furious. Because you don't like these kinds of movies. A Walk to Remember made me cry from the moment the SAD part happened. I also have the Soundtrack and you know that song from Switchfoot "You" well whenever I hear that song, I always seem to cry. When I saw that movie that same night I talked to my friends and I told them about the movie, and I was crying. You know how the same actors and actresses star in another movie together? Well I hope that Shane West and Mandy Moore will do another movie together. They just did an outstanding job in A Walk to Remember. A Walk to Remember thought me a lot of things that I never knew before. And I think this movie should win another award for it, because it really deserves more then 1 or 2 awards. I know that Mandy Moore won an MTV award for it. GREAT! Even though the movie did have swears for about the first half or so, at least the swears weren't THAT bad. I know I've seen movie like Save the Last Dance and they swear A LOT. I learned that the movie did have a SAD ending to it...but it also had a happy one too once you think about it closely. And I'm not talking about the SAD part. I don't wanna spoil it for others because some of you may not have watched it (although someone did spoil it) But here is some advice "Go and see it if you haven't because it's worth it" When I first saw the preview of A Walk to Remember on Television, I was thinking of something different. Because when I saw it in February, it was MUCH different then I thought it would be. But it's good to imagine. Whenever I look at sites and they keep saying "This is a dumb movie" or whatever, they're totally WRONG!!! Some people just don't seem to understand. I rate this movie a BIG 10/10

title: great
review: this movie is really good! mandy moore is great being a pop star and acting!! not to mention shane west which is a great actor and is really really hott! i love this movie! especially when landon gives mandy her wishes ( be at 2 places at once, and get a tattoo) they couldnt have chosen better actors! this movie desrves a 10/10! every guy should watch this movie and take notes about how to treat a girl, usualy guys dont like these kinds of movies because they cant be as romantic and nice to a girl ! when i watched this movie i cried and so did everyone around me! and again this movie is great!!!!

title: One of the best
review: This movie, or should I say masterpiece, is a film that I have vowed to burn my dvd player out with. The films songs, sung by the talented female star Mandy Moore help set the emotion in the film. I cried the first time I saw this movie and I'm going to cry every time I see the movie. I am now going to read the book to see which one is sadder but this film is now tied with "Scream" at number one on my list. I was never a love story type of guy, but now that I have see this movie, I can say that love stories of this caliber are great. I can not put in to writing how much I loved this movie and how much it changed me after seeing it. I like to thank Nicholas Sparks for writing such an emotional book. Shane west feeling was almost real, and when he cried,i could stop myself from doing the same. He brought real emotion to the screen. In closing I would recommend this film to anyone with a girlfriend who you are in love with and would do any thing for.

title: Nothing new here, but well-done and Mandy Moore is totally believable.
review:
Mandy Moore is a beautiful young girl and seems to be a natural actress. Here she plays the daughter of a strict preacher (Peter Coyote), and she herself is a spiritual person who does her own thing in high school, pursuing her list of things to do, while not worrying what the shallow students think of her. Takes her hand-built reflector telescope into the cemetary at night to view the heavens. Tutors other students. Sings in the church choir.

SPOILERS -- She and her dad have a secret. She is dying of lukemia, and her "list" is really the things she wants to do before she dies, which isn't very far away. Number one on her list is to get married in the same small church in Virginia where her parents were married. Circumstances get her and the popular but dangerous guy into common settings, tutoring, the school play, and ultimately she "makes him want to be a better person", shades of "As Good As It Gets". He has to spurn the old friends to move on.

As she gets more sick, and it is obvious her time is very short, he proposes and they do get married in the small church, she dies, he goes on to college, he gets accepted to medical school, the things he put on his list after meeting her.

There are absolutely no new ideas in this film. Its charm comes in the way the characters develop, and the truly wonderful acting by Mandy Moore. It is a good story, of what true love and devotion is, rather than two kids just trying to get in bed as soon as they can. The film doesn't preach, but it does touch the subjects of belief in God and the value of real relationships. In my book that kind of film deserves a high rating. I thoroughly enjoyed it. Not a perfect movie, some scenes didn't ring true, but overall I really enjoyed it.

title: THE BEST FILM EVER!!
review: Everyone can ignore what "I think the movie sucked cause i have no taste in good films!" said. To tell you the truth i didn't wanna see the movie because Mandy Moore was the main character, but her role and the way she performed "Jamie Sullivan" was impressing. I cried everytime i saw the movie...lets just say that i saw that movie everytime i wasn't busy with rehearsal. (so at least four times). It was soooooo sad. I'm glad they didn't have a "happy" ending, even though it had,in a way  a happy ending. Anyways... anyone who has not seen this inspiring film should see it!!! TRUST ME and all the other awtr fans.

title: Love will find a way
review: This movie was amazing.  It had me in tears even though I knew the ending before renting it.  It is on my top 5 list and has changed my outlook on life.  Mandy Moore and Shane West are wonderful.  It proves that love will find a way and fate does have something to do with it.  You just have to believe.

title: made me cry all night
review: my gosh a walk to remember is the best movie i have seen in ages. i watched it this afternoon and i've been crying all night it was so good. parts of it were really sad which is why i've been crying. mandy moore did a great job acting. and shane west is really hott and hes a great actor too. i really recommend this to teens and women. cuz this is a real tear jerker if your the kind of person who cries during movies. i love this movie! and i definately give it like 8 of 10 stars. (i didn't give it all ten cuz they kissed alot and it was pretty boring seeing them kiss every other sentence.)

title: Good...if this was the only movie in the world.
review: This movie has the word cliche written all over it.  The writers just HAD nothing else to write about.  No creativity.  Okay.  Just because some girls were crying doesn't mean all of them were, including me.  I went to go see this movie with my friends.  By the time the movie was over, two of my friends sitting next to me were asking for tissues, while I was laughing my head off.  I mean, there really is no plot to this movie.  There's no moral, no beginning, no ending to this movie.  No conclusion.  When the credits start, with good movies I usually just stare at the screen and ask myself, "It's over?" and go through an overview of what the movie was like.  With this movie, all I said to myself was, "Yes!  It's over!"  And the music, especially the theme song, Cry is so phony.  I used to actually like Mandy Moore until she did this movie.  I haven't seen Here On Earth or Love Story, but I could tell by the plot line that this is so similar!  Predictable plot, bad acting, typical teenage movies.  I was just wondering...did people produce this thing for lack of better entertainment?

title: I luved it!
review: I just luv this movie!!! Shane West is SUPER hot and that was pretty much the reason why I decided to see it the first place! But once I watched it I totally feel in luv with the story line! It SO sweet! I'm obviously the typical girl and its definatly a chick flick but I luv it! Give it a chance if you haven't seen it, see it, you wont regret it! I give this movie a 10/10.

title: Great romance that makes you want to be a better person.
review: I just finished listening to the commentary by Skankman, Moore, and West, and I was trying to reach them with this message to address a few comments that they made.  Hopefully they will read this.  First of all, I think many people knew about why Landon was doing the things for Jamie (because they were on her list).  Secondly, I am a mother of 3 and was so happy to watch a movie that didn't have cussing and sex in it, but looked at the issues realistically. Not ALL high school students cuss and have sex.  It is an encouragement to all to see Mandy's character showing how people can be good.  Sure kids are tempted and have desires, but not ALL give in.  I think we need more movies like this one to set an example of how kids should behave and treat others.  This movie dealt with many deeper issues than the love story, but I loved that part too.  I cry every time I see it, and it truly is an encouragement to my children and me.  By the way, I am a Christian and was not offended by any of the scenes.  They were realistic and they showed how to deal with behaviors that some view as inappropriate. It is an encouragement for all to be better people and make a difference in their lives.

title: A strong movie compared to other recent chick flick
review: I don't understand all the criticism against this movie.  Yes, the story was corny and slow at times, but the acting was strong, the plot had meaning, and the music was great.  If anything, buy the soundtrack.  I seem to remember all the criticism against a little movie called A REBEL WITHOUT A CAUSE.  Now what, three decades later, that movie is considered a classic with standout performances by James Dean and Natalie Woods.  No way am I comparing A WALK TO REMEMBER to REBEL but there were some similarities that I enjoyed.  Shane West had a break out performance and Mandy Moore complemented him very well.  Personally, I think West carried Moore on the acting part of the movie but Moore carried West in the "Do we care?" part of the movie.  I wasn't a big fan of Mandy Moore before but now, I have nothing but support for her.  I can't wait for her next movie and might even consider renting Princess Diaries.  A WALK TO REMEMBER is definitely a DVD worthy purchase and I'm off to Best Buy right now.

title: The greatest
review:
This movie changed my opinions in some things:)

i've watched it 4 times within 3 days.. i just love the story and Mandy Moore rules!!!

love her songs too.. wish i could get her album or the movies soundtrack from someplace:))

go go go:))

regards. Raino from Estonia

title: take nothing for granted !!!!
review: Another true feel good movie in which one person's intervention can change another persons in a positive or negative way.A brilliant job done by a very young cast.

title: A wonderful story of true love and inspiration
review:
"A Walk to Remember" is based on a novel written by Nicholas Sparks. I have read the novel and have seen the movie, and while each is different in its own way, both are fantastic.

This movie is very emotional - exploring the relationship between two teens in North Carolina. A relationship not based on sex or lust, but on love and salvation. Moore and West embodied the characters of Jamie and Landon perfectly. Their performances draw the viewer into their lives - seeing the looks in their eyes, the emotion in their voices, the heart wrenching feelings that are evident as the story progresses. The viewer sees Jamie opening up her world to let Landon in = and sees Landon change as the love Jamie has for him grows deeper and stronger with each passing day.

The performances of the entire cast are wonderful - Peter Coyote as the Reverend / Jamie's father is the epitome of what a Southern Baptist minister looks and acts like; Daryl Hannah as Landon's mom is enjoyable - although I am not sure what to make of her dark hair!!!

This movie pulls at the heart strings and leaves an impression on the viewer that will remain for a long time to come -- an impression of what true love really is all about, how wonderful it is to find it, and how much it is to be cherished - whatever comes.

For all the hopeless romantics, this is one to add to your collection....

title: I fell in love with the movie!
review: I think that the movie A WALK TO REMEMBER deserved the Grammy, I mean what about Harry Potter and Lord of the Rings? Weren't they movies based on books? OK so A WALK TO REMEMBER may not be that modern or totally computer generated but it makes you fall in love all over again, who could ask for more? On the casts alone, it was perfect! Mandy Moore+Shane West=The Perfect Couple! Hey, I know I'm right about that plus, the soundtrack alone lures you to the story. My fave was "Only Hope" and "Cry". And I must admit that although the movie only lasted 1 hour and 30 minutes, every second was worth it.

title: Walk?
review: Hm, let's see now - some scenes in this film were NOT easy for me to sit through. I had to slide my cap down just to avoid seeing some characters humiliated. It reminded me of Love Story and Here on Earth but overall, this movie gets a ? from me cos I am just not that sure what to make of it. It is not for some people. Go rent Summer of '42 when you can or Henry Jaglom's New Year's Day.

title: Heartwarming heartbreaker.
review:
I actually came close to tears on this one. Which is pretty rare. The most recent movie to make me cry in probably the last ten years is RIDING IN CARS WITH BOYS. Shane West does a pretty good acting job here and so does pop star Mandy Moore. This film is much better than what I was expecting. I was expecting another mushy romance story with characters that always make the wrong choices. But this is an intelligent romance with a moral.

The story was a little original with believable acting from most of the actors. While I didn't really cry or anything, I did get a little moved at certain parts of the film. When we find out the bad news, I really wasn't expecting it. It came sort of like a shock to me. But, all in all, everything turns out good. The ending wasn't really a happy one, but atleast it wasn't a sad, depressing one. A WALK TO REMEMBER gets 5/5.

title: A amazing movie
review: This movie makes you think of life. What you could really do and learning in life and about faith. Some critic's said it was bad but i would have to disagree. THis movie has held a fanbase of teens and some adults that get what the movie was trying to display, trying to teach it's viewers. All i have to say is that it made me think and cry and it is a great movie for anyone to see.thank you.

title: To Those Disillusioned European Males Out There...
review:
I've read some negative comments about this flick coming from European (especially British) male reviewers. Pretty much, what they have to say is that the movie sucks because it is either totally unbelievable or a `remake' of `Here on Earth.'

Now, I'm a male, I'm European, and I grew up in Europe. I think I have an idea or two on why European males consider this movie totally unrealistic. Let's get to the core of the issue here.

The plain truth is that Christianity is a mystery in Europe, especially for the new generations. Girls like Jamie Sullivan in Europe are like white flies (even among the evangelical Christians that I know over there!); therefore, when your typical European guy sees this movie, he'll be thinking, `This thing does not make sense'

See, the truth is that Europeans can relate more to the girl of `Here on Earth,' who does not have any problem betraying her boyfriend with the main character of the flick, or with the girl of `Autumn in New York,' who does not have any problem flirting with the male lead after five seconds she's known him (and going to bed with him after fifteen minutes), even though the guy could be her father and actually had something going on with the girl's mother a few years before.

See, those kinds of creepy things are perfectly acceptable in a movie for your average European guy. But, when you see the pure and innocent love story of `A WALK,' they say: `Already done.' Already done? Really? A love story where two teenagers do not go to bed and yet show the greatest intimacy you can see in a movie, where the guy blesses his girlfriend with total love without expecting anything back, just for the sake of making her whole. You've seen this in many movies? Really? Ok, I'll tell you what. Name one other recent movie where you see the kind of unconditional love, purity, innocence, redemption, forgiveness, and spiritual growth (the average European guy will want to look up the words `spiritual' and `growth' in the dictionary, since he's probably not accustomed with them) that you see in `A WALK' Since, this story has been done so many times, you won't have any problems naming at least one other movie, right? Oh, and please, do not come up with a movie like `Life as a House.' I saw that one, and it falls under the same category as `Autumn in New York' and `Here on Earth;' movies that want to win my heart by showing one aspect of love while showing lack of respect for all or most of its other characteristics.

One final word of advice for your average European guy out there: look up the word `love' in your dictionary. Too many years of European cultural influence might have led you to confuse it with the words `Lust,' `Selfishness,' and `Sex.'

fscinico@yahoo.com

title: Pompous poop
review:
It's clear from the commentaries on the dvd that everyone working

on this film really tried hard and meant well; but, oh dear, the result

is sentimental and lightweight, so completely cut off from the

realities inherent in its story that it's just hopeless.

It's a measure of just how far it is from narrative credibility that this

movie makes 'Here on Earth' (Chris Klein, Josh Hartnett, Leelee

Sobieski), which has a nearly identical storyline, look like it's a

well-acted and well-written drama. If you haven't seen 'Here on

Earth', you'll have to take my word for it that I'm being rude about 'A

Walk to Remember'.

I've no idea whether Mandy Moore fulfils her potential here, but

Shane West has done much better in 'Once and Again', even in

'Whatever It Takes'. He promised a while ago that he wasn't going

to do any more teen movies, and on this evidence, the sooner he

takes on a role that really stretches him instead of just relying on

looking cute or mournful, the better. He has shown signs that he's

going to develop into a really good actor - but you have to look hard

to see it here.

This film does have one merit: it can be an object lesson in film

schools, to show why sweetening a story too much and lightening

the story's elements to avoid upsetting anyone at all, in the

process losing all contact with the value and emotional core of the

original story, leave you with a film that's worth a lot less than the

effort that's gone into making it.

title: Excellent Movie, like Book
review:
The Book "a walk to remember" of Nicholas Sparks is excellent romatic novel that I have read in 2000.

But, I read this movie is not good in critics at movie sites. Average RATING is 5/10. And many critics say "Mandy Moore's Second choice of cast is no good(failure). So, I have no desire..

But, the movie "A walk to remember" is a more excellent drama movie that I have ever seen.

Mandy Moore's role of Jaimie Sullivan is great, and I don't Know she is that girl of jealous cheer-leader in Princess Diary (2001). In this movie, Mandy is not a follower of Brit. Mandy is more excellent than Brit in Crossroads (2002).

And Shane West is bright actor..

This movie is full of romantic atmosphere....

my rating : 9.9/10

title: Terrific
review: This movie was absolutely terrific.  It was a lot better than I ever expected it to me.  I wasn't sure that Mandy Moore could do both acting and singing but she has shown me she can.  Shane West was also wonderful in it. This movie will make you laugh, cry, but it also inspires you.  It inspires you to do what your heart says and to have hope no matter what.

title: GREAT Movie
review: It is a great movie. It is  also very sad but you enjoy it at the same time.I love it.Mandy Moore was great and Shane West was perfect for that part.They all were good at there parts.I hope to buy the movie as soon as it come out. I LOVE IT AND I HOPE YOU DO TOO.

title: What a pleasant surprise!
review:
I have to start off by saying that i am not a fan of the Pop princess scene, but what a pleasant surprise A walk to remember turned out to be! I watched this movie by default and all i can say...again...is wow! Manday Moore, the last in the line of Pop teens to hit the scene is absolutely wonderful in the role of Jaime Sullivan. She deserves to be given credit for a job well done. As a previous user mentioned, they always seem to cast the beautiful in the role of the dowdy-but-soon-to-be-hot role. No one can say that Mandy moore is beautiful, but never in the movie is she so polished and greased up. She looks natural and it's all so believable! Her acting was really good, and she handled the emotional scenes well - could've been better, but it was ok.

Aaah, then we come to Landon, played by Once and Again's Eli Samler. Excellent. I loved him in this role, the emotional scenes was really moving and i found myself teared up ALL THROUGH this movie!

I would recommed this to anyone. I've gone to see it twice already, and i'm planning on buying a copy as well.

By the way, th soundtrack is great too. Tell me you cried through the ply scene when Jaime was singing Only hope???? Come on, admit it!

EXCELLENT!!! A must see! Oh, and kleenex is essential!

title: an amazing,beautifully cast and life mirroring movie...
review:
To be honest, by now, i have seen this movie for the 4th time. you may think this is way over or im just plain stupid. i didn't watch this because of Mandy Moore nor Shane West. this is a movie with a religious ingredient but not exaggerating and conservative. it proves its romance without a sex scene (which is in most romance movie these days).

People who think this movie is no way near good, unfortunately they failed to see its meaningful, life mirroring message. let's not deny the fact that its highly predictable and typical. but if you try to watch it a different approach, get into the characters (this is when i began to cry, i actually dwell on Jamie's character-not sure how did that happen), then you would know what i mean. the scence when Jamie confessed she was "sick", there were tears in my eyes. my tears hang in there, and then when she came to see Landen and began to apologise, i wiped my eyes. i thought that was the highlight of it. then when Jamie said "i'm afraid not to be with you" i just cried. i maybe a cry baby, but this movie has brought tears to many. in fact most people stayed crying (girls) till the end of the movie.

I was disappointed to the ratings it received from Australian critics. i mean yes, maybe not the best movie of the year, but i strongly suggest for them to watch the movie again. the soundtrack was awesome! i just couldn't let go of it, everyday i listen to it. and everytime i hear mandy moore's songs, scenes from the movie pops in my head. i have brought soundtracks from several movies i have also seen more than once but none of them reminds me of the exact scence in the movie when it was played. i must admit the songs blends perfectly to the moments in the movie.

Mandy moore deserves that MTV Movie award for such surprising and amazing role and acting! i almost forgot its mandy moore i was watching.i can't wait to have my own copy!

title: Very sweet and emotional.
review:
I just saw 'A walk to remember', and thought it was such a sweet, emotional uplifting movie. It was a touch of beaches meets romeo and juliette. Very dramatic yet so sweet to the heart to relate to a modern adolecent audience.

Very true to the fact that i myself am a guy and i was sitting in a cinema by myself full of young girls who saw this movie with the exception of a few reluctant boyfriends who got pulled along i'm guessing! I'm not the kind of guy who cries at movies. In fact to date no movie has ever made me cry, (hence forth the 'cold hearted' nickname my friends gave me.. haha. I am though a sucker for romances and dramas, just haven't found a movie so strong) although 'A walk to remember' made my eyes moist. Prehaps it's because i could relate to the characters - or that the actors were so believable with emotionals. Either way, the way they all related to each other thanks to a great story, fantastic acting and well timed editing/directing .. the movie really took hold of you.

My sincere applause to first time actress Mandy Moore, and a very convincing Shane West.

title: A Performance to Remember
review:
There's no doubt that Mandy Moore (blondie turned brunette) really put heart and soul on her performance in this movie. With this, she has surpassed her "competition" (Britney Spears, Jessica Simpson and Christina Aguilera) by way too long. Now I know why she won her MTV Movie Award as Best Breakthrough Performance. She has started her acting career with the right foot.

Shane West seemed to have helped her a lot. There was plenty of compatibility between them. His performance was also good (probably because of his previous appearance on the melodramatic TV show "Once and Again").

And finally, the story itself was very good. Sad and touching, though.

The songs performed by Mandy Moore herself, help people to catch the mood of the movie. One thing I can assure you: every time you hear a song from her, this movie will pop into your mind from now on.

One last advice, if you have a weepy heart: have at hand of box of tissues, or a napkin (the same thing if your significant other is right next to you).

title: Excellent - As Far as Movies Go...
review: I read the book, and the book was definately better... but as far as movies go, it was excellent!  Be sure to SEE THE MOVIE FIRST so you won't ruin the experience...  Once you see the movie, THEN read the novel and you'll get the most from each :0).

title: Beautiful
review: It was much more then I expected. It's not just another teen love story, the unpopular ugly girl with the popular hot guy... It's more then that. It has nice songs too. A very beautiful and touching movie to watch with your bf/gf.

title: Perfect romantic movie
review: Wow. This is a truly excellent film, really moved me. Really interesting script, perfectly assembled. The actors do a great job in this movie, not a single flaw. The movie is about this guy who is cool and popular in school, has lots of friends, but maybe not an ambition to get somewhere with his life. After he gets caught doing some illegal stuff he gets punished by the schools janitor. He has to act in a play, tutor young students etc. On his assignments he meets Jamie, a strange religious girl who is the daughter of the reverend in the city. Then slowly his life takes a new form...

title: great movie
review: First of all, I have heard a lot of people saying this is not a good movie and I want to tell you people that you are wrong because this movie has everything, good music, good actors, and the most important thing that it has is a good story. It is really sad and that it what mostly makes it a good movie. I define a good movie that has true things happening in them and this was a great example. There are many people like Jamie and Landen out there. Well I really hope you get a chance to see it so you can see for yourself that it is one of the best movies ever!

title: Stunning Movie
review: The book was amazing and usually the movie doesn't come close, this however, was the exception to the rule. The movie stays true to the book and it is absolutely worth watching. Mandy Moore is a great actress as well as singer.

title: Cutie
review:
It's a cute love story, great for valentine's day ;-)! Now seriusly it's a great movie and both Shane West and Mandy

Moore were great in it, they do have chemistry after all... It almost made me cry and I almost never cry... Though I liked the book better then the movie it's still very good...

review: At I was very reluctant to see the movie but my brother encourage me to see it and i was not disappointed.  In fact, after watching it I bought the soundtrack (the songs are really good and Mandy is fantastic in-Its gonna be love), the movie also and now I am about to buy the book. title: i want to read the book!!!
review: Wow!!! at long last, we've watch a walk to remember.if you guys, just dont know the history of that movie with me and my friends...we've waited so many months just to see that movie.Here in the philippines, the movie have been rescheduled for so many times and at those times we try to go to movie houses and check if the movie was out.well....as for me and my friends...our "waiting" has paid off...not because we've seen a new story, but because mandy and shane had managed to do it..simply amazing.Maybe the story is not so unique, in fact the story is so predictable but of course there are points wherein we really appreciated.The movie was so open about religion, and thats the reason why it is some sort of a special film.because movies now a days are not that spiritual.....and also the songs are so good...it is highly recommendable...

title: Unbelievably Emotional Roller Coaster Ride!
review:
First off, let me start this by saying that the critics reviews of this film absolutely appalled me. Their reasons for these ratings appalled me even further! Critic called this film "so saccharine covered it will make you want to lose your lunch" and so "sweet and innocent it will make your blood boil." I guess a film with a lack of sex, drugs, and violence (although there is violence to a small extent) might really throw people for a loop. ..Apparently, emotionally-charged, wholesome films aren't enough for the medias insatiable appetite for obligatory breast-shots and sensless blood-shed. I mean, don't get me wrong, films such as "Boogie Nights", "54", and "Scream", all of which contain violence and/or nudity/sexual content, have all made their way onto my top 20 favorite movies of all time. I enjoy them just as much as the next person, but this film was a huge change of pace from what I'm used to seeing on the big screen these days.

I went to see this movie with high expectations for it to be a sappy teen romance, one that might even make me tear up a bit (I'm a sap for romance, i.e. "Bounce", and "Pearl Harbor"). What I got was so much more. SO much more. The film opens with a sequence that may mislead you a bit. I sat in my chair for the first 10 minutes thinking, "Oh great, could this be any more of a stereotypical teen flick?" Although I love movies like "Whatever It Takes", "10 Things I Hate About You" and "Boys and Girls", somewhat less-than-innovative teen flicks, I wanted more out of this one. It quickly begins to better itself with the introduction of Mandy Moore's character, Jamie Sullivan. In a very "Carrie"-esque fashion, she's the pretty "ugly" girl (another thing critics couldn't over look) whom everyone makes fun of and you feel sorry for. There is something special about her right from the very start. There are so many layers to her character and you want to get to know them all. By the end of the film, you do.

Throughout the course of the film, some of the most romantic movie moments in history (in my personal opinion) take place. See, Jamie has a to-do list, and as her and Landon (the incredibly cute Shane West) begin to fall for eachother, he tries to complete her list one thing at a time. One thing she mentions is how she's love to be in two places at once. So, he takes her to the middle of the road one night and tells her to stand in a specific spot. When she asks what's going on, he tells her she's straddling the state line--she's in two places at once. . .Now, call me a hopeless romantic, but I think that is the sweetest thing in the entire world (and my favorite part of the whole movie). He also proposes to her so they can get married in the same church her mom did (another wish on her list). By the end of the film, your heart is tied in knots and you don't know whether to be happy or cry. Jamie eventually unveils a life-altering secret to Landon that changes the pace of the entire film. If you get emotional easily like me (I cried in the first 20 minutes of "Scooby Doo" when the gang breaks up.. .), you will be as heartbroken as Landon. The film ends with a very vague feeling, and when I walke out of the theatre, I knew I couldn't wait to see it again. . .and again. . .and again. . .

Mandy Moore's acting is exceptional, if not better. I think she's an incredibly talented singer and now, I respect her totally as an actress ("Princess Diaries" just made me want to slap her). Shane West as always was great. We really get to see his range in this film. And the supporting cast does a fine job. I don't think this movie could have been any better! Since the movie, I bought the soundtrack, read the book, and already have my copy on DVD preordered at Amazon (July 9!!!) Please, ignore critics thoughtless reviews and check this amazing little film out for yourself. ..I highly reccommend it!

title: Surprisingly Moving and Touching
review:
Yeah, yeah...the storyline's been done before. Even some of the dialogue sound familiar. And yes, the score at the end dripped with too much melodrama to be effective.

But you know what, despite all that, the movie still works. It had me, and a good number of the audience, teary eyed at the appropriate moments. It had me smiling like a dork in the joyous moments of the film.

For me, what made this movie so effective was the performance and chemistry of the leads, Shane West and Mandy Moore. They made celluloid romance look real and sincere. Their emotions and feelings were palpable. The film and the actors gave one of the best depictions of real love. There is maturity and innocence in their actions. And that's what makes this movie different from other run-of-the-mill romance movies.

Mandy Moore really surprised me at how effective she was in conveying Jamie's innocence and strength of character. Her sweet face and graceful manner make her almost otherworldy, but she still manages to reach out to the viewers and tug at their emotions as if she was someone they knew all their life. I believe we'll be seeing more of Mandy in Hollywood which I think is a good thing.

Shane West is another revelation. He had the difficult task of showing Landon's growth from aimless youth to self-assured adult capable of self-less love. And he pulled it off. His subtle performance made Landon's transformation believable and does not suffer a single awkward moment. Like Mandy, I hope we see more of Mr.West in Hollywood.

Others have complained that the story is too squeaky clean and it's totally impossible that two teeners could be so controlled when it came to sex. Well, guess what...there are responsible teen-agers out there. They just don't get enough attention since most of Hollywood think that only sex will sell to a young audience. The box-office performance of "A Walk To Remember" certainly disproves that. Young people, adults and grannies alike enjoyed this movie. It's about time that Hollywood showed another kind of teenager. The kind that you can admire.

As for the comments that this one was just another "Prety-ugly-girl" movie where the heroine is just waiting for a make-over...well, I don't know what movie you were watching but "Walk" was definitely not it. Jamie was never ugly to begin with. She just didn't dress right and did things that were "unusual" for other kids. All that branded her as an outcast. And where is it written that being pretty ensured popularity in High School? That's a fallacy. Lots of pretty girls in high school but they weren't popular since they didn't have the right friends, the right clothes, the flashy attitude or other things that made one popular. The Jamie character was that kind of pretty girl. She had the pretty face but had a strong sense of self to not be concerned with superficial things. Again, that's what made her different. And she never had a make-over in the movie! She stayed true to herself til the end.

Congratulations to Shane, Mandy and the filmmakers of A Walk To Remember! It was a risky move to go against the mainstream of sex and violence in films. But judging from the user comments in this site, you guys did the right thing. This is simply one of the best movies I've seen in a long time.

P.S. The soundtrack is excellent as well. Listening to it brings back images from the movie and one can't help but be emotional when hearing the tracks.

title: an inspirational movie that will make you cry and smile at the same time
review:
The book A Walk to Remember was, no doubt, one of my favorite books. It's a moving tale of hope, faith, and love. When I found out that they were turning it into a movie i was down right agitated. In my mind: "Hollywood will butcher this..." After watching the movie (For the third time now, if i may add =] ), my faith in films (those based from books) have been officially restored.

The plot is simple: A jaded, rebellious young man (Landon Carter) unexpectedly falls with a sweet, religious girl (Jamie Sullivan).

But the experiences each character undergoes makes the movie simply beautiful. The simple things they do for each other will truly leave you smiling and probably even complaining why you yet to find that kindof love. Hehe...

Shane West's performance as the soul-searching Landon Carter was fantastic. I don't know how he does it but the simple tug of his mouth, forming a smile, or the slight squinting of his eyes makes you "feel" what he feels. The scene where he clung to his father in desperation left me bawling my tears out. Mandy Moore played her role beautifully. After Mariah's Glitter and Britney's Crossroads, it was refreshing to finally see a singer who can actually act!

All in all, the movie is worth every penny you pay for it. Sure, it may be flawed in some ways, but everything else makes up for it.

Truly a beautiful movie.

title: It would be a greater movie if Mandy Moore wasn't in it
review:

title: Great Movie!!!!
review: They taken a great book and made it into a great movie.  A walk to remember is a wonderful film.  The movie is Great for men and women I saw the movie 4 times at the Theater.  And Shane West and Mandy Moore they are great in the movie.  Well acted excellent.  Like I said before the movie was great I loved it.  I give it 5 Stars *****

title: A positive response.
review: I saw A Walk to Remember last night at the Melbourne premiere and was impressed. The movie was extremely emotional and managed to avoid for the most part resorting to old cliches which would have detracted from the overall feeling. Rarely does a film successfully make the audience care about the characters to the extent that this film does and that would be in large part due to the actors, specifically Shane West and Mandy Moore who were perfect in their roles and were deserving of the recognition they recieved at the 2002 YOUTH HOLLYWOOD awards. Shane West is consistantly a great actor and Mandy Moore does not deserve any 'pop star turned actor' criticism as she is obviously talented in both areas. As for Mandy Moore being too attractive to play a wall flower, its not how one appears that decides how they are percieved, its how one acts and as Jamie, Mandy Moore exudes the perfect balance of emotions to pull the role off. Overall an amazing film.

title: Mandy Moore played a plain Jane well
review: I was at first hesitant when i heard Mandy Moore was playing the lead female role in this movie.  Nicholas Sparks is one of my favorite authors and I remembered how great the book was and just wasnt sure about seeing Mandy as a plain Jane.  When i saw the movie i was amazed.  She played the role so well!!  I couldnt believe how well she did, she is a girl of amazing talent and I hope she does take more roles on like this.  When she sang in the movie thats when i realized Adam Shankman really did have the right girl casted for this movie.  I couldnt see anyone else playing Jamie Sullivan. The movie is sad but well done and Shane plays Landon Carter well. The bad guy turned good seems to fit him well.  Over all the movie was well acted and is by far my favorite book turned into movie, movie.

title: Awesome Movie!!
review: I love this movie! Its number 1 on my list! Shane and Mandy did a great job with making it, and they have awesome chemistry on set. They are two young talented actors. Not that its the reason why I like the movie but Shane is so hot!!

title: Absolutely loved it
review:
I was fully expecting your standard fare teen movie (coming-of-age kind of thing) but this was entirely not what I expected. After the first 10 minutes of the movie had me convinced I was going to see another John Hughes-type film, the change in direction that this film took me in was entirely a welcome and most enjoyable surprise. I highly recommend this film to people of all ages.

No spoiler here, but I thought the "Don't fall in love with me" line would come back into play in some manner, but certainly nowhere near the way in which it did finally come into play.

title: Wonderful!
review: I really loved this movie.  I had read the book before watching it, so I had some sense of what was going to happen, but I was not expecting the acting to be as good as it was.  I was also worried that the book wouldn't be followed accurately enough.  But all my worries were pushed aside as I began watching.  Mandy Moore does an amazing job portraying Jamie, the preacher's kid, and Shane West was great as Landon, the rebel as well.  This movie deals with realistic teen problems without having to cram in a ton of sex and vulgarity.  I recommend it to anyone who wants to see it, and don't forget to take some kleenex, you'll need it.

title: without mandy moore, a walk to remember = worst movie EVER
review: Hats off to Mandy Moore who looked great and put on a great performance...I dont know why she chose this movie when she is given such an interesting character but THE WORST lines in the world.  I liked this movie more the first time when it was called HERE ON EARTH!  which btw handled the storyline a million times better.  Shane West was not bad, but buddy, hit the weights!  I think critics and anyone who can see past what little appeal this movie had would agree, this movie could have been improved and made 100x better.  Worth seeing if you have nothing better to see or if the only other option is Mothman Prophecies, which both rank up there as BRUTAL.

title: Captivating! *Possible Spoiler*
review:
When I first saw the commercials for the movie, I thought it was going to SUCK - especially because of Mandy Moore. But then I decided that if you can't judge a book by its cover, how can you judge a Movie?

SO I went to Amazon and read all about the book, and stupidly read to many of the reviews therefore finding out what happened [because you know you have 2 kinds of reviewers a) those who hated the book and/or want to spoil it for everyone else and b) those who are to stupid to know that the word review is not a synonym for SUMMARY] then I ordered it. I'll be getting it tomorrow, I think.

So anyway, Unbeknownst to me I decided to go see the movie a couple of days ago, only I never got there -- then I thought, why not just wait till I read the book. But I ended up thinking about it and really wanting to see it each and every-time I saw an add or commercial.

So I went and I really liked it. I'm not going to even start to compare it to something like titanic -- because of course there is no comparison, but for its type and genre, it was pretty damn good. I've definitely seen a lot worse.

It had me in tears in after like scene 1 [incessant tears lol AKA constantly crying] but then again I'm a Sap. The kind of girl that cries at Cartoons, Disney Movies, Books, TV Shows, everything lol. I was probably born with tissues in-hand.

Yes, there may have been some cheesy writing and even cliches, but is there really ever not cliches in many movies? How can there not be cliches, everything is only original ONCE - after that if its ever done again its considered a cliche: If Joe Schmoe wrote a script and had someone kill someone by pushing them off a boat and that was an original idea - then 12 years later Jane doe had the same idea, only altered a little - that would be cliche, right? but should she get criticized for that? I don't really agree, maybe she feels that that is the best way for her script/story to go. I'm an actress and a writer, so I do understand how that can be.

Shane West gave an awesome performance as the Not-so-Arrogant Landon Carter. Peer Pressure and Logic conflicted this slightly "troubled teen" as he bounced between them like a child on the giant inflated trampoline-like carnival ride. But eventually Logic took over, as well as Emotion. The girl that was shunned not only by him, but by his "friends" was soon the girl he found himself falling for. This same girl he knew for 12 years, never even spoke to and felt she could be summed up in mere sentences.

Mandy Moore's performance was not as awful as I first assumed, infact it was pretty good. Portraying Jamie Sullivan, The Ministers Daughter [a very small town with only 1 Minister] in other-words, a very straight edged "goodie goodie." She sings in the choir, partakes in such after-school clubs as Stars and Planets, Drama, etc. She never Dates, Has hardly any friends, etc. She's your quintessential "perfect" daughter. [As for Mandy:] I mean, she's definitely No actress - but she didn't bring the Movie down like I thought she probably would.

Overall, this was a sweeet Movie, "cliches" and all. If you're a sappy crier like me, bring tissues or make sure you get napkins at the concession stand lol.

I look forward to reading the book, and seeing the movie again. And while I may be in the minority, I say that if you have even the slightest notion to go see this movie, then you definitely should. :)

Any Questions, Comments, Whatever. Email ME :)

title: Cute movie
review: I read this book back in the summer, and I remember looking on IMDb to found out if any other Nicholas Sparks' books had been made into movies.  I was thrilled to see that in a few months I would be able to sit and enjoy another's interpretation of this entertaining book.  While the movie does deviate from the story a bit, it was well done and still stuck to the basic premise behind the book.  Another factor that helped me like the movie is that even though Mandy Moore is an attractive young woman, she was not displayed that way for most of the movie.  The makeup/costume people did a fine job of making her look plain, while her sweet voice made her appear to be the shy, reserved girl we all knew in high school.  Although I prefer the book to the movie (flashback over 50 years, more concentration on Jamie's religious strength, etc.), this movie is definitely worth a watch for you Sparks' fans.  A fine performance given from West and Moore.  Their on-screen chemistry was wonderful.

title: Mandy Moore is good, HOWEVER
review: I thought Mandy Moore did a wonderful job in her first leading role, but this movie was just a mess.  First of all the editing was so poorly done. I counted at least 5 scenes that should have been left on  the editing room floor..they seemed to be there is just a filler and it really frustrated me. I would have enjoyed seeing more interaction between the two lead character.  There were too many scenes with the characters that we care or know nothing about. And not to be shallow but I would have liked to have seen a little bedroom action.  They showed the dorky friend simulate a raunchy sex act...why couldn't we have seen a little more intiment moments. This movie could have been  better if it were not thrown together ...maybe to beat Britney Spears movie to the box office??

title: A well-meaning but untimately unsuccessful movie for me...
review:
***warning, spoilers!!!***

After reading the book, I may have set my sights a bit too high. I understand that it's harder to make a good movie than a book, but this movie is a major disappointment, even though they should have credit for at least trying.
