Knowing that it's set in the nineties instead of the fifties, I sensed that something was seriously wrong. (with so many "90s" based movies in the market, making another movie is like walking thru a minefield of cliches!!!) The opening scene was unbearable, with the rapid-fire acting you'd expect from apprentice actors. (it's okay to have smart one liners, but it just goes on too long!!! Even kids in real like don't talk so much trash at such a speed. Maybe they were struggling to get those lines over with. *hint* The black guy does something really stupid; yet another cliche.) The reason for the kids doing what they did in the first scene is never explained.

It doesn't get any better. The lead of the story, Landon Carter, who was framed for the previously mentioned stunt, GETS A LEADING ROLE IN A COMMUNITY PLAY!!! What kind of punishment is that!? There is also many many instances, when swear words never should have been used.

Of course, Carter and Jamie Sullivan get closer and closer every scene. Again, the circumstances they meet is as fake as I could imagine, involving a church choir scene where Jamie seems to be the only one that sings decently. Carter's friends, especially the black guy, crack some great lines, but most of the time they are schizophrenic (inconsistent in their personality), and in their efforts to ruin Carter's and Sullivan's "relationship", they pull off a high school prank that is lame, even by high school standards. Again, WHY THE HECK THEY SCRAP ALL THE DETAILS IN THE BOOK? This is a complete mess, although there's a moment of relief in the community play scene, when Moore, playing Sullivan, goes back to doing what she does best.

Meanwhile, the guy playing Jamie's dad is as stereotypical as hell. However he gives a surprisingly good performance when explaining to Jamie about what boys are like (he takes his time, using only one line.); that scene starting off awfully enough.

The second half of the movie are a series of scenes which seems to be borrowed from every teen movie made since the stone age. And the result is awful. Not only did I not know what was going on, (then realised nothing was going on, since those series of scenes didn't make any sense) but the line "I love you" was used like twelve times, each times decreasing in sincerity, that the very last time it was used, I heard the guy next to me just groan and cuss. The emotional equivalent for running for touchdown, even though you never had the ball in the 1st place.

To top it all off, Many Moore's performance is just outright DISGRACEFUL. She just doesn't cut it as a preacher's daughter. Maybe it was her lines. Or her lack of emotion. Maybe both. Whatever. My take is that if you're going to make a movie based on a good book, FOLLOW THE GOOD BOOK. That is a good first step. And Mandy Moore should take more ACTING CLASSES!!!

BTW for those people that say this movie is for "stupid 12-year olds", your snobiness is showing. What 12-year-olds? We know your grown-up tastes are "superior". *hint* *hint* Cut it out.

title: mandy's great
review:
I kind of got roped into going to see this with my sister, and thought why not, at least Mandy Moore is in it. I must admit that at first I thought it was corny, with the illness and the wedding, etc., but I wanted to get the whole story and read the book (a very good and quick read). After reading the book you really get a better idea about the movie and realize that it is not a typical teen movie. The story isn't about a puppy-love crush or the big dance. Admittedly it shares many themes with other terrible teen movies, but that does not link these movies into some cheap "genre". Many of the adaptations for the screen hurt the story, and in that sense help to justify many of the negative reviews. The best adaptation, and one that I feel really makes this a good movie, is the time frame for the two main characters to fall in love. The book offers a very real sense of urgency, which is expected because Jamie is going to die very soon. What happens in only a matter of months in the book translates very well into the time frame of less than two hour movie. It didn't feel forced or choppy to me, but something that could be completely natural.

A word about the acting. I think that Mandy Moore could have a very promising career as an actor. After reading the book I think she played the role of Jamie perfectly. She portrayed that sense of endless exuberance and faith very well. I also think that Shane West did a fairly good job. In watching him perform, he seemed portray well the way a guy would act in certain situations, e.g. with his buddies, with Mandy and her father, etc. He acted in a way a real person would act in the same situations, which to me is most important.

Bottom line, with this movie and with any movie, if you can take something good out of it, then it was worth it. A good movie is one that can personally get you involved in it. Too many people go into a movie with the task of only trying to recognize and point out its faults without actually just watching it. There are too many cynics out there who can't wait to dump a movie into the teeny-bopper genre just because its actors happen to be teenagers. Save your reviews for Britney's movie "Crossroads."

title: Hollywood NEEDS CLEAN Good Refreshing Love stories like this !
review: What we need more of in Hollywood: good honest CLEAN romantic LOVE stories, not SEX stories. A movie for all ages and both sexes, with GOOD VALUES, UNSELFISH LOVE. A movie with themes about REAL Love, Family values, peer pressure, being yourself in spite of everyone else, giving unselfishly, a good Christian movie with REAL values. We NEED more like this ! ! Great acting by Mandy Moore & Shane West, Peter Coyote and all ! Jamie Sullivan is a "Real Hero" and Role Model we could all look up to, a fine one for our young people to be watching on film. The world needs more of this type of inspiration. Mandy Moore played this role to perfection. The entire audience loved this movie, and I heard comments like "This is my favorite movie I've ever seen" on the way out. Sorry I didn't have my Kleenex, it brings out the emotions.  GREAT Date movie, GREAT Father/Son movie! GREAT Church group movie ! Even great to go see by yourself, but nicer to share with someone you love, that loves you !

title: Excellent
review: I thought that this movie was so good.  I have not seen a guy treat a girl so good.  Landon did everything to make Jamie happy and more guys need to be like him. I also think that it was so cute how he changed his whole life around to be with her.  He learned to dance, made new friends, and built her a telescope. I am going to see this movie again and again.

title: A definite must see!!!
review: I absolutely loved this movie.  It was one of those movies that you come away from wanting to see again and again.  Sure I am a hopeless romantic, but this movie had so much more than romance to it.  It definitely was not your typical predictable teen movie.  Mandy Moore and Shane West, I thought, did a terrific job.  I was pleasantly surprised by Mandy Moore especially. So for all of you out there who like that feeling when you come away from a movie that your money was well spent and for those you are looking for a great date movie especially, this is the movie for you.  Don't listen to the critics, judge for yourself!

title: AMAZING.
review: This movie was SO SWEET. The love between Landon and Jamie is the kind of love that everyone hopes to find. He's so sweet to her, it made me cry so much. I've read the book, and usually I think that when a movie is based on a novel, the novel is always better, but this movie was a lot more moving than the book was. Mandy Moore is beautiful and angelic. Shane West is SEXY and he played the part so well. It looked like he really loved her and you could feel the emotions they both were trying to portray. It was the best love story I've ever seen.

title: Please go and enjoy this movie!.
review: See it again with a friend.....tell others how much you enjoyed it, don't let it get lost in all the other so-called Action movies out there!.   My hubby of almost 42 yrs. and I saw this movie over the weekend, and I'm glad I took some tissues,   we were both using them!.  I think   this movie will stay in your heart for a long time!

title: CORNY, FULL OF CLICHES; IT DOESN'T MATTER!
review: This movie was very good. It was corny at times, with scenes you sometimes knew were coming. But, the execution of these scenes were very well done. Shane West and Many Moore are so in their respective roles and you truly feel for both of their characters. This movie is simple, beautiful, and will defenitely touch you. Nothing more, but certainly nothing less.

title: A touching, lighthearted glimpse into the human spirit.
review:
A Walk to Remember embodies many things that I consider to make a truly good movie. The movie is far from being great, but has so many endearing qualities that make it undeniably worthwhile. Mandy Moore plays a very convincable and strong-hearted young girl who seems to understand who she is and what her heart desires. The teen singer, along with fellow actor Shane West, put out strong, memorable performances which make you hope to see them in more films in the near future. They tackle the job of portraying teenage roles that actually fit the life of real teens, rather than, as Roger Ebert puts it, (being) "reminded that many teenagers in movies seem to think like 30-year-old standup comics", and they're good at it.

3 1/2 Stars, personal rating; 9 out of 10, IMDb rating

title: Must See Movie
review: Even though this movie might be another normal love story.  I think the movie was great.  If you didn't like it which some people probably won't then you shouldn't have gone.  This movie is for Drama movie lovers.  The people that like the sad happy endings.  Well, I hope you go see the movie and enjoy every moment of it.

title: A non-formula teen movie
review: A Walk to Remember was a teen movie that didn't follow the regular "Teen Movie Formula."  Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore) wasn't a pretty-ugly girl, she was a plain girl who was outcasted for her strong belief in God that she let everyone know about and Landon Carter (Shane West) wasn't the typical popular jock that tried to change the non-popular girl.  While faith in God did play a part in the movie, it wasn't preached to the audience.  If you want to see a movie that isn't your typical teen movie and has actual depth to it, then this is the movie for you.

title: Beautiful Movie!!!
review: This Movie was made excellent! the morals and everything to it was good. Good screen of actors..as well!! I rate everyone to see this movie a MUST!!! Stupendous Movie!! Excellent soundtrack as well!!

title: GREAT MOVIE!!
review: WOWWWWWWW!!! what a movie!! i thoroughly enjoyed this movie. i saw it last nite and i couldnt get over it! Shane West and Mandy Moore did a fantastic job in the movie. it was a great love story! i would recommend it to anyone!!!

title: Remember the kleenex!
review: I work at a theatre, and I've been seeing the trailer for almost a month. Of course I instantly wanted to see it!  I took out the book first and read it.  It was wonderful, and I prepared myself for the movie.   It is HIGHLY enjoyable!  I adored it.  Mandy Moore did a wonderful job, and Shane West... besides the fact that he's pretty much gorgeous, he played this part SO well.  I hope to see them both in future movies!  = )   You HAVE to go see this movie!

title: Excellent
review: A Walk to Remember is definitely a Movie to remember. It's an excellent movie to see. I've heard many say that, this is just another teen movie and it's all the same from the other ones. This is NOT just another teen movie or a chick flick. I thought it was a great movie for everyone to watch. It has many great lessons that you can learn from it. I was very inspired and very proud of the cast and how the emotions were shown on film. If you guys haven't seen it, I recommend you take some friends and see it!

title: A hack job
review: I just saw "A Walk to Remember" and, as a lover of Nicholas Sparks' work, I am severely disappointed at how much the major plot line was changed. While it was still a good movie, it was butchered almost beyond recognition. The whole circumstances as to how they come to be together and fall in love was changed so drastically that it is unbelievable.  It was changed from a very heart-felt, passionate novel to a movie geared towards teens to make them feel sympathy for the ugly duckling.  I repeat once more.  I am severely disappointed!

title: Awesome!
review: I have just seen this movie and I gotta say it brought tears to my eyes! Whoever says that this is just another teen movie doesn't understand anything about movies of this type. They certainly don't know what it's like to live what the main character went through. But for the people who have been through the kind of harrassement that Jamie Sullivan did, know exactly what it feels like. No matter how many times writers make up stories like this one, each is unique in its own way and each represents a real aspect of everyday life among teenagers. It represents a tough period in their lives, for those who know exactly what this movie shows, some people just can't understand it because they have never been through such a thing. This movie deserves major credits and I for one give it a 10/10! Mandy Moore shows her ability as an amazing actress!(Oh and just a little side note, for those who say that she has no business in acting I got a question for you....YOU THINK YOU COULD'VE DONE BETTER??? NOT) She shows real emotions and real character power in each and every scene. She will go far in acting and this will not be the end of seeing her on the big-screen! This multi-talented girl will keep going and going.

title: This movie was everything I expected and more...
review:
This movie was everything I expected and more...

I went to this movie expecting a sappy love story, but I came out of it having remembered a powerful lesson.

I saw this movie yesterday and it is still playing over in my mind, it has made me think in a big way.

The story of Jamie and Landon is not a new story, what starts out as friendship turns to something more, and then of course there is the major drama which I will not divulge. I love how Landon is a better person for having known Jamie and in the end it affects everyone around them.

Another thing I was very impressed with was the soundtrack, I dont usually pay attention to such things but in this case I did, probably because the music throughout the movie is bands I already listen to. I also went out and bought the CD just to hear the wonderful mixture.

I hope this movie does well, its rare to find a movie that sticks with you and makes you think for days after. Or at least not thinking theres 2 hrs I wish I could get back.

I felt sorry for the people I saw it with though that did not *get* the movie. They said it was just a lame rip off of another movie that came out a few years ago, and though I did not see that particular movie I think they were wrong I and I feel bad that they couldnt get past the fact that Mandy Moore was in a movie.

title: A Real Tear-Jerker
review: I saw this movie on opening night, and honestly could not believe how good it was.  I went in expecting it to be good, but not to have an exciting ending.  I was totally proved wrong!  This movie has everything a chick flick should include.  Love, betrayal, and a total twist that you would not expect.  The acting is incredible, even the guys might like this one.  I do for-warn you, bring your kleenex.  This movie definitely deserves an 11/10, and my recommendation for you everyone!

title: A beautiful movie
review: I just saw A Walk to Remember and I have to admit that I normally hate sappy teen movies.  But for whatever reason, this one was really moving. I could really feel the love and chemistry between the two characters which is extremely important.  Shane West did a great job and looked very sexy, and Mandy Moore was superb for her first leading role.  The music was wonderful, the story excellent, and the actors, sensational.

title: Wonderfully Suprising
review: When I saw the preview for this movie, I thought it looked pretty good, but I didnt expect much out of Mandy Moore.  My friends and I decided to have a girls night out and see A Walk to Remember.  Much to my dismay, it was extremely good.  It made me want to just sit in a ball and cry.  I discovered during this movie how talented Mandy Moore is.  Not only can she sing, unlike some other "pop icons" she can actually act, and very well. However, not only Mandy had a great performance.  Shane West was breathtaking as well.  So after leaving the movie, and wiping all the tears off our faces, my friends and I were very suprised at how much we liked it. It was so great!! 8.0/10

title: Definitely memorable!
review: This movie has been bashed because of its sentimentality, which I think is unfair. Yes, this movie has a heart, but it is not too sappy. I found it touching and very well done, and I gather that was the general consensus as the entire theater erupted into applause in the end. I thought the parts were well acted and the characters were developed, along with a beautiful plot. The music is an extra adornment that adds to the mood. Mandy Moore did surprisingly well, considering that she is a pop star-turned-actress. (Not that I'm prejudiced at all.) I would definitely see this film again, and recommend it to friends.

title: Total Chick Flick, but above average for a teen movie.
review:
I thought this movie was very sweet, it does have some of the cliches of a teen movie, but at the same time it had a much deeper and more powerful story than most teen movies. Some of you are saying that it's a typical "pretty ugly girl" movie, where the popular guy takes on the mousey girl with glasses, big clothes and a bad haircut and underneath she a babe. And yeah, it's clear that Mandy Moore is no "ugly girl", but it's not like she changed her clothes and cut her hair, she was still the same person at the end as she was at the beginning. Can you name any other "pretty-ugly" girls who didn't change their entire being by the end of the movie?

And I would also like to inform everyone that being pretty doesn't make you automaticly popular in highschool. I knew plenty of girls that were a pretty as any of the "popular" girls and their Friday's night were always free. And many of the "popular" girls are popular because they play a lot of sports, wear trendy clothes, have nice houses to party at, and it didn't hurt to be a little bold with boys. They weren't necessarily popular because they were nice or pretty.

Anyway, I'm done preaching. I liked this movie pretty well. I think Mandy Moore's a decent actress and may have a promising career when she done teen bopping (I think she one of the better teen queens and she's not a ho, unlike a certain singer whose upcoming movie was previewed at this one, and after the 30 seconds I feel like I saw the whole thing)Shane West was also really good, and real cute too. It's no masterpiece, but it's sweet and a good debut for Mandy.

title: I HAVENT SEEN A MOVIE THIS BRILLIANT IN A LONG TIME ~! ~!! ~!
review: MY FRIEND AND I saw this movie and both agree it is excellent.  I couldn't believe how much we both cried.  Amazing.  The movie is superb.  I have reccommended it to many people.  Many Moore was great along with SHANE WEST! He was profound.  I was really shocked on how much i personally enjoyed it b/c it is labeled as "teeny bopper"  movie BUT IN ALL HONESTY  it wasn't. It's one of those movies you want TO OWN and that you would PAY FULL PRICE to see.

title: Leave your cynicism home and enjoy this movie.
review:
This movie received a poor review in a popular New York tabloid. I'm glad I didn't let that sway me from going to see it and, if you've read the same review, I hope it won't keep you away, either. The two hours flew by and, miraculously, even my seven year old sat through it with nary a trip to the candy stand. Two high school seniors, Jamie Sullivan (a very brunette Mandy Moore) and Landon Carter (Shane West) begin this movie with absolutely nothing in common. Jamie is the Reverend Sullivan's daughter. She's sweet, studious, religious, innocent, keeps to herself, and not only is NOT in the "in group" but seems to have no friends whatsoever in the small town where she and Landon have both lived their whole lives. Landon is street smart, a poor student by design, has doubts about God, dates a fast girl, has a lot of friends. Landon also has a chip on his shoulder because his father, a cardiologist, walked out on Landon and his mother some time before.

The movie begins with Landon and his friends pulling a dirty trick on another classmate involving a jump off a tower. The classmate gets injured. Landon gets caught and is "sentenced" to, amongst other things, joining the cast of a play in which Jamie is also involved. After initially resisting his involvement in the play, he enlists the help of Jamie to learn his part but keeps their relationship, however tenuous, a secret from the rest of his friends. However, his limited exposure to such a sincere, truly good and spiritual person (Jamie's yearbook ambition is to "witness a miracle") does impress him and, indeed, even haunts him. He slowly loses his cynicism about life and people and tries to better himself... all because of her influence, of which she in unaware. In the meantime, he has broken off with his popular girlfriend and she, sensing the growing feelings Landon has for Jamie, sets Jamie up as the butt of a horrendously cruel and very public "joke". Landon comes to her rescue and the romantic relationship between Jamie and Landon begins. And it is truly a beautiful, albeit innocent, one. But Jamie has a secret which clears up, to the viewer, many of the questions they may have about the level of maturity she exhibits which is well beyond her years.

I loved this movie because I would like to believe that it could happen. The depth of love between these two young adults is as perfect a love as could be experienced on this earth. Only a very deep cynic, one who has lost all faith in the possibilities of unconditional love, could write this movie off as "sweet" or "predictable". Don't let that be you.

title: THIS IS GREAT
review: i just saw the movie and it was great. It made me cry and laugh.This movie is so way better than the book. Mandy Moore is a great actress she is wasy better than britney spears and her movie "Crossroads". Shane west was hot and mandy moore was great. the movie touched my heart and this not another chick flick. I went to the movies witha lot of my guy friends and they said the liked it and it was funny. The had some bad language so what i didn't get when the rated it PG this should have been Pg - 13.

title: amazing movie
review: I saw A Walk to Remember and its really good.Its not a teeny bop movie...its better then that!....i cried like a baby...a 4 those who say this movie is horrible because its teeny bop....dont  talk before u see it! Cause the movie is great!..and mandy moore is an amazing singer AND actress...and shane west is soo hot and a talented actor!

title: Boring, predictable, unrealistic, and just plain STUPID.
review:
I am a fan of movies with plot twists. This is exactly why I hated "A Walk to Remember". For the first half hour to 45 minutes of this movie, it was somewhat enjoyable and entertaining. Then, there was a turning point in the movie. It became nauseatingly predictable.

At first, I was only able to predict the ending vaguely, but as the time went on, I was able to pinpoint every detail of what was to happen next. A few times, I was even able to tell, word for word, what a character would say next. Since I am not a psychic, and I am usually horrible at predicting the endings of even the most mediocre movies, I would say that the fact that I was able to forsee the ending to this movie is enough reason not to go see it.

If predictability is not enough of a reason for a person to skip this movie, I can list a few other, more minor, cons: both of the main characters have crooked teeth (that just bugged me the whole time), the plot was totally unrealistic, something about Mandy Moore's speaking voice makes a person want to rip their ears off, and you could much better spend your $5.00-$8.00 by renting "American Beauty", "Miss Congeniality", "There's Something About Mary", and/or "A Goofy Movie", which happen to be true classics.

I would only recommend this movie to insomniacs. This movie's lack of plot twists should put you right to sleep.

title: Hollywood's attempt to recreate a fantastic book
review:
The film "A Walk to Remember" was a decent attempt to recreate author Nicholas Sparks's book of the same name. However, this Hollywood adaptation changed several small aspects of the film, creating large discrepancies between the two that those who read the book first will most definitely notice.

The actors tried their best and did extremely well, considering the lackluster script they were handed. The director, Adam Shankman, took a leap of faith in moving to a project so serious, compared to some of his earlier work, like the comedy "The Wedding Planner."

Mandy Moore played the innocent to perfection. Shane West was a good 'bad boy' but a little stiff during the emotional parts of his character. Peter Coyote was an excellent Reverend Sullivan, although the shots of him were a bit strange at times. Darryl Hannah remained in the background as West's mother, but her appearance was quite strange, due to an obvious wig and collagen lip injections.

All in all, Shankman and his crew did their best to adapt a book set in the 1950's for a 2002 audience. I only wish they could have stayed truer to the actual novel...

title: Ugh
review: Yeah, that's basically all I can say: Ugh. I truly did not like it. It was pretty stupid. I was surprised it was only rated PG, but that's not the point. I give Mandy Moore the credit she deserves: Her acting may not be Oscar-caliber, but it is fair. Why didn't I like it? It was boring and it had a lot of drama for really no reason. To sum it up, don't waste your time seeing it. See a better movie, like Lord of the Rings, Black Hawk Down (if you can handle a good deal of violence), or A Beautiful Mind. Once again, I stress A Walk To Remember is a waste of acting, time, and money!

title: A Must See!
review: Contrary to popular belief, this movie is not at all a movie that is made just for teens. The roots of this movie will run deeply for people of all ages. It concerns life, love, faith, death, and all that is in between. A very good movie, I recommend it to anyone and give it a big A+

title: Read the book
review:
A Walk to Remember was, in comparison to the book, somewhat disappointing. Although the essence of the story was established by the movie, it lacked the book's serenity and changed Jamie Sullivan's role.

There were some casting and acting problems. Shane West did an amazing job portraying Landon, but his mother was obviously miscast. Mandy Moore exceeded my expectations in acting, but she still was not quite the Jamie that we all know and love. Jamie's dad did not portray the reverend very well at all. Jamie's character is supposed to be a perfect person. She is ridiculously nice, and she is never mean to people, even when they are mean to her. In the movie, Jamie slipped a few times, making rude comments on at least two different occasions. This rudeness was a little surprising.

Overall, the movie is reasonably entertaining, but cannot do the book justice. For all of you who liked the movie, but have not read the book, you are missing out on the wonderful story that A Walk to Remember is. Read the book.

title: touching movie
review: I saw A Walk to Remember the night it came out. Mandy Moore and Shane West both are so talented and did such a great job in this movie. Nicholas sparks is a great author and the movie is done so well.i recommend everyone to go and see it.it really touched me and i am definitly going to buy it.

title: Truly Excellent (VERY SPOILERISH. SPOILER!!!!!!)
review:
Such a good movie! I was beyond skeptical at seeing this since it seemed from the trailers to be a "Glitter/Crossroads/The Wash/How High/all the other notsotalented singers trying to act" movie and granted, there is the obligatory scene where JAmie does sing, but still i was so surprised by this movie. Although slightly predictable (eg the disease, etc..) it was still highly enjoyable. Loved it!!!!!!!





SEE THIS MOVIE!!1

title: A Movie To Remember
review: This was a wonderful movie that stated the power of love. It is different from all the other love movies because the relationship these two shared was not about sex like all the others, it was about the love they had for each other. A Walk To Remember is most certainly a movie that will be remembered.

title: so emotional
review: ok, yea im a 15 year old girl and i love teen movies.. but this movie was not just for girls like me.. i went went with 2 guys.. and yes.. they both cried and they both believe its a really good movie.. we've already planned to go see it again! yea.. it was so easy to relate to.. especially seeing as i have someone to kinda relate to it.. but yea.. it was awesome i recommend anyone who is reading this TO SEE IT!

title: This is the type of movie teens should want to see.
review: This was a great movie.  No gratuitous violence, No sex, No blatant cuss words.  This was a good clean movie which left you with an uplifting feeling.  I was more than happy to take my 13 & 17 year old to this movie. I am very tired of the "teen" movies out there which make teens feel that experimenting with sex is good.  Bravo to Mandy Moore & the makers of this film.  Good job!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Finally, a movie about teens that's not a "teen movie"
review: "A Walk to Remember" reminds us that characters under the age of 20 can be mature and complex, or grow to be that way by the end of the story.  This is one of those stories that makes you want to be a better person.  Although there is an abundance of predictable moments, it's nice to see a movie that doesn't include every crappy part of reality.  Movies are a form of escape and this one shows us what we CAN be, not what is expected of us.  Mandy Moore really pulled off the role.  Although she has natural beauty, she was never "made over."  It is obvious that she is never overloaded with make-up and Landon falls in love with who she is, not how she looks.  I was pleasantly surprised by her acting ability, I saw Jamie on the screen, not Mandy.  Also, I've been a fan of Shane West since "Once and Again" began and have been waiting for someone to give him a great role for him to show off his amazing talent and versatility.  From beginning to end he completely transforms as a character and I can't wait to see what role he'll take on next!  This is sure to be a springboard for leading roles in major movies for Shane.  "A Walk to Remember" takes us back to a time when movies were what you WANTED life to be, not what it WAS.  Congrats to the amazing cast and crew (and author Nicholas Sparks)for bringing this wonderful story to life and restoring hope in Hollywood movies.

title: Awesome movie!!! 5 stars!!!!
review: I read the book A Walk to Remember and could not wait to see it when it came out in theaters.  I was shocked when it only got one star and the critics practically trashed it.  I went to see it anyway.  I loved it!!!  It was put together so nice,everything from the cast to the music.  I gave it 5 stars (or more), but i think critics should have given it at least 3 stars.  It was the best movie i have seen in a long time.  Shane West and Mandy Moore were awesome together! Everybody in the movie theater was crying, including me. In case you don't know what it is about, it is about a girl named Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore) who does not fit in and gets made fun of.  Because of a prank that causes someone to get hurt, a cool boy named Landon Cartor (Shane West), has to be in a play with Jamie.  He eventually falls for her and sees that she has a great personality.  I dont want to give away the ending, go see it, its great!  If you have read the book, it is pretty much the same but it is set in 1996 instead of the 1950's so it is a little bit different.  This movie was so great!  If you want to see a great movie this year, this would be it.  Go see it, A Walk to Remember was the best, i recommend it to everybody!

title: One Of The BEST Movies I've Seen In A While!
review: A Walk To Remember....When I fist started hearing about this movie and seeing the trailers I was just like "awww" how cute. I really enjoy Mandy Moore's music and thought it would be a cute movie. But let me tell you this this move was AMAZING!. I was SOO shocked by the deep emotions of this movie. I was truly in tears walking out. The WHOLE theatre gave a long clapping ending. You have 2 go see this movie. I know most people are like "pop singer, trying 2 be a actress" but its TOTALLY not like that, Mandy does a GREAT job. She sticks to character and she doesnt turn pop singer in the movie. I also recently saw the Crossroads trailer for Britney Spears and if you have to choose between these 2...GO SEE A WALK TO REMEMBER!.

title: NOT what you'd expect
review: When I went into the theater, I expected to sit and watch a movie with an ugly girl with the popular guy that changes her into the prettiest and most popular girl in school.  This is not the case for A Walk To Remember.  The girl never changes her look, she isn't even ugly to begin with, just wears clothes that doesn't reflect the "popular fashion."  The guy doesn't change her, she changes the guy into a better man.  I think the acting is great throughout the film.  Although I really wish that they could have a singer/actress that doesn't have a singing role.  I feel for Mandy Moore because I feel that it does take away from her charactor.  But overall, I really did enjoy this film through an through.

title: The sweetest movie!
review: I am in love with this movie now!  Although I fit in the 13-17 female category that critics say are the only crowd who will enjoy the movie, I'm sure others will too!  I left the theater a large Mandy Moore and Shane West fan!  This movie is officially my favorite movie!  With a sweet plot, I cried through half of this movie non-stop!  My only complaint was what "Not Another Teen Movie" called him--A Token Black Guy--there was one in here that fit the the part perfectly..  Although I am a teen, I wouldn't call A Walk To Remember a teen movie.  Whether a Mandy Moore fan or not, this movie is spectacular!

title: Of all chick flicks, this one is one of the best ones I've seen
review: Personally, I loved this film, but I wanted explain both why it's good and why it's bad, for those who want a reason to see it and those who want not to waste their money on something they don't want to see.  If you want a chick-flick, tearjerker, or date movie, this one is a good choice; also, if you're of the target audience (teenage girls, Christians, or Nicholas Sparks fans), you might like it too. Why it's good: 1) Shane West and Mandy Moore can act, and they have great chemistry together.  I think this is basically why it's better than, say "Here on Earth" (which is what this film is being compared to in other mean, nasty reviews in newspapers I've read so far). 2) It's a HUGE tearjerker!!! 3) It gives you a warm fuzzy feeling, like it gives you hope when you see a character like Jaime Sullivan who's actually a good person. 4) For teen girls, there's always Shane West 5) For Mandy Moore fans, there's Mandy Moore 6) Christians will like the fact that the Christian Jaime is portrayed in a good light- she's also a strong character and has a sense of humour in her comebacks to school bullys. 7) I can't really vouch for how similar the movie was to the book, since I haven't read it, but I've heard, although there are changes that happens with every book-turning-into-a-movie, it stays true to the themes and feelings from the original novel. Now, bad things: 1) It's quite mushy/corny 2) You COULD argue it was done before in "Here on Earth." 3) If you're a male, you could be in a potentially embarassing situation because the audience was about 95% female when I went to the theater. Well, that's my "bad reasons" list.  Yeah, a bit biased, wasn't I?  I have to say, there were moments when everyone was sighing, or sobbing, or saying "awwwwww!"  I guess you can tell I really liked it.  It was good!

title: Very emotional and oh sooo sweet!!!
review: A Walk to Remember turned out to be better than I had expected.  The casting was great, Mandy Moore and Shane West had great chemistry.  This movie was one of the most emotional movies I've ever seen.  It made me sad, happy, and angry, all at the same time.  Overall the movie was great.  The best part of A Walk to Remember was the sound track, it was unbelievable and went well with the movie.

title: GREAT movie...great love story...
review: Well, this movie came out just last night (well, here it did anyways) and I went to see it along with my fiance...at first I thought "Great. Mandy Moore acting... this should rot..." But was I ever surprised last night. This was one of the better movies I've seen in a while. It was great acting...but it was REAL acting. The characters acted like they should have for their age. Mandy Moore really impressed me a lot with the way she played her part... and the writing was so great....uggh it's so hard for me not to spoil the ending because I really want everyone to go check it out with their special someone!!! I couldn't help but want to cry for the last 20 minutes...great flick PLEASE check it out!

title: Much better than it gets credit for
review:
Any person who doubted this movie from the beginning would say it was just a cliche. The story was far from a cliche, and since it's a quality book and not just some movie written for a teen idol, it deserves much more respect. Jamie Sullivan is never an ugly girl, and never becomes pretty, she just happens to look especially nice one night because she dressed up for her performance in the school play. People should stop commenting on it like she got a makeover and then was the most popular girl in school.

It was a story of a girl with a good heart and good morals, who was able to accomplish a lot and make a guy who used to think he was something special, realize what special really means. Mandy Moore did a very good job and proved that if she wants to act, she most certainly has the talent to.

Those who say that people who like this movie could only be Mandy Moore fans or anything else with a negative connotation...are wrong. It was a heartfelt story that was portrayed very well. Whether the actors have staying power is totally irrelevant to the quality of the film. I would never dissuade anyone from seeing this movie, it is very touching and worth the hour and change of your time that you will spend watching it.

title: a really good movie!
review: I saw A Walk To Remember yesterday and I think its a really sweet and romantic movie.  The storyline was great and really moving, and I cried through like half of the movie!  Mandy Moore really is a better actress than most people give her credit for, and in this movie she is awesome!  I totally recommend this movie! *probably its better for girls or people who like really romantic things though*

title: Completely amazing!
review: I had read the book not too long ago and I just saw the movie last night. It was really good!!!  The book is one of my favorites, and even though the book and the movie are slightly different, I love both.  Yes (saying this for guys:it is a chick flick) and I cried.  The story is incredible and Shane West and Mandy Moore portrayed their characters quite well. It is a once-in-a-lifetime love story, that will make you want to see the movie a second time.

title: Surprisingly great movie
review: When I first walked into the movie, my thoughts were it was going to be another stupid teen movie with a singer trying to act. It was the opposite of my expectations. Mandy Moore was great in her starring debut as Jamie. Shane West looked really good(I admit that was my main reason for seeing it in the first place) and delivered a performance with a change that was really convincing. From the point in the alley where she tells him something, I cried. It takes an amazingly powerful movie to do that for me because I am usually not one to cry at a movie. It was a love story, not a teenage drama like so many other recent movies. This movie showed the power of faith and love. I loved it and would see it again.

title: I thought I'd hate it - But I loved it!!
review: It's not often that I would ever consider going to a "chick flick" - in fact I have never gone to a "chick flick" in my entire life... until now.  My wife coerced me; she played the "you made me go to see Predator 2" trump card.  It was either go to the movie or wash the dishes for the next year. I went to see "A Walk to Remember" with her and I loved it.  I laughed, I cried [I'll deny this if asked], I felt so wonderfully refreshed.  This was a simply wonderful movie.   I felt 20 years old again.  I felt like I was in high school again.  Ah first love... it still burns.

title: More than I expected
review:
I read this book over a year ago and it instantly became my favorite book. I began reading all of Nicholas Sparks books and I fell in love with each in every one of them. He became my favorite author.

So when I heard they were making A Walk to Remember into a movie, I had mixed feelings about it. I was excited, but a little cautious. I mean could they transform this excellent book into a movie. As time came closer for the movie to be released in the theaters, I was hearing that it was just another teen flick. This let me down a little, but I still wanted to see it. I wanted to see if it really was a let down or not. So I went to the movies with not to much of high expectations. But when I came out of the theater my expectations were soaring. They did an excellent job making this movie. Though it doesn't follow the book exactly and some things were added and changed, I absolutely loved it. This is not a teen flick, just a movie with teens in it. Thank you to everyone that made my favorite book come to life and become one of my favorite movies.

title: This movie was the BEST!!!!!
review: I have to say that this movie is one of my favorites. Mandy Moore is great, and so is Shane West. Any person that says it sucks is out of their mind. It had a point and a lesson for the viewer, and it isn't a stupid teen movie. Not only is it great but it is also the saddest movie I have ever seen!! Overall A Walk to Remember is the best movie out right now.

title: I wish I could have a romance like this one...
review:
I wish I could have a romance like this one. Love like this only comes once in a lifetime, no matter what others may say. I went to see the movie last night, and I wanted to weep for his tragedy!

If only all guys could be this romantic--he cares for her no matter what, and I became jealous when he took her side after the flyer incident. Compassion like his might only be found in stories such as this, so I hope that whoever goes to see it enjoys the story as much as I did.

title: A Great Chick Flick!
review: There's no arguing that this ISN'T a chick flick.  And I mean that in the best possible way.  It isn't a comedy, there is no violence, no car chases. This is a movie about the heart.  About falling in love for the first time. About those special people who change you for the best, who believe in you and allow you to believe in yourself.  You'll laugh, you'll cry, and will leave the theater thankful for the people who you love and hoping to meet that person who will fall in love with you.  All in all, a great movie.  I was a little wary when I heard Mandy Moore was in it, but she gave me a positive surprise as she did a very good job with her role.  Shane West was also very fitting in his role.  Go and see it if you want to see a movie that reminds you to believe in people.

title: A Walk To Remember Had Me In Tears!
review: I agree with all the people who think this movie was excellent!  I wasn't too sure about Mandy Moore's acting ability at first, at least in this kind of role-but she surprised me, and I think she was FIT for the part of Jamie. Shane West wowed me, too, and the movie itself:  I have read the book, and loved it, and at the end of the movie, I, along with every other person in the theatre, was crying.  It was SO bittersweet, and some of those lines they said-it makes me want to cry all over again!  I encourage EVERYONE to see this movie!! (Warning:  it's mostly a 'chick flick', but guys-you'll like it, too!)

title: A great movie!
review: I recommend this movie to anyone who likes to cry.  I saw it last night and the story was great!  I haven't read the book yet but I plan on it.  Two thumbs up for the movie and two thumbs way up for the performances of Shane West and Mandy Moore.  They put everything they had into their roles, which is one reason why the movie is so enjoyable.  A definite tearjerker!

title: AWESOME
review:
Who would have thought Mandy Moore could act? NOT me. BUT she can!!!

She gave an amazing performance..........though actor Shane West stood out above everyone. It will make you laugh and cry, and WISH that it was you in Mandy Moore's shoes!

The movie has only the very basic plot from the book.........they changed just about everything. Personally, I would have like it better if they had set it in the 1950s like the book. BUT the movie held its own. I LOVED IT!

title: Skeptical at first, but.....
review: Nicholas Sparks' amazing novel is brought to life in this movie.  I was skeptical at first because I was afraid that it would have been slaughtered by Hollywood, but I was pleasantly surprised.  Mandy Moore and Shane West did a great job in the film and I highly recommend it to anyone who has ever been in love.  The character development is spectacular and Peter Coyote and Daryl Hannah did excellent jobs portraying the parents of the teens.  If you get a chance run and see this great movie now!

title: Excellent movie! A Bang for your money!
review: This movie was excellent! It was full of good lessons that we should emulate. It may be corny for others, but for me it really uplifts my spirit. It portrays true love, clean and unconditional. Mandy is really a great actress and singer. I hope she will do better in her upcoming movies.

title: Awesome!
review: I saw the movie the day after it was released.  It was great.  I loved it. I loved the plot.  I also loved the book.  I have it and I've read it maybe 10 times.  I can't wait until it comes out on DVD which is on July 9, 2002. Only about 3 more months.

title: Excellent movie...although a chick-flick
review: This was an excellent movie for both MALES and females, although being generally viewed as a chick-flick.  The plot was awesome....it teaches teens today what to REALLY look for in a partner and in true friends.  I think that they exaggerated Jamie's clothing.  Sure she was conservative; however, they didn't have to put granny clothes on her.  She could have worn modest clothing without the granny look.  But overall, the movie was fantastic.

title: Absolutely Amazing
review: After seeing a Walk To Remember it became obvious that this would be my favorite movie of 2002 without a doubt. The acting is great, no one could have been better for the role of Jamie than Mandy was. She and Shane West had great chemistry on the screen and were so convincing with everything they did. Every moment was vital to the whole effect of the movie, and every moment contained every emotion needed.  After seeing the movie I read the book by Nicholas Sparks and appreciated it even more. Every aspect of the movie brought out what Sparks felt as he wrote the novel in my opinion. If you are to see one movie in 2002 make A Walk To Remember it.

title: a one of a kind, 100% must-see movie!!!
review: a walk to remember is some kind of movie! it talks about life... reality... and true love... i don't understand why shallow-minded people out there got the heart to talk on saying it's gross.. because it's not!  it's just about perfect.. it's what teenagers need, a perfect getaway from all those obscene, pain-in-the-neck movies of today which talk about nothing but sex, drugs,and violence. The movie is just so touching and something most of us could relate to... it's not all the time we encounter a movie so deeply moving as this one!! you'll definitely miss one half of your life if you'll miss it! to all the shallow-minded people out there... get real, would you?

title: Look past the obvious
review: It's a PG movie with a current teen heart throb and a young pop star, with a cheesy tag line on the poster.How great can it be? but i went anyway because hey, i've always liked SHane West since Whatever it Takes.After i left the theater, the movie stuck with me so much, i went back to see it again and again, in fact, an unhealthy number of times. and everytime, i pulled something new from it. This movie was more than just "boy meets girl, young love".  There were many dynamics to the story. It's a story involving forgiveness, humility, and faith.  The movie's song "only hope" sung beautifully by Mandy Moore, written by Jonathan Foreman (of Switchfoot, formerly The New Radicals), is easily interpreted (if not firstly written) as a christian worship song. (Switchfoot is a christian band). The relationship between Landon and his father is parallell to a persons relationship with God, and the way you approach him.  This movie was incredible, and a life lesson.  About how many people you'll miss out on if you limit yourself with first impressions and stereotypes. About having faith in yourself and other people.  Understanding the depth and possibility of love at any age.  A lesson in forgiving others and learning how to humble yourself and ask for help.  So i challenge everyone to put aside their "this is pure candy" remarks, and pull one of the many lessons given here.

title: nothing like Glitter
review: ** oops. be careful, this gives away a little bit of the movie** so glitter got all bad reviews... from just about everyone. don't let that effect you choice of watching a walk to remember. This movie is different, and mandy moore is fit for the part. Not only does she play the part really well, she makes you forget that she is also a pop star. You actually believe that she is a sick patient with lukemia and is about to die soon. She doesn't get all cocky just because she finally bridged the gap between the music and movie buisness. She did bridge the gap but the did it humbily and performed magnificently. Shane West also did a great job. He makes you feel what he is suppose to feel in the movie. And he does such a great acting job to make the transition between cocky popular dude to a caring thoughtful boyfriend really smooth. The audience really does believe that he changed from person A to person B, even though they are as different as black and white. West helps the audience believe that this is true. Please watch it, it won't disappoint you.

title: Mandy moore did a great job
review: I walked into the theater thinking that this was going to be a horrible movie, another movie where a singer who doesn't belong in the acting business, is trying to walk across the thin bridge. It wasn't like that at all. Mandy Moore did a great job, portraying her character. I forgot that Janie Sullivan was Mandy Moore and I enjoyed the movie a lot more because of that. Shane West also did a fabulous job playing his character. Because of his wonderful acting scene, i cried while watching this movie. I highly recommend all of you to watch this movie.

title: Greatness!!!!!
review: Oh my was this movie good! I was bawling at the end! Shane West is soooo hott in it! I haven't read the book but i intend to. So that is about all I have to comment on. If you haven't seen this movie i totally recommend it! Everybody needs a good cry sometimes and this is a good movie to cry to.

title: a very sad but good movie
review: Set in 1950s but for some reason they still have photoshop computers =). Its about this guy who falls in love with the reverend's daughter. He founds out she is dying of leukemia after he falls in love with her. I'd go on but then I might cry =(

title: Excellent movie
review: A Walk To Remember is an excellent movie. It's not just another ordinary teen movie like Down To You or... It teaches us many things in life. The choice of actors is excellent.

title: A Film Whose Story and Principles Rise Far Above Its Flaws
review:
A couple more words on A Walk to Remember and I'm off my soapbox.

1). It's nice to see a movie that isn't afraid of faith, doesn't mock it, doesn't trivialize it, and doesn't criminalize it. Like The Apostle, it dares to be spiritual without being overtly religious.

2). It's also nice to see a movie that dares to portray teenagers as thoughtful, intelligent human beings who think about things other than sex and weed and saying "dude" all the time. In fact, it is a stunningly honest portrayal of adolescence as West's character screams to the world "I'm a rebel, screw you all" but turns right around and says through Moore's character, "that act may work with your friends, but when you're all alone, you know that being aloof isn't really all that fulfilling." Like many teens, Landon knows that but doesn't dare say it out loud... not right away...

3). Is it possible to show the transformation of his character without using "Flood" by Jars of Clay? Jars is an awesome band, but that song was big 5 years ago, and I am the only human on the planet who still listens to that album (though it WAS their best). The kids are listening to Creed and Lifehouse and Sixpence and dc Talk and Plus One now, to say nothing of the harder stuff pouring out of my local station. Christian pop music may have started with Michael W. Smith and Amy Grant, and flourished through Jars and dc Talk and the Newsboys, but the industry has grown up in recent years. The record companies recognized good music when they heard it; it's time Hollywood stopped treating Christians like we spend all our time at Gaither reunions. There's plenty of good modern rock out there, and easily found.

That last bit was a long rant for a 20-second section of the movie, but as a musician it didn't escape my attention. Don't let one nitpick stop you from taking in what is an excellent story, and fairly well told through the actors.

title: A Surprising Vacation from Typical Teen Tripe
review:
I originally walked into this movie as punishment for taking my girlfriend to see Kung Pow with my friends. I turned the tables on her, however, my enjoying this movie, and with good reason.

I have never read the book, and in either case I have no idea what correlation exists between the title and the story, but I do know this about the movie, it is a good story that is competently acted by the principals. Shane West is good at pouting at authority and even better at showing steely resolve when someone dares to believe in him. Mandy Moore easily sells her role as the quiet but confident church mouse, but I think she cheats by having those big brown eyes. The dialog is not perfect but manages to make its point and move the story forward. Personally I think if dialog is "good enough" you need to go back and make it great, but the story itself, while a bit cliched and contrived, glosses over the holes in the dialog.

The movie starts off rather hard-edged and typical of Varsity Blues-type teen movies, but the opening scene is an antithesis to the rest of the story. It is so disjointed that it almost seems out of place, probably because it was not in the book (I'm told), but it can be dismissed as necessary to get us acquainted with the fact that these teens are going headlong down the path to trouble. Once that's out of the way, we can actually start examining the characters.

West seems angry at everybody, probably because his dad left him and his mom is Daryl Hannah in a bad wig. Add his desire to be cool with his friends, mostly by pretending not to care what people think (a dichotomy that only makes sense if you're cool), and you have a kid only to happy to glare at everybody.

Moore is a preacher's daughter who inexplicably sees West and finds in him an inner strength that no one else sees. The film suggests that it's because nobody else is looking for it, a subtle undertone about the times. It goes without saying that they fall in love, and there is a major tragic plot twist in the final third of the movie that has the whole theater blubbering by end credits.

The dirty little secret of this movie is that the story is not about the couple, but about West and his character's redemption. The undertones of faith and charity scream for a religious message, but for better or worse, there is no actual conversion process in the film. I was personally disappointed by this, as it seems to suggest redemption by proxy, which is both unbiblical and impractical, but in an age where religion is immediately and unfairly linked with prosletyzing, it's a compromise I will have to live with.

Having said this, the final portion of the movie seemed a bit drawn out and misdirected. Time spent languishing over the principals, their tragedy and their resolve (a bit mature and dry-eyed for 18-year-olds), could have been invested in West's interaction with supporting characters. In fact, the supporting cast has been sentenced to the periphery in this film, appearing only now and again to remind us that West and Moore are not the only two people on earth. Perhaps truncating the later scenes and replacing them with longer scenes involving the supporting characters would have fleshed them out more, and as a result, made the principals more three-dimensional as well. A good supporting role does not supplant the main story or give the audience something to do between car chases, it enhances the main story. A bit more of this would have made a really good movie into an outstanding portrait of humanity.

I highly recommend anyone who dares to believe, in God, in themselves, in each other, go and see this film. You will not be disappointed. Self-appointed cinema gurus, watch at your own risk. This is ALMOST a great movie. 8 out of 10.

title: Quite good
review: When I first heard the Mandy Moore was starring in an upcoming movie, my first thought was: typical. But it really wasn't that bad! I would even go as far as to say it was good. Pretty good. There were a few parts where Mandy got a little annoying, but other than that, she was a fine actress, considering this is her first major role in a movie. I have earned a new respect for Mandy Moore. I was also delighted to see that she did not have a huge singing part in A Walk to Remember, just singing in the church choir and a school play. However, Britney Spears' movie Crossroads, looks horrible! Her singing career influenced the movie way too much. But we'll cross that road when we come to it. Ha. Get it?

title: Great Flick
review: This was a great movie in my opinion.  I had read the novel before I saw the movie so I was expecting to be able to bash it when I left.  I am also not usually a fan of movies such as these but there was something about this movie that sucked me in at the beginning and would not let me out until the end.  This is a happy/sad type of movie that has a lot of emotional scenes at the end.  I am not a person to get tear jerked during a movie but this one sure did jerk some tears.  I wasn't full out crying but I was close. Only one other movie has done that to me....Braveheart (best movie ever). Anyway, the story is great, the acting is above par, and the development of the main characters is perfect.  The only problem I have with this movie is that it drops some of the characters and subplots in mid plot and very weakly reincorporates them in the end.  I would have liked to see more development of these characters and sub-plots but I guess there was not enough time.  Anyway, I recommend this movie to all but younger kids who will not find it too entertaining.

title: This was the best movie ever!
review: I loved this movie so much.  I cried and cried and cried.  Mandy Moore is a really good actress and deserves awards for her roll as Jaime Sullivan. Shane West also did a very good job.  i would reccomend this movie to everyone, i even have the soundtrack and it is great!!! MAndy and Shane...if you ever read this....I love you both!

title: fresh....
review:
This is so far the most beautiful love story I have ever seen. The film is so stunningly fresh, it blows my mind...I just hope that filmakers will continue to make films that explores our basic human need - love, love in its purest form...

Shane West and Mandy Moore were perfect for the role...

Thank you Mr. Director for doing justice to Nicholas Sparks novel..

title: A Wonderful Film For Anyone Who Has Ever Fallen In Love...
review: A Walk To Remember is the classic jock guy meets reclusive girl movie, but it is so much more. This film shows the true power of the human heart and the mystery engulfed within. Whether you are a guy, a girl, a husband, wife, or even grandparent, this film WILL touch your heart in ways never seen before. A Walk To Remember is seriously a film for the heart. If you haven't seen this film yet, go; you won't be disappointed. If you have ever fallen in love, wish that one day you will, or never want to again, this film will impact you in every way possible. Go see this wonderful film with your heart open. You won't leave your seat without a new-found glory.

title: sappy but still sweet
review: A delightfully clean piece of americanna a la mode... just remember your insulin injection!  Nicely acted, slightly overly dramatic, but still delightful in its melodramatic pish posh.. A sweet little love story that claws at the heartstrings with all the subtly of monica ripping at a certain ex prez's fly.  Loved it!

title: Surprisingly Enjoyable Movie!
review: I must confess, first of all, that I originally went to this movie more out of an attempt to humor my girlfriend than for my own personal enjoyment. Although I tend to enjoy a good "chick flick" from time to time, personally I was initially more interested in seeing "Lord of the Rings" for a second time than this movie.  However I was pleasantly surprised at how well this movie was done and actually ended up enjoying it immensely.  I haven't read the book upon which this movie is based, so I can't say anything about how faithful it is or isn't to the book, although I do plan on eventually reading it.  However, as far as the movie goes, I can't really think of anything that should have been changed about the movie.  The movie was pleasantly devoid of profanity, violence, and sex, it promoted several important messages about life, love, and growing as a person without lecturing or being preachy, the characters evolved realistically (in the time alloted, of course), The acting was expressive without being overly dramatic and without resorting the characters resorting to cliche'-ridden lines, and although the ending was sad, it also offered a sense of hope and happiness.  The soundtrack was also very well done from start to finish, including Mandy Moore's song from the play ("Only Hope").  I also have to give the movie extra credit for the fact that I was close to tears by the end of the film, something that hasn't happened at least since "Transformers the Movie" when Optimus Prime died when I in 3rd grade.  Any movie that can make me emotional and bring me close to tears like that is clearly doing something right.  My girlfriend bought the soundtrack to the movie right after we left the movie theater and I have found that just listening to the songs, particularly the aforementioned one, is enough to start making me feel sad again.  Anybody who has not seen this movie yet and is wondering if they should owes it at least a rental.  Very well-done movie!

title: The BEST Movie
review: I think that this movie is excellent.  Mandy Moore was sensational and Shane West was gorgeous, they put on an incredible performance which touched me. Mandy Moore gave a a new meaning to life and made me see that people need pain to appreciate happiness.  I would definitely recommend this movie. It's for everyone who believes in love or just want a new meaning to their life.  Mandy Moore and sexy Shane West took my breath away.

title: Its a special movie that goes straight to the heart
review: I generally don't get too emotional while watching a movie but this one brought tears to my eyes.Mandy Moore was fantastic as the preacher's daughter.She embodied the essence of the character and one could feel that she was Jamie.Shane West was also quite good as the popular guy in school Landon,who falls in love with Jamie.The whole story is about how the plain and simple girl(Jamie) changes the life of Landon and saves him from ruining his life.

title: GOOD
review: I liked the movie. It was great. I just don't like how they changed stuff. For example, in the book, Landon doesn't get in trouble and end up putting a kid in the hospital. They should have kept it just like the book and it would have been better, but eves so, it was great!

title: Beautiful
review: I just watched A Walk To Remember yesterday and I thought that it was a beautiful movie, and full of meaning. The ending gave you a feeling of sadness and happiness at the same time, which is something that many movies cannot do for me. Also, it also made me hope that it would never end, that it would go on and on and I could just watch it forever. Mandy Moore was a very good actress for a pop singer, and Shane West was very good. I cannot understand why some critics give the movie really bad reviews.

title: A movie to remember!
review: I just saw this movie tonight and I loved it. I actually read the book about a month ago, and then again last week, and I know that the movie isn't quite the same but, just like the book, it was so good! Mandy Moore, despite being a pop singer, has great acting ability contrary to what others might say. I love this story because it doesnt focus around sex, drugs,and violence and all those other teen movie cliches. The story actually had meaning. Some people will turn their noses up at this movie simply because the story comes across something they have seen before in movies. I must add that I was in a large sold out theater tonight to see it, and all around me I heard people laughing at the comic bits, crying at the sad parts, and just enjoying the movie.When I left, I heard people all around saying how much they liked it, young and old. So I say, give this movie a shot, for all you know it may surprise you. And a suggestion I must add is bring some kleenex.

title: the real "not another teen movie"
review: it's rare for hollywood to churn out a film with a lot of heart and a lot of faith.  it's rare for producers and filmmakers to dare go against the norm of altogether avoiding sex, violence and cussing. it's also rare to find actors who will take a chance in participating in a movie that go against box-office formulas. so, it also doesn't come as a surprise to read heartless reviews about this beautiful film.  but thank God for filmmakers, writers and actors who believe there is still a place for a film like this in God-less hollywood.  personally, as a writer myself, i've anticipated where the plot was going but the mesmerizing thing about it was that i was moved so much to see where it was going -- it's that powerful.  this movie may not sweep awards nor make billions in the box office (although i hope and pray it does) but it will move hearts long after britney's "crossroads" or any of those so-called "teen movies" has passed into oblivion. this movie isn't just about religion, it's about faith nor is it just about teenage romance but about what teenagers can aspire to be.

title: Great Movie!
review:
A Walk To Remember was amazing. I loved it so much. It defines what every good teen movie should be. It is the best teen movie I have seen in a LONG time. I was going to the movie at first because I am a huge fan of Shane West because of Once and Again, which I have been watching since it's premiere in 1999. But I never expected the movie to be THAT good. Mandy Moore's preformance was breathtaking as she played the charactor of Jaime Sullivan. I never expected her to be any good. And Shane West was amazing as always. I didn't expect anything but excellence from him.

For all the bad reviews out there, you must not have a heart. Because that is what this movie was, all heart. I feel sorry for all of you who didn't enjoy it :)

title: Definitely Worth Seeing
review: I would like to say that 'A Walk to Remember' blew me away. Mandy Moore is definitely brilliant, but Shane West is much more brilliant. They're both going to bomb Hollywood soon. In the movie, Mandy's hair is brunette, probably because her original blond hair would make it as if she is the popular girl. ^.^ The reviewers say that this movie is religious, but I do not think so. It may have no sex scenes and lots of snogging scenes, but seriously, it's sweet and teaches us the meaning of love. Want to know how many times I've seen this move? six. No kidding. The soundtrack is so cool--especialy Mandy Moore's 'It's Gonna Be Love'. This is not another teen movie--it's not predictable too. There's lots of favorite quotes that I've gotten from this movie. This move may not be screaming for lots of awards, but it's definitely worth seeing--it'll let you learn something. So go on! Have a Walk to Remember! ;)

title: I liked this movie
review:
I'm so glad I found this site. I've read many of the thoughtful comments and decided to write some of my own. I'm not a teenager but I really liked the film and the naturalness of the acting. It had sappy moments but all love stories do. My only real criticism with the movie is that I wish that it hadn't rushed through Landon's growing feelings for Jamie. The emphasis in the book is how Landon evolves as a person and falls in love with Jamie. The book beautifully illustrates this and by the time he tells her that he loves her [in the book] you really believe it.

Most of the reviews were mean spirited and unfair. This movie is not preachy at all, you dont't have to be religious to appreciate the themes of love, respect and forgiveness.

title: Great film - can't wait to see it again
review:
YES,finally I have seen a teen movie that anyone can enjoy.If I had to say in a few words why this movie was SO GREAT.. then I would probably say something like this: The story has things in it that many teens can relate to.

The plot is mainly about a Popular guy who falls in love with a dowdy outcast girl. But the guy at first has a problem with acknowledging his feelings for her, in fear of his status being corrupted. His life is turned upside down when the the girl says a very sad :'( secret. I dont want to reveal to much but I do have one last thing to add- Its a movie which you know the ending is going to come and you just don't want it to happen.

But there were some down parts to the movie,one was that some lines were kind of korny. But besides that I give it a 10++. Its definetly a must see movie I recommend it for teenagers and up and not to mention Shane West isn't that bad to look at for an hour n 44 minutes. ^_^

~ thanx for reading my opnion ~

title: Love the book, like the movie!
review: OH-MY-GOD! This movie is absolutely good! Don't listen to anybody who tells you otherwise. Well, it is a little on the generic side (that much i admit) but that still does not change the fact that it's a pretty good story. Shane West was absolutely adorable in this flick. I mean, I hated his guts in Get Over It, and his performance in Whatever It Takes did not even faze me one bit, but he definitely hit pay dirt on this one! He's got that rebel-turned-good-boy thing going for him. I definitely developed a major crush on him after watching this movie! Anyway, Mandy Moore (the female lead) was not as bad as I expected. I thought she was gonne be awful, but it was passable at most. She has a pretty mediocre talent when it comes to acting. (Take The Princess Diaries, for example...).If it's any consolation to Mandy, I love the movie's theme song, though! c",)The movie would have been better if they casted the female lead with a great dramatic actress, because the role of Jamie was a pivotal one. More depth was required. They should have casted someone along the lines of Julia Stiles, Sarah Michelle Gellar or Katie Holmes (just 3 of the best drama princesses of this generation.)At least, Shane West was there to salvage the dramatic content! Overall, it's a must-see flick for those who likes romance and teen movies. It's a little predictable, but I guarantee you'll be sighing and crying till the credits roll! How bout 8 out of ten stars?!?!

title: Finally! A teen film that portrays virtue with neither ridicule nor lectures.
review:
Finally! A teen film that portrays virtue with neither ridicule nor lectures.

"A Walk to Remember" opens with in-your-face teen rebellion. The "in-crowd" at Beaufort High sets up a wannabe for a prank that goes too far. The principal punishes the protagonist by forcing him to interact with "people different from himself." And so Landon Carter (Shane West) crosses paths with Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore), a plain Jane Bible-carrying astronomy geek whom Landon has known and ignored since kindergarten.

What follows is a love story with predictable milestones, innocent teenage romance, and devices to close the loose ends. What makes this film special, though, is the way it develops the characters. Landon is portrayed as an angry son who doesn't want to forgive his father for leaving his mother. Jamie has a seductive inner peace that Landon can't resist. The trailer use Landon's question, "Don't you care what people think about you?" and Jamie's answer: "No," to set her up as a rebel against rebellion. But she also sees something good in him despite her first instincts (and her father), which tell her he's nothing but trouble.

Reverend Sullivan (Peter Coyote) could have been less aloof, but the screenplay doesn't give him much to work with. He has to raise his daughter alone after his wife dies. He does the best he knows how, trying to balance the transfer of his values with the acceptance that he has to let his daughter grow up to become her own person.

It's typical for Hollywood films to ridicule anyone who doesn't break the rules, and films praised by the Christian community often suffer from proselytizing that turns off secular audiences. This film doesn't pander to either side. Jamie, by being an old-fashioned symbol for virtue, is the hero of the film, and yet the Christian overtones are muted.

The tone of the mainstream critics of this film is merciless, which is another indication that this film is rebellious in exactly the way it sets out to be. It's a sweet story with a bittersweet ending, and grace is plentiful. That's too much for cynical nihilists to tolerate. But read the negative reviews for yourself. The criticisms sound empty and shallow, just like Landon's in-crowd friends who fail to ridicule him into abandoning his relationship with Jamie.

title: Like "Love Story" for teens.
review: A Walk to Remember is a refreshing and welcome alternative to the typical "teen movie" that Hollywood makes these days (e.g. American Pie, Bring it On, pick any Freddie Prinz Jr. movie!). It is smarter than the movies named above for several reasons: (1) the characters are well developed and seem like real people with real issues; (2) there are no jokes involving bodily fluids or functions (thank God!); and (3) it is about romance, rather than sex. Shane West plays Landon Carter, who is a rebellious but popular kid in his high school. And pop star Mandy Moore plays Jamie Sullivan, a cute but unpopular girl in (the same) high school, due to her quasi-mousy style of dress and her strong Christian beliefs (her dad is the minister of a local church). When Landon gets in trouble and is forced to participate in the upcoming school play as his punishment, he is helped in his preparation by Jamie, who is also in the play and who volunteers to meet with him to practice their lines. During their meetings, an attraction builds between Landon and Jamie but he is afraid to show his feelings for her in public, around his "popular" friends, until something happens, and he feels that he must make a stand. I won't reveal any more of the plot here, since much of the joy of watching A Walk to Remember lies in seeing how it develops the growing romance between the two teens. There's genuine sweetness in this story and between the two lovers--which manages to stay a hair's breadth away from manipulative sentimentality--and then something happens. For the record, I predicted it far in advance, but that didn't lessen the impact of what happens. For the film takes its time developing its two main characters so that we genuinely care about their fate when the "unexpected" moment finally comes. For those who have not been overcome by cynicism and irony, and who are open to seeing a sweet teenage love story, I heartily recommend A Walk to Remember. It is a sleeper that will gradually win your heart over. (If you're a teenager, I recommend that you go see this film and prove to Hollywood that there's a market (among teens) for sweet, intelligent films like this.)

title: Cute Movie, Suprisingly nice and Uplifting...
review: Going into this movie, I suspected it would be the average boy meets girl... boy and girl somehow end up falling for eachother. With Mandy Moore as the lead actress I really wasnt expecting much. Shane West as leading man, I have seen his other movies like 'Get Over It' and 'Whatever It Takes'... I knew he was funny in those roles but really had no idea what to expect. Mandy and Shane had wonderful chemistry onscreen. The story was beautiful, and I think it really makes for a great female bonding experience, since at the end of the film, every girl in the theater was crying their eyes out. Mandy Moore did a suprisingly wonderful job, and I really look forward to her other movies after this. I think this will also lead to better roles for Shane West as well since he did a wonderful job also...

title: really liked it, all you should know is...
review:
Good, solid movie, and one with character and moral values. Not likely to sweep the Academy Awards, but, all in all, WELL worth seeing.

=ALL= YOU SHOULD KNOW before going to see this movie is that: it's about teens, it involves a girl who has faith in God, there's romance as well, and quite a few people really like the movie.

To be fair, it seems there are others who just can't stand it. A lot of those are probably (if I had to guess) people who are a bit of Grinches when it comes to values and faith. If you are favorable towards those things, whether you're a teen yourself, or a 40-year-old dad like me, you'll probably like A Walk to Remember.
