Not that you have to be particularly religious to enjoy this film.

There were a couple of moments where I felt the production suffered; chiefly, in a couple of musical numbers that were just -too- musical. The soundtrack seemed to wander off into recording-studio land, divorced from the surroundings of the film. They would have done better to bring in some of the sounds from the real-life (er, movie-life) setting, and not to have the vocals quite so "professional." The girl is supposed to be a rather ordinary high-school girl; it is a bit distracting for her to sound like a professional singer (even though I understand she is).

But other parts of the movie overcome those flaws. You pretty well forget (at least I did) that you're in a movie. That's one of the tests of a good film.

This one will probably make it into our home video library.

title: ~A Wonderful Movie!~
review: ~This movie was so amazing!  I left with chills!  It was the first movie in a long time where the morals and the christian values were protrayed in the movie!  The actors played their roles well and made the audience believe what they were saying!  I give the movie and the actors in it two thumbs up!~  :-)

title: A movie to remember!
review: This movie was by far one of the best "teen movies" I've ever seen!  It showed a girl of integrity with an awesome faith in God that all of us should wish that we had.  This movie is a MUCH MUCH better movie for the 'pre-teen' crowd than cross roads, because it shows a MUCH better role model for girls, and guys alike.  All guys who go see this movie....take notes! Shane's character Landon is the perfect kind of guy.  I'd say the book is better than the movie in this instance, but a lot of my friends who have both read the book and seen the movie disagree with me....see for yourselves! This movie is definetly a 10/10 in my book.

title: Movie-goer
review: I saw this movie and loved it! It was a "feel-good" film. It reminded me of the movie "LOVE STORY." I read one critic's review who called it "forgettable." Gee...it's a good thing I don't listen to critics because I'm BUYING this one as soon as it comes out! I think this world needs more films like this and less "shoot 'em up, blow 'em up"

title: A very moving film
review:
If you do not have a heart then you will not like this movie.

I went to see it with my wife and my 14-year-old daughter and I found myself, a 44-year-old man watching the film with tears streaming down my face. Simply a superb film.

I found the characters to be different and interesting, not following the similar `pop star in a movie' profile. The Jamie Sullivan character played by Mandy Moore was an expansive, complex character that typically can't be played by such a young person, but she nailed the character perfectly, playing her with such depth and feeling that I don't think it could have been done any better by anyone else.

Shane West also did a wonderful job playing Landon Carter. I though he played this character perfectly. His emotions, his inner struggle with his desire to be with Jamie or to continue to be `cool', his anger, and non-caring attitude. He used all of these emotions to paint this character flawlessly.

Peter Coyote also played the part of Reverend Sullivan, Jamie's father to a T. He perfectly portrayed the Christian father with the inner struggle of seeing his daughter grow up and having to let go, also because of her illness, wanting to protect her.

This movie is a `must see', but bring a box of Tissues.

title: Not so bad
review:
I read the reviews for this movie before I saw it, and, honestly, I wasn't expecting it to be good. The reviews said that Mandy Moore was too pretty to play this role. So I expected this to be another "Crossroads." But was I sure wrong!

While watching this movie, I completely forgot that Mandy Moore was even a singer. She did such a great job in this. And, for the record, she did not look like a pop star in this. I don't know where that reviewer could get that idea.

Now, if you have read the book, there are some differences. But really the changes didn't really bring the movie down, but make it even better. Yes, I would have liked some of the things to stay the same, but still the movie seemed to work anyways.

Shane West played Landon very well. He's obviously a growing actor and I hope to see him in other roles.

I'm impressed in Mandy Moore for picking a role like this instead of picking a lame chick flick movie like Britney Spears did. Some of the scenes in A Walk to Remember had some dramatic intensities, and I think Mandy pulled them off well.

Overall, I enjoyed this movie and I recommend this to anyone who's in the mood for a great movie. 9-10

title: The Difference Is...
review: A few weeks ago I went and saw this movie with my father. I really wanted to see the movie because I read the book a thousand times. I heard that the movie is much diffrent from the book, and that left me dismayed for awhile. But, I still wanted to see it. Let, me first say that Mandy Moore can act! I don't think anyone else could play the part of Jamie Sullivan with more heart than Mandy Moore did. And, Shane West is such a great actor, and he needs to be more recognized. Now, I have read tons of reviews, and lots of IMDb user comments, and people keep saying the same thing over and over again..."this movie was cliched." Yes, some aspects of the movie was in fact cliched. But, I think people are missing the one factor that seperates this movie from other teen oriented movies...it uses religion!  Never before did I see a movie that portrayed religion as a good thing. I mean we have so many people in the Hollywood business belonging to this Scientology stuff that I think that everyone has forgotten God. Movies from the past have made fun of God by bashing catholism, and stereotyping other religions to a point where it makes America want to throw up! But here comes along a teen movie that holds it's moral values and reminds us that  people somewhere out there still believe that God exists. The point of the movie was the Jamie was outcasted because her father was the strict pastor at a Southern Baptist Church. She held her faith strong and people made fun of her for that. She did'nt transform into this beautiful girl, she stayed true to herself. So thats why i dont get this pretty-ugly girl crap. Nobody in the movie said she was ugly..they just thought that being different is strange. I go to a Catholic school, and I guess everyone of us is strange. Especially to public school people. The point is I think you should see this movie because it is DIFFERENT in the sense that it reminds us of Christianity, instead of bashing it. Mandy Moore is a wonderful actress and she beats Britney in my book at acting. (I saw Crossroads and I almost threw up) By the way, even my southern Baptist dad cried!

title: Can't wait to buy this movie
review:
I loved this movie so much, I was ready to walk right back in and see it again the same day. My fiance and I couldn't stop talking about it for days. I want to tell everyone this is a must see.

It moved well and never seemed to stay on one scene too long. The emotion and love was so true to what we all long for. There were real friends that stand by you regardless of what others think, people looking out for other people's interests and not their own. It was so refreshing to see characters who aren't self centered and only thinking about themselves, not to mention that they portrayed all of this without sex and violence. An awesome movie that can do it's job at a PG rating is unbelievable!

title: Different...
review: ..but very good! This was such a good movie! It wasn't full of violence or cussing, but actually had a decent story line. Not only that, but it taught great lessons, and it wasn't one of those "predictable" movies. It was really sad in the end. I think most people were pleased with this movie, because at the end, I heard somebody remark, "That was a good movie for a change."-which is exactly what it was.

title: AMAZING!!
review: Mandy Moore and Shane West were great together (I didn't think Mandy could act!); the story was amazing but now that I've seen the movie I'm not sure if there's a point in reading the book.  I have never cried so hard from a movie before!  I knew what happened before I saw it but the commercials don't give it away which is a shock.. It was totally unpredictable and there were so many different unexpected things that happened.  The beginning is a little corny, but don't leave the theater, it gets good soon... I would definitely see it again!!

title: What an amazing movie
review:
Like a lot of people I went into this movie not expecting too much. And I am thrilled to say that I was so wrong to think that. Shane West and Mandy Moore are amazing, contrary to what many people, who have not seen this movie, may think. Yes Mandy Moore is in this movie, yes they play teenagers, yes she is religious, yes she does sing. But for once, it all fit the movie. It did not seen contrived or out of place. I'm not even Christian and I appreciated her faith. If anything, it added to the emotion of the movie.

The writing is wonderful. And for once, even though the main characters are teens, this is not a teen movie. Sex, drugs, and skimpy clothing are not given screen time like in other teen movies. It makes you think about your own life and makes you want to be better. Great Job you guys, you just made a big fan!! I can't wait to buy it when it comes out on DVD!

~Ameeta

title: Not so bad
review: This movie wasnt so bad, and its mostly  for girls so guys stay at home or go watch something else. Its a classical story of bad popular guy falls in love with innocent social outcast girl. When he realizes her terrible secret his whole world is crushed and so on. Shane West is absolutely hot, but Mandy please stay in music world, no offense. I liked this movie, but i think that book is little bit better but thats just my opinion.

title: Perfection Personified
review: Aristotle believed in perfect circles and perfect triangles that only exist in our minds. The actual representations of these perfect shapes are flawed if for no other reason than that they are man made. So although these representations are slightly flawed, they remind us of the perfect shapes or things in our minds. Even though we've never seen a perfect triangle, we know what one looks like because our mind can eliminate the flaws. The characters in this film are by no means perfect, the situations are occasionally ludicrously created to stir up emotion or so that Shane West runs into Mandy Moore in the most unlikely place. But, the attempt made was to try to put the perfect people together and watch as the magic happens. And these representations of the perfect boy/girlfriend are enough to stir up feelings and cause you to sharpen your own perfect boy/girlfriend image. A Walk to Remember is only a good movie if you open yourselves up and have faith that maybe for just 100 minutes Aristotle was wrong, and that perfection can occur.

title: Sappy
review: Although the movie was well scripted and fairly acted, it was very mushy and predictable.  Those of you who didn't read the bestseller when it first arrived on bookshelves had no idea what you were getting yourself into, but for us we were quite surprised that the great book was adapted into a movie. This was an excellent choice for Mandy Moore to pick as her first starring lead role in a motion picture, and she is a fine actress with great learning talent.  Shane West was excellent as the heartthrob/ bad-boy, but not a far departure from his current character on "Once and Again".  All and all the movie was moderately good, but needed more substance and less reliability on the romantic element.

title: Great plot; bad storyline/ending
review: The movie in whole was great.  I haven't really read the book to see how the adapation was.  The movie has a very weak beginning.  The characters weren't as well established as they could have been.  Mandy Moore's character really shines though.  The plot was great, however it had a lot of cliches.  A few unexpectant turns make this movie an emotional tugger.  The solique at the end is a little over dramatic.

title: I LOVED IT!!!
review: Wow. What can I say? I went to the theaters expecting to diss it when I walked out but boy was I wrong. I have to say Mandy Moore gave a great performace and Shane West.....wow. Its a great love story and I WILL see it again.

title: Hold my hair while I vomit
review: I apologize but this is one of the most generic movies I've ever seen. It's so damn formulaic. It's got the popular guy, the ugly girl, the strict father, the dumbass friends, the only black guy in the whole movie, the predictable love story, the expected music scene, and the death. How the HELL can this make up a great movie? Mandy Moore is trying to play a "different" role (in other words, not completely glamorous) in an attempt not to blend in with the other popstars.  People give in to such contribed crap. If you have an untamable urge to see it, or an unstoppable love for this movie, good for you.

title: An amazing journey of faith, love & growing up.
review: I absolutely loved this movie.  It has moved to my list of all-time favorites.  Landon does an incredible job coming across as the typical guy jerk, but he realizes there's so much more out there as he learns to love completely and give of himself.  As a result of Jamie's love and faith, he grows into a man, instead of just a bigger version of a little boy, which is the direction he was headed.  Jamie also is an amazing role.  She stands by her faith and beliefs, despite the pain and sometimes ridicule it causes her from her peers.  She portrays a Christian teenage girl, without coming across "preach-y" or "holier-than-thou" or totally out of touch with the world.  Which is the way it really is.  Also, who says she is the ugly duckling turned beautiful.  In my opinion she was beautiful right from the start.  Glamour isn't synonymous with beauty.

title: wonderful
review: I loved this movie. It reminds me of myself and my life actually. Anyways.. I loved the movie. This movie had a message behind it. No matter who you are or what you look like you can do anything. I really admire this movie because it made me wanna be a better person... They acted very well..and yes i cried about 4 or 5 times. I think everyone should at least try to see it once, even if its not your style of movie. You maye just like it. It was a wonderful movie.

title: Awesome movie - I liked it more than the book!!!
review: This is a wonderful movie. I went to see this without my husband and when asked how it was, I was still so "touched" I couldn't talk about it without crying. I would see it again and again. Can't wait for this to be available for purchase. I will own a copy on DVD as soon as possible. Great work Nicholas!!!!

title: Once you think you've seen it all....
review: I remember seeing the previews for "A Walk To Remember" and thinking three things.  The first was "Oh, a Mandy Moore movie, how much you wanna' bet that will be the most brainless teen flick of the year?"  The second was "Can we say predictable? "  And my third thought was "Shane West is HOT!" As it turns out, the only one of those three observances was right, and lucky for me (and the rest of the female population) it was that Shane West is, indeed, VERY ATTRACTIVE.  "A Walk To Remember" is more than just the flighty teen flick it looked like in the previews.  This movie isn't just a plug for Mandy Moore songs and an excuse to stare at Shane West for a few hours, it is both moving and meaningful.  I'm often very hard on movies if I feel like they don't have enough substance or character development.  "A Walk To Remember" has you leaving the theater after some good ole' catharsis, as well as feeling like you just made some new close friends. I definitely recommend this movie, and warn that it IS a tear-jerker.  But then again, it sometimes feels better to cry then to hold it all in, and if you get to watch this movie while doing it, it's not too bad of a deal.

title: A bit saccharine but better than some sugar.
review:
I think I can fairly say that as an agnostic man rapidly approaching his mid-thirties, I'm not exactly the target audience for `A Walk to Remember'. That alone is its own disclaimer: I need not even add that I'm cynical, jaded, and universally unmoved by the machinations that filmmakers (and novelists) use to tug at our emotions. Most films in this genre send my eyes straight to the back of my skull immediately to rest there for the next two hours. It's not even the type of film I would normally find myself attending were it not a bout of whimsical nostalgia. I think my even being in the theater may take a bit of mercifully short explanation:

When I saw the trailer, I was struck how much young Miss Moore reminded me of a girl I loved the summer before my senior year. That was lure and when I sat in the theater and saw this story mirrored my own - good, moral girl takes a chance on the wild guy - it made me think about things I'd not considered for years. Unlike Landon, I was not wise enough to appreciate the gift I was given and she gave up on me, to my immediate regret. Two thousand miles and seventeen years later in a Los Angeles theater I was surprised to find that I still regretted it. On the drive home I even found myself taking stock of my life and the way I live it. The movie made me think and it made me feel. No one could have been more surprised than me.

Still, I can see the faults with `A Walk to Remember'. Though Shane West manages to convey some solid emotion as Landon and Mandy Moore's Jamie radiates despite both inexperience and a frumpy wardrobe, these characters are one-dimensional and seem slaves to the sheer unoriginality of the story. Typical is a scene where Landon's ex-girlfriend cruelly passes out flyers with sweet Jamie's head pasted on a Club magazine covergirl's body. Sadly, it is overdone with all the attendant movie clichés: Close-ups of school kids laughing like hyenas, close-ups of Jamie's sweaty mortification, a heartbeat soundtrack, all of the above moving at half-speed. A better (and ultimately more difficult) scene would have shown us a Jamie capable of standing up for herself in the moment, perhaps breaking down only when it had passed and she was alone with Landon, enabling him to return and still throw the punch that estranges himself from his friends. A viewer that lacks a personal connection and therefore the ability to fill these missteps with the emotional shorthand needed, could certainly point to this scene and others as a reason to dismiss the entire film. However, with the possible exception of professional movie critics and some members of the reptile family, I think most of us enjoy a level of intercourse with our poor battered hearts. Hopefully enough to allow ourselves the occasional emotional manipulation even when it is as nakedly applied as in this film.

As teen love stories go, `A Walk to Remember' may deserve some points for trying to transcend the genre even if it doesn't quite make the climb. Certainly, it might be more beneficial to our culture if we were given more young female characters like Jamie. If girls like her were given some equal time among the teeny-bopper bimbettes that permeate entertainment, it might just open some young men to the reality of what they should be finding attractive and start looking not only with their eyes, but with their hearts and minds. At the very least, it may spare some of them a surprising and unnerving feeling of deep regret, years later, when they least expect it.

If you have a serious sweet tooth, the film is a 10. For those who have loved and lost at a young enough age where you can still manage a pang when you think about it, it's a solid 7. If you can't give it at least a four, get on a transplant list - your heart is about to go.

title: I'll always remember
review: So the ugly is pretty gee there's a shock. hollywood has to do it in order to sell the movie and mandy moore being a pop star is a plus.  Don't get me wrong though she's great and i couldn't see any better  people (Mandy Moore and Shane West) to play the leads and a different cast play their roles. They all were great and acting was amazing.  My mom even cried i did have a tear to my eye.  As for the ugly girl thing take me for instance i'm fat and ugly.  Their not gonna put me on the big screen now are they but if they want a true makeover an ugly girl to a pretty girl then they should give me a call.  In other words I liked the Movie.

title: If you're a teen girl, you'll love it. Otherwise, this one probably wasn't made for you.
review:
Although not very faithful to the novel by Nicholas Sparks, this isn't too bad for a teen movie. As long as you know that you'll get all of the teen cliches so prominently displayed in the "Not Another Teen Movie" parody, then the rest will be OK for you. Most of the characters are more like caricatures of what someone thinks a typical teen from that peer group are like. The story is pretty good, but the presentation is a little stale.

Mandy Moore plays the "ugly duckling" part pretty well. It's at least notable that she did not go the Britney/Mariah route into films trying to be just as glamorous or as good looking as they think they are in real life. Her range of emotions seems pretty honest. The character is pretty well developed and easy to sympathize with. The only fault in her performance is the overly dramatic singing sequences in a few parts of the movie.

Shane West ("Whatever It Takes") does pretty well as an insecure popular kid falling for the unpopular girl. With the turn the movie takes (I won't spoil it here), his character becomes more tolerable and less typical as the film goes on. With help from good supporting actors Peter Coyote ("E.T.") and Darryl Hannah, the cast rounds out pretty nicely. Obviously this movie was not geared for critics, though, and will probably get panned. It's made for teen girls and that's about it. So, in that respect, it's served its purpose and isn't bad for what it is. It's got its target audience covered and will probably do well in malls and multiplexes across the country. If you're in that demographic, go check it out. If not, you'll be fine waiting for video if you're even curious at all.

title: Amazing
review: A Walk to Remember was an amazing movie. Shane West and Mandy Moore were so good. Their acting was perfect. I usually don't cry at movies, but by the end of this one my eyes were red. I saw the movie two times and it just got better the second time. My friends and I can't wait until it comes out on video. The music was great, and the lines were beautiful. This movie was absolutely perfect.

title: I can not believe I'm gonna say this
review: I'm a 17 year old male from New Hampshire and I'm more than willing to admit this was a very good movie. It's emotional output was excellent. I hope noone compares this to that stupid Britney Spears movie "Crossroads", because this movie has something that one does not, good acting. Give A Walk to Remember a try, even if your some big shot guy, you just may end up liking it.

title: Truly, a Walk to Remember
review:
I saw this movie almost two weeks ago, and it struck me so much that I have seen it two more times with the excuse of accompanying some friends of mine who wanted to go see it. I wanted to take my time before writing this review, in order to make it slowly sink in. In the meantime, I have read reviews by critics and moviegoers, have read the novel by Nicholas Sparks on which this movie is (loosely) based, and have realized that the first time I saw it in the theater was actually the first time I ever cried at a movie. I do not exactly know why most of the the other people in the theater were crying, but I did cry because of the sweet, chaste, and unselfish love that Landon and Jamie showed towards each other in many a scene. It was really touching. Most movie critics have put down this movie on the moral basis that `Hollywood does not have the right to preach to us.' Personally, I liked the fact that Christianity was treated with fairness and respect.

It has been rightly written that this movie brings nothing new to the big screen. It is a mixture of `Love Story,' `Pretty in Pink,' and `She's All That,' with a sprinkle of `Seventh Heaven.' Yet, my personal opinion is that `A Walk to Remember' is in a category by itself, way above even celebrated movies such as`Titanic,' `Sleepless in Seattle,' or `Say Anything.' In all these movies, there is no spiritual and psychological growth in the characters, neither are there higher moral lessons to be learned by the viewer. They surely have a couple of aspects similar to `A Walk' but, in the end, they totally lack the sense of nobility irradiated by this movie. `A Walk' makes you think and, as I read in some of the reviews, even reevaluate your moral principles. This is not something that the above-mentioned love stories do.

Take `Say Anything,' for example. It was recently voted on `Entertainment Weekly' as the best modern romance movie. They say there it shows a lot of attention to small details, like the scene in which Lloyd checks his hair in the mirror before dialing the last digit of Diane's phone number. Now, notice that these details do not show love and altruism, but rather superficiality and selfishness. He wants to look good: normal in a teenager, but hardly noble. Check instead all the things Landon does for Jamie. It's totally unselfish and considerate towards her feelings and principles. Check out for example how, in one scene, he stops kissing her as a sign of respect for her religious beliefs: how manly and how mature. Also, sex is never an issue, and even their kisses reveal a sense of purity, chastity, and sweetness unseen in most other movies. You want details? Forget the `Say Anything' Lloyd checking his hair in the mirror, and check out the scene with Landon and Jamie on the deck. She is sleeping with her head on his shoulder. He notices that her sweater leaves her shoulder uncovered and pulls it up to keep her warm. Want more romantic details? Check out the seriousness with which both of them say the phrase, `I love you,' and their reaction to this phrase. Unlike in many other movies, in which these words (if they are even pronounced) drown in an ocean of sex-related activities, here they play a pivotal role that conveys truly felt reactions in the two characters.

The acting is surprisingly good. Honestly, the first time I saw the movie, I did not even know that Mandy Moore was a pop singer (I am not exactly into teen pop music). Had the acting been bad, most of the above-mentioned details would have not worked out the way they did. Both West and Moore did an excellent job, and so did the supporting cast.

In conclusion, I do not recall seeing any other movie in which there are so many positive aspects at the same time. Here we have true (proved, and not just `felt') love, chastity, respect, kindness, maturity, self-confidence not based on peer pressure but on higher moral standards, forgiveness, devotion, patience, hope, and faith. All these aspects contribute to making this movie much more that a mere teen love story, but instead a true walk to remember, even for the viewers.

By the way, check out the book. It is even better.

title: Better than I expected
review:
I bought a ticket for this movie on the strength of Roger Ebert's review, and I was pleasantly surprised to find myself agreeing with his three-star review. It is a fairly corny teen flick, yes, but it's ABOUT something. I left the theatre thinking how some 18-year-olds focus on today, believing that they have all the time in the world to worry about the future, and others are faced with situations that make them grow up fast. People in the second group tend to realize that 18 is not to young to do something valuable, to change another person's life.

This definitely wasn't Shakespeare, but I was gently entertained, and it made me think. That's good enough for me.

title: Great tearjerker! Mandy Moore was Excellent!
review: This film was surprisely good. I had always wanted to see it from the first time I heard about it. I've always loved Mandy Moore and this movie made me love her more. I never cry in movies let me tell you but in this one I cried almost through the whole thing. It was really touching and Mandy was really convincing of a nerd who is dying of leukemia. She was great. I loved her acting. Shane was good too but only in a couple of scenes (where he is hugging his dad and crying) but Mandy was excellent throughout the whole movie. You will not be disappointed when you go see this. This is one of the 50 best movies of 2002! GO SEE IT!!!!!

title: Shane & Mandy Are The Best!
review:
Ohmigod,

This movie is so sad, sweet, whatever! It takes you on so many journey's and I love it. It's great! Everything, the plot, the music, the stars!!! MANDY, I never liked before, but this movie made me say bye bye Britney, and hello Mandy. Shane is sooooo cute, and together they made a great couple. This movie i liked because it's not the typical Britney Spears' "let's have fun, lose our virginity, and act like we are nerdy even though were like hotter than the popular girls in school," I loved how Mandy was the popular "pretty" girl, and I think Landon was such a sweet guy. He's perfect! I mean I would die for a guy like that! There are guys like that out there, but there is always something wrong with them. I know it's just a movie but he becomes sweet, sensitive, caring, loving, patient, and not only that he's hot! Those are MAJOR..... +'s!!! If a single (15-18) guy is out there and actually can be that great and noble, gimme a call ;) I know I'll find him someday! :D

The movie deserves 2 thumbs up!!!!

title: Sweetest Movie Ever!!
review: I just saw a Walk to Remember for the second time.  This movie is great for everyone, especially those who haven't lost the magical feel true love brings over you.  Shane West does an astounding job and really makes you feel for him.  He will probably be in many more movies with the way his acting career is going.  Mandy has a great break out performance in the movies.  The whole cast is wonderful

title: This a surprising movie.
review: Well, hmm.  I read the book first and I liked it so much I've read it 3 times in the last week.  I was a bit disappointed by the many changes that are in the movie (the book is in the 1950's, the movie is current times, for one).  For the first 30 minutes, I was wondering why I wanted to see the movie at all.  But it ended up being very well done and I believe it was faithful to the plot & spirit of the book.  I haven't cried for a long time, but I wept crazy at this movie.

title: Really Touching
review: I thought this movie was going to be  a typical romance movie and was just over hyped because of Mandy Moore. But this movie really exceeded my expectations and was really touching and made me cry .The ending was really sad which  I am not going to ruin  for you but highly recommend that you watch this movie.

title: Not bad but how many remakes can there be?
review: Not a bad movie, but isn't this Love Story years later?  The acting is so-so with Moore having the same 1/2 happy 1/2 sad expression on her face through the whole film.  I guess it's a great film if you're under 16 but older than that, you can see through the thin plot.  One question...for a father that hated the boy dating his daughter, why let them get married at 17?

title: Jamie & Landon
review: The movie was pretty good, although, as other people said,the couple's process of 'falling into love' happened altogether too quickly. At one point Landon says something like "i miss spending time with you" and we had previously only seen them speak (casually) a handful of times.  I have not read the novel, so i can't compare and contrast, but the acting was good and at some points very (gush-worthingly) cute. I admire that Mandy dyed her hair brown, b/c it helped to separate Jamie from Mandy Moore, pop princess. I also liked how they didn't overdo a singing-Jamie. All in all a good movie, but like i said before, they didn't let the viewer see the jamie / landon pre-love relationship flourish.

title: Simply Lovely
review: What a wonderful film!!!  Pure, innocent, beautiful, and lovely.  This eptitomizes true love.  So many films today focus on shallow kids jumping into bed with one another, but this film develops a love story -a true love story. There is no need for gratuitous sexuality, because the innocence of true romance shines though.  This is a film for people who dream of and believe in true love.  You'll love it!  The acting by both Mandy Moore and Shane West is simply superb.  They emit chemistry, honesty, and true love. Congratulations to the director and all those involved - you have made one of the loveliest, most honest films, in existence.  This is destined to be a new Classic.

title: not for EVERYBODY, but personally, it's my ALL-TIME FAVOURITE!
review: i just saw this movie. unlike most of the people who watched this movie-because everyone was saying it was sOoOooo good-i had wanted to watch this movie since i saw the previews. this movie was the most touching movie i've ever seen in my life. it is my ALL-TIME favourite! and i don't go around saying movies are my favourite unless i truly mean it. and, i don't think i'll be changing my mind anytime soon. i am a real movie buff, and trust me, i haven't been able to think of an ALL-TIME fave movie since i was 5 and it was The Little Mermaid! almost everyone i know agrees with me, (though i think i'm the MOST in love with it). Shane West and Mandy Moore act magically in this film. i cried THROUGHOUT the ENTIRE movie! all i have left to say is: WATCH IT. you won't regret it.

title: A Beautiful Story that made a great Movie.
review: Shane West and Mandy Moore are wonderful in this movie and look great together. They are both very talented actors and they really made the movie feel real. The story is sweet and inspiring and I encourage every romance lover to see it. I hope to see more movies such as this one, and more of these two wonderful actors.

title: Great movie, better than the book!
review:
The movie really was better than the book, the producers made signficant changes in the beginning to setup the relationship between jamie and landon. The opening dare scene really showed the kind of guy landon was, what kind of direction he was headed, and truly made a dramatic difference between jamie and landon... When he was forced to go into drama by the principal, to me, it seemed a much more logical and natural way to setup the relationship...the movie made it seem that jamie was much more the saviour, and the landon was the one in need this way... The movie is just straight out more powerful than the book.. I think this doesn't make the book bad, its just more of a credit to the producers.

Aside from that, if you haven't read the book, go see the movie first!!! If you've seen the movie and loved it, it is probably worth your while to read it too.

And, yes, the world should have more Jamie Sullivans.

title: A real surprise! The story starts a little questionable but zooms to heights I didn't think it could meet.
review: As a fan of Christian themed and clean movies I was looking forward to this movie then found out more about Mandy Moore.  I was thinking it would have a "fair" story but doubted the depth of the story, the depth of the characters faith in the movie, and if Mandy Moore had been selected for her acting skills or for her teen female popularity. I hate spoilers so I won't even hint at the story line but suffice it to say the story takes twists and turns that leave you with no memory of the first 10 minutes.  The characters develop into people you can relate to, cheer for, cry with, and believe they are real. From a 30 something male, this is a movie to see.

title: Surprisingly rewarding movie
review: A Walk to Remember is a movie that is worth watching, for the simple reason that the two leads are exactly the kind of people you wished you had as your best friends.  Shane West is an extremely promising talent, and Mandy is simply sacharrin sweet.  Go watch it.

title: GREAT
review: I loved this movie. I also went off and even bought the book. Thought they were both good. Can't wait till it comes out on DVD. Now if you are thinking about watching this movie be warn that this is a chick flick. Also now I have a new respect for Mandy Moore can't wait to see what she does next.

title: Fabulous
review: I saw this movie and was touched by the story, I haven't read the book, but give my thumbs up to Mandy Moore, she played so wonderful, also Shane West, their acting are great! you guys should see this movie! This story happens in our everyday life! and it makes couples think how luck they are now.

title: Best Chick Flick
review: I'll be the first to admit that I am not into Mandy Moore or the chick flick scene altogether... so when my friends asked me if I wanted to go see "A Walk to emember," I said "sure-I'll have a great time laughing at you guys when you're crying." So I went (resentfully), not knowing anything about it.  Midway through, however, I was crying more than I have ever cried at a movie.  Afterwards, when my friends and I were talking, I decided that this was by far the best tear jerker I have ever seen.  I liked it so much that on Sunday I bought the book and read the whole thing that night. (crying the whole way through)...Now, although it is weird for me, I am obsessed with the movie... I am going to see it again for the 2nd time with my friend this weekend (and I can't wait)... So kudos to mandy and shane on a great movie!!!

title: Great
review: A Walk To Remember was great. The acting was good and the music is really good. At first I thought that Mandy Moore was going to be a bad actress but she was really good. Shane West was soooooooo totally HOTT!!!! That was one of the main reasons why I wanted to see it but it was totally worth. So I recommend this movie to eveybody.

title: Positive
review: I thought this movie was very well acted by all of the actors.  There was a lot of chemistry between the leads and I actually got into the movie.  I normally don't buy into this type of film, like heaven on earth, however this was done extremely well.  Note the beginning and what they do with the actors names etc., really cool :) I really got something out of this movie. There are many messages here, and I think many teens will benefit from seeing this movie.

title: Great Movie
review: I thought this movie was awesome.  I didn't think it was going to be so good.  I thought it was gonna be another teenie bopper movie but it wasn't. I love how the movie was played out and the actors and actress did a great job. GO AND WATCH IT, if you haven't yet.

title: Amazing!
review:
I thought the movie was without a doubt amazing. It touched my heart and made me believe that there is true love out there. It is a great story with a superb cast. If you haven't seen it yet...Go see A Walk To Remember!

"Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy; it does not boast; it is not proud. It is not rude; it is not self-seeking. It is not easily angered; it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil, but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. Love never fails." -Jaime in A Walk to Remember

title: Not as good as the book
review: I did like this movie. Notice I didn't say that I loved the movie. If I had not read the book before seeing the movie I could say that I loved the movie. The first time I saw "A Walk..." I was actually disappointed. For those of you who have read the book you know that the movie is almost nothing like the book. After seeing the movie three times I can say that I really enjoyed it, but, I was hoping for a movie that was more closely based on the wonderful book by Nicholas Sparks. Mandy Moore and Shane West did an excellent job with the script and the chemistry between them seemed very real. I commend them on their great job.

title: don't waste your money
review: I HATED this movie!! Mandy Moore is one of the worst actresses I have seen in a long time. The book by Nicholas Sparks was so wonderful, this movie could have been amazing. Instead, I found myself wishing the movie would just end so I could leave. The script was TERRIBLE, and the talking about faith but never actually mentioning God so as not to evoke controversy really irritated me. I would never recommend this to anyone, and I am usually pretty generous with movie criticisms. Don't waste your hard-earned money on this cheeseball.

title: It is touching
review: Wow.  I was blown away by this movie.  Mandy Moore and Shane West did a spectacular job.  You know, Mandy Moore doesn't get too much hype as a singer, but after you see this movie, you'll totally want MOORE!  She did such a wonderful job in this movie that I'm still affected by the movie, and it's been a week!  Shane West and Mandy work really well together, and it's hard to believe that they're not really together in real life!!!! So the movie is predictable.  And so the movie is a chick flick.  And so the movie isn't original.  But you know what?  When you can take something, a plot that has already been worked, and STILL make it work, that's really something!  Some parts of the movie were unrealistic, like the part West tells Mandy that he loves her.  It was too quick.  But overall, the movie was really well put together.  Mandy and Shane are the perfect people for the roles.  I was deeply touched by their love.  It makes you believe that true love, faith, and all the good stuff in life does exist even if it may not exist here and now!  I think everyone left the theatre crying.  Even the guys.  That should tell you something.  I totally admire Mandy Moore now. She is likeable without having to show off, without having too be too "Hollywood."  If anyone says that this movie sucks, or says that those who like the movie are pathetic,then those are the type of people who ALWAYS have to find something bad in everything because this movie was really awesome, to my surprise.  Hope to see more of West and Moore together!

title: I needed that!
review: I have never cried at a movie before this!  What an amazing story.  So emotionally captivating.  There was so much chemistry between Shane West and Mandy Moore.  I absolutely loved it!  Didn't really care much for the dark hair on Darryl Hannah, but it wasn't TOO distracting!

title: Poor adaption from book to movie
review: When I went to see this movie, I thought I'd be seeing a decent "chick flick" love story. What I found was a boring, too long, cheesy, bad production. The most disturbing thing was the costumes. It was supposed the take place in the mid-90's, but everything looked post-millenium. Low-rider jeans and three-quarter sleeved shirts filled every scene. Even the music was off target. I'm sorry, but "Get Your Freak On" by Missy Elliot came out last year. I was told that this originally (in the book) took place in the 1950's. It would have made MUCH more sense if they had left it there, rather than trying to modernize it's stereotypical and predictable story line. The only positive note to be made is that Mandy Moore is actually believable, although the character isn't. Thumbs up on your acting, Mandy, thumbs down to the script.

title: Sweet and Inspiring Despite Distraction
review: This film was inspiring and encourages the viewer to set vigorous goals and take a chance despite social pressure.  This film isn't overly sappy and portrays the main characters as intelligent individuals with the power to change.  Props to Shankman, West, and Moore.  The only distraction: distasteful, sexual language in the opening scene, especially by the Eric character.  I know screenwriters add such dialogue to connect with the viewer, but it actually alienates.

title: Surprisingly good
review: I have just recently saw this film and was very surprised on how good of a movie that it actually was.  Admittingly I have never read the book but I feel that the movie was well done.  I think that Mandy Moore has proven that unlike her music career that acting might be her calling for she did surprisingly very well in her role as it seems to be opposite of her singer persona.  Although when I first saw the length of the movie was close to two hours I thought that it was going to be long and drawn out but I was soon to be proven wrong.  I believe that this was a well directed movie as the scenes just seemed to flow easily and quickly to another and it did not even seem like it had taken the two hours.  I was one of those films that if you were to go to the restroom during it then you would definitaly miss something.  All in all this was one of the best movies I have seen and I think that more people would enjoy it than they realize.

title: Not spectacular, but it reaches the heart
review: What i liked about this film so much was how i was able to relate to the character that Mandy Moore played. Although the directing, script and overall "movie" overview isn't that great, the good story line by Nicholas Sparks makes for a good movie. This IS a chick flick. There are many parts where i had to take a deep breath and hope that the movie would "hurry up". However, this film is worth seeing for a change from the traditional teen movie. I didn't feel that Shane West's character was all that deserving of Mandy Moore's. The "love" happened too quickly. NO i'm not jealous of Shane West or anything! I'm not that attracted to Mandy Moore.

title: Not Just Any Teeny Bopper Movie
review: Honestly, I went into the theater expecting a silly teeny bopper movie.. I mean, Mandy Moore on screen, but I honestly believe that it was a wonderful film.  Sure, I'm a girl, and I like sappy movies.. but the moments in A Walk to Remember seem very realistic, though predictable.  I thought Shane West and Mandy Moore both did a fantastic job, and they portray great emotions. Sure, some things scream "teen movie" but I walked out with this with a newfound belief in love (yeah, yeah.. I'm sure that was the whole point) but the story was put together well, and I'd actually encourage anybody who wants to see a movie that tugs at the heart to give A Walk to Remember a chance.  Even the music is good!

title: Fantastic
review: This movie was amazing.  Very well done.  I thought it would just be another teeny bopper show and was pleased to find it to be the antithesis of that. Mandy Moore and Shane West were wonderful and I left wanting to be better than I am.

title: The best movie ever!
review: I saw A Walk To Remember two times, and it has only been out for three weeks.  I love the movie so much!  Shane West and Mandy Moore are great in the movie!  This movie has been the best movie I have ever seen!  If anyone has not seen it yet, GO OUT AND SEE IT!! It's SO good!!

title: So boring
review: I know I'm in the minority when I say this, but this was one of the most boring movies I've seen in a long time.  I was looking forward to seeing it, but ended up bored long before the movie was over.  Also, as a Christian, I found the "religious" aspect lacking.  Seriously lacking.  I was hoping in the beginning that all the cursing would be short-lived.  My hopes were dashed.  I couldn't recommend that anyone see this movie.

title: The most heart warming movie ive seen
review: this movie was so realistic! it made me cry the most i ever have. it is a miracle that happened, and shows what faith can do. it is the best movie i have seen! West CAN ACT! i think it was the best set of characters, and so well written. He is so hot and has the best smile it really brought the love between them. Jamie was so sure of herself during the movie and proved that miracles can happen. i can watch this movie 100 times and not get sick of it! its not like other movies. you get attached so much and when she tells him about her leukemia you feel what he feels. their actions really brought the movie alive. i think everyone except teenagers should see his movie!!

title: It's about time.
review: There'll be lots of comments about how this movie is just like all those "other" teenage romance flicks.  The difference is - the morals portrayed are meaningful and much, much deeper than anything Hollywood has put out in years.  It's about time, and we felt this was time well spent.

title: Definitely "not another teen movie"
review: I agree with all the reviewers who loved this movie (I just saw it for the second time today) but I don't agree that it should be called a teen movie. This lumps it into the categories of movies like "Bring it On" and "American Pie," which is about as unfair as any prejudice. Though "A Walk" is about teenagers, it is not a teen movie. This movie was made with heart and feeling. I would recommend it to anyone, but I warn any males who are reading this review: in both instances, men were sorely outnumbered, at one point about a ratio of 2 guys for every sixty girls. There were many handkerchiefs soaked when the credits started rolling. Everyone should see this movie.

title: Get the tissues
review:
I really wish that I had brought tissues along. Everyone that I have talked to said that they cried, even guys. I was surprised, my sis cried and that is very rare.

It was overall a good movie, though it was kind of predictable. We knew that he was going to make #1 on her list come true.

title: great!
review: A Walk to Remember has to be one of the best movies that i have EVER seen!! I love that movie! I litterly was hunched over bawling after the movie! I cried all the way home and 30 minutes after i reached my house!It was awesome! I liked the movie alot better than the book too! Oh yeah-Shane West is the hottest guy in the world!

title: A tearjerker
review: Wow! I just saw this movie and it was great.  Shane West and Mandy Moore had fantastic chemistry.  Mandy Moore played it smart with a small role in "The Princess Diaries" to prepare for "A Walk to Remember".  I don't think i've ever cried so long in a movie before.  If you don't cry you definitely dont have a heart.

title: A Wonderful movie.
review: I went to see "A Walk to Remember" hoping to find that Amanda Moore could act... I was not let down. Amanda "Mandy" picked the perfect role to show she can act as well as sing. It shows she can be serious, not just a "Blonde." West does a good job as well playing her boyfriend/husband. I was very pleased and would recomend this movie to anyone who wants to laugh and cry (oh, you will cry). Britney Spears will probably be kicking herself later!!  *****out of*****.

title: Hopelessly Touching
review: Honestly, the movie was amazingly sweet. At least for me, it touched my hopeless romantic heart. Very different from the book, but I expected that going in. I found myself comparing the two alot even thought I tried not to, but in the end, it really didn't matter.  Shane West was the perfect choice to play Landon Carter, and while I had my doubts about Mandy Moore, she came through with a great performance for the most part.  At times, I felt the story was a little jumpy and that it could've developed more. But the meaningful, heartfelt moments more than compensated.  Might I also add that the music in the movie is amazing, great soundtrack.  A Walk To Remember is a teen movie, without the usual staples.  It definitely sways the audience with maturity, instead of with gross out humor or sight gags.  A Walk to Remember does for the romantic movie what Nicholas Sparks did for the romance novel.

title: Very Good
review: I thought this movie was really good. I wanted to see it from the beginning. My sister saw it first then took me. I thought the beginning was really confusing cuz the guys were really stupid pushing the girls around and being drunk and stuff. After the first part, the movie started to make sense. Shane west is cute, but to tell the truth, sometimes he looks downright evil. It's a little scary. The movie probably should have been PG-13 because of the language, but it was still really good. I REALLY dont like Mandy Moore, but she acted this movie very well. I think she should stay an actor and stop being a singer. :-) I thought Shane's character was really sweet, and it made me wish all guys were like that. (Yeah, wishful thinking) Overall, I would give the movie a 4 out of 5. GO SEE IT!

title: What a great movie!
review: Even though this movie was predictable, it still did a fine job of entertaining me. Any one that loves romantic movies will love this story. Mandy Moore will surprise people with how well she does with what could be a difficult part for a new actress.  I recommend this movie for anyone that enjoys a good love story. And anybody who doesn't fall in love with Mandy Moore after this movie should have their head examined.

title: Great Movie.
review:
I saw this on Saturday and I thought it was great. Manday Moore and Shane West both did a great job.

This was probably also the closest I came to crying at a movie. This and Titanic are the saddest movies I've ever seen.

Bottom line: Excellent.

title: Actually not all that bad..
review:
First off- there are things that I liked about this movie, and there are things that I didn't. First the things I did like: -Mandy Moore's first starring role in a main movie was a bit of a stretch (At least she wasn't playing herself; instead her character worked for me, as the shy girl- Compared to Britney Spears' upcoming movie, her part seemed a lot more different than her regular persona) -The chemistry between Landon and Jamie seemed to work and they seemed right for each other. -Landon's friends all seemed stuck up and jerks except for the black guy, he seemed like he really cared and was a nice guy and provided some funny lines. -Jamie's father- Peter Coyote seemed perfect for his role as the father of Jamie. - A very smooth move made by Landon- I won't reveal what it is but heres a hint: It involves the "state line".

Okay, now some stuff that I didn't like about the movie-

-The tension between Landon and his father- it could have been out of the movie and wouldn't have been missed. - There were some sappy moments, but not as many as there could have been - The fact that I knew the ending before the movie began. (My friend told me)

Anyways- this was a pretty good movie, not the best but if there is nothing better to see, its worth it. It really could have been a made for tv movie, but that doesn't mean its a bad thing.

Thanks

title: A sloppy sap-fest...
review:
A WALK TO REMEMBER / (2002) D-

By Wes Alexander

Teen romances have become very painful for me. It started in 2000 with HERE ON EARTH, continued on with CRAZY/BEAUTIFUL in 2001 and now A WALK TO REMEMBER. I don't know when the creators of these movies stopped caring, but they better start caring soon. The month of January scares me because it is usually the worst month for movies. Studios save all of their good movies for December and in January send out whatever's left on the shelf.

A WALK TO REMEMBER is exactly the same as every other movie of this genre, but here goes: Shane West plays Landon Carter, a reckless teenager who decides it's time to change after a friend of his has an accident He has to- ya know what? Screw it. It's not worth the time to write the summary. You know what happens. He meets Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore) and she starts to change his life forever, as said in the trailer. The two fall in love and so on and whatnot.

It seems with each of these movies I get even more irritated. This film is filled with so many clichÃ©s it's not even funny. This is a line in the movie: `Everything was going fine, then you happened.' I'm serious. That's the kind of dialogue these characters say. The screenplay by Karen Janszen is filled with the most unbelievable and insane dialogue. Does she realize real people don't talk like that? I've never read the book, but I have a high suspicion it's better than the movie.

The only thing that saves this movie is the fact that Moore and West have chemistry. It's rare in these movies, but it does happen in this one. I don't personally like Mandy Moore, but she makes the most of this material. I don't really like Shane West either, but the two make a good pair. It's a pity that they couldn't have had something decent to work with.

It is no doubt that teenage girls will eat up this kind of tripe. It's not their fault, they don't know any better. But, the lack of emotion is a real drag. A half and hour episode of MTV's Undressed has more emotion than all two hours of WALK. This film will be easily forgotten.

title: Awesome!
review: I saw a Walk to Remember for a party I had held on the 27th of February. It was silly and sad. The movie had an awesome cast and Shane West was hot! Anyway, I just read the book a day after I saw the movie. Now, the book is a lot more different than the movie but you'll get the idea if you see it. For holding a harmless prank, Landon Carter (West) has to do community service where he meets Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore.) They eventually fall in love and I won't tell you anymore about it than that. Hope you go see and if you do save some popcorn for me!

title: A trully memorable Jamie!
review: I went to see this movie with the expectation of seeing just another silly "teen" flick. To my amazement the movie was very well acted, extremely emotional, and truly enveloping. The character of Jamie played by Mandy Moore was what impressed me the most. Mandy Moore is a true actress! The character of Jamie was not just another sweet girl done wrong. Jamie was so alive in Mandy emotionally, that in certain parts of the movie I noticed emotions under the surface of Jamie that were almost subliminal, I never thought that someone could show indifference at the surface and hurt underneath the way Jamie does in some scenes. I think this movie should be right up there with Love Story!

title: I was shocked...
review: I went last night to see A Walk to Remember and all though I had read the book I prepared myself for an overacted teenie bopper movie. I was very very wrong. The characters were so amazingly portrayed in the movie I had a hard time believing that it was Mandy Moore a pop goddess and Shane West a practical no name actors except in little teenage romantic comedies. It was heart warming and very well done. I love the sondtrack it really gave a different edge to the story as it is read in the book. I had the misfortune of reading Nicholas Sparks Message in a Bottle and loving it only to go see the movie and notice that it was nothing like the book this is not true of A Walk to Remeber they stuck very true to the story. I loved this movie and I suprised myself by how much I loved it.

title: A positive tear-jerker
review: You are saying how can a tear-jerker be positive?  It is in a lot of ways. Love is a powerful thing and can do wonders.  It is where the nice guy or girl finish first for a change.  This also explains how opposite attracts. The story:  Landon is popular and Jamie is not.  She is plain Jane and moral to boot.  She is scorn by some groups which does not discourage her.  She changes Landon's look towards her by being who she is.  He sees her beauty, outside and in, falls in love.  She wishes not for him to fall in love because something is wrong with her.  I love the movie.  Mandy is very good and beautiful as Jamie.  She makes me think of a hometown girl who fits the bill.  Being clean and wanting respect of who she is.  Shane is good too as well as Daryl Hannah and Peter Coyete.

title: Its one of the best movies I've seen!!
review: I must say that Mandy Moore does extremely well in this movie.  I honestly can't tell you just how good this movie is.  It really touched me in a way that I can't explain.  Mandy Moore and Shane West are a great duo.  They made this movie happen.  Its a hit.  I am glad I got to watch this movie because its something I have to own.  I think that everyone should watch this movie whether they are a Mandy Moore fan or not.  Its worth it, lets just say you won't regret you watched it.  This movie was better than The Princess Diaries.

title: One of the greatest love stories of my generations time.
review: in the last decade teenagers have been bombarded with teeny love stories such as she's all that and what ever it takes. Now finally teenagers are introduced to a true love story that is not  just a comedy. This is a true romantic movie. It touches the soul and makes those who have someone to love want to love and be loved and those who have no one want to have someone. This takes people back to the old saying beauty isn't on the outside but in the inside, but in this case Mandy More has both.

title: PG Rating? Parents, Watch Out!
review:
The opening line of this film was something along the lines of "I've got to take a biiiiiig piss" and then the rest of the movie was liberally sprinkled with variations of the word "s**t." Does it take skin, gore or the f-word to get a PG-13 rating these days?

I mention this as a caution to parents of those under the age of 13. The 12- and 11-year-old girls I took to "A Walk to Remember" were visibly bothered by the salty language. Good for them!

That said, the film was pretty well acted but as predictable as pimples on a teen. Anyone with more than 10 years of moviegoing experience will see every plot twist telegraphed well in advance. That did not deter about a third of the audience from weeping at well manipulated points.

I'd love to know the "back story" of this movie because it was obvious (from the date of safety inspection stickers on many cars) that it was filmed six years ago and then shelved. Usually, that spells major trouble and a total lack of confidence on the part of the studio. "A Walk to Remember" didn't seem to be that big of a mess to me.

I can see why many teens would revere this movie as inspirational. As an adult, it is refreshing to see a teen film that is not glorifying negative stereotypes but celebrates positive values. Go see this with your over-12 kid (if he or she will let you!) and then talk about its messages. If you do, your ticket will be one excellent investment.

title: A great movie
review: Like most people i thought this movie would turn out to be like Glitter or some other singer trying to turn actress.  Vut i was surpised and happy it didn't.  This movie cuts right to your heart.  I sat through the movie holding my b/f and crying ( he was too but if asked he would deny it).  It really made me think and i don't think most movies do that anyone more.  I believe in one true love and this movie made my belief even stronger i loved this movie.  I warned all my friends they need tissues cause i wish i had..had them i was crying alot.

title: Praise, real life values some kids really lack.
review: This emotional film has a first 30 minutes that leave you to wonder where its going, but you will later see. It does a good job of reminding us all that there are more reasons why we are alive than just to satisfy our selves and do for our own self. It goes beyond the things we have or want and spells out the need for understanding, sharing and compassion. A great film with lots of heart. 100 times better than the trailer will let you believe. See it! Then buy a copy of it on DVD to save for when your kids are teens and have them watch it. It might help to make them aware life is more than material things and self righteous attitudes. I was touched by this movie and that isn't easy to do. Q.

title: Great
review: This movie was really good. You all should see it. Some people have been comparing it to she's all that or movies like that but it's not like them at all! The movie was about a girl who NEVER changed and Landon never minded! Most boys aren't like that...But they should know that there's more to girls then looks and what they believe in and what they where. This movie teaches people alot about life. The theater was packed and everyone cried...that's how good it was.

title: Shane West is a Total HOTTIE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: I think this movie was an excellent portrayal of teen life and love! It help to open your eyes to bigger and brighter expectations, this film makes you feel good inside and it lets you know to look past outward apperences and right at a person's heart, mind, and soul. Now you might think that I'm reading too much into "a simple teen movie", but I believe in looking for the whole potential of something! Being only a teen myself it made me look at my life for a second time and realize maybe I have been doing it right.( by this I mean I'm living my life by my standards and I'm loving it/and if someone can write a character like Jamie Sullivan maybe they do understand a lot better then I thought they did) Well, I loved the movie and if you didn't quite understand my last line it's okay!?!, I just thought I'd give my two-sence about a movie that will take it's place on my favorites list, plus an added BONUS is that Shane West is a Total HOTTIE!!!!!!!!!

title: this movie was amazing!!!
review: i loved this movie so much, it is one of the best movies i have ever seen. mandy moore was an excellent actress, i didn't expect her to be so good. it was just an all around great movie.  so i suggest you go and see this movie, asap!!!

title: Surprised
review: I wasn't going to go see this movie because it was about high school kids, but my brother said go see it and I wasn't sorry.  I knew it was about high school kids, and the girl was not accepted but not much else.  We have seen movies that deal with discrimination due to color, race, sexual preference, sex, looks and weight.  But not one on Christian religious beliefs in high school.  If was refreshing to see it could be done well and someone in hollywood would even make it. It tends to be a "chick flick" but the guys could learn from this.

title: Mixed Feelings
review:
As a Movie I say tops. As a movie derived from a book...It went splat. There was soo much not in the movie. as a matter of fact it seems as the movie only took the main story from the book. The book focuses more on the feelings and faith of Jaime rather than the relationship between landon and her.

I recommend reading the book and seeing the movie so you can see how much more feeling you can get from reading this book.

title: Touching
review: I was very surprised to end up loving this movie.  I thought it was going to be just like all the other bad boy meets and falls in love with good girl. I was wrong, this movie goes deep down and shows up how people can change our lives forever.

title: If you want a film to remember...this is the one.
review: The only bad thing about this movie is it's advertising campaign.  This is one of the greatest films, I've ever seen, and the only reason why I didn't go sooner, was because I didn't think it would be worth a dime, because of the advertising.  You will enjoy every aspect of this film.  Mandy Moore definitely has a bright future, and the whole cast is really wonderful. It's a movie for the fellas, and a movie for the girls.  It's a movie for everyone.  Young, and old.  I really hope this film continues to do well. It's certainly one you will remember.

title: This is a wonderful movie. Clean and heart lifting. All ages
review: I enjoyed this movie very much.  It was a movie that I would not feel embarrassed to see with my daughter or my mother.  The acting was very good and the story plot was warm and light.  It had moments of suspense...I had a difficult time keeping dry eyes.  It was so neat to see two young people in love and I thought it was really cool how she was able to keep her focus and it was cool how he saw what she represented and wanted to be with her.  It was a sad ending, but a heart lifting movie.  My wife and I enjoyed it together. Sort of a 15 year old version of "A Love Story" but better.

title: This movie portrayed innocence at its best.
review: It is a "must see movie". Critics who think otherwise need a different job, because they have no taste whatsoever. The cast that was chosen was absolutely perfect. You can't possibly say that "the book was better than the movie" or that "the movie was better than the book." If you love "tear-jerkers" with a little romance involved, this is the movie to see. So what are you waiting for? Get up and go!

title: Amazing movie. Worth seeing more than once
review:
A Walk to Remember is an amazing movie. I saw it last weekend and also this weekend. It was THAT good! It is worth seeing more than once. All the reviews I have read have been positive but I really don't listen to critics too much because it's just their opinion. Sometimes when they say a movie is great, I see it and it stinks or they say it stinks and I love it. So I suggest everyone should make their own decision and opinion of the movie. I personally loved the movie. My older brother and everyone in the theater loved it too.

The book is incredible. It's alittle different than the movie but both are excellent. The director did an incredible job and so did everyone associated with the movie. Shane West and Mandy Moore were perfect as Landon and Jamie. They gave amazing performances. They are very talented actors and have amazing on-screen chemistry.

I highly recommend this movie.

title: Worth Remembering
review: Don't believe the critics. Trust me. I almost did and I'm glad I didn't. A Walk to Remember is a wonderful movie. It's a movie with faults. It's a movie that probably could have been directed better. But while a flawless movie with no faults might win an Oscar, it might not entertain and touch you like "A Walk to Remember". Let me preface this by saying that although I have known tendencies to get into bubble gum pop, such as Britney Spears etc...I was not a fan of Mandy Moore. Nor did I think she was all that looks-wise either (at least prior to this film).  I decided to give this movie a try because the online feedback was truly compelling. I went to several different movie databases and the customer reviews were really persuasive.  I almost didn't go because just about every critic bashed the movie except Roger Ebert who gave it high marks. So, I decided to give it a try. The movie is set in a small town (Beaufort, NC). It begins predictably enough with the bad boy and pals bullying the commoners in the usual H.S. way. But the movie becomes very different from the She's All That, American Pie, type genre.  Mandy Moore is cast as the preacher's daughter, but instead of the usual portrayal of the "preacher's kid" we find a person very comfortable in her own skin, very devoted to God, and ernestly making progress towards her life goals (which include 'befriending someone I don't like" and "being in two places at once"). Landon Carter (Shane West) is being punished for some misdeeds and is forced to do community service, where he finds Jamie Sullivan (Moore) already there and obviously, she does this regularly. I won't go any further into this because I hate reviews that give away the whole movie. What I will say is that it's been a long long time since I saw a truly enjoyable movie that had such a positive message about life and love. I was amazed at how they showed how one person can make so much difference in the life of another.  If you are with your significant other, I guarantee that you will hold him/her a little bit tighter walking out of the theater In summation...it's a wonderful, feel good flick. It's got all of the sappy romance of the "Wedding Singer" with the emotion of a movie like "Untamed Heart". But in the end, it will make you reflect on who you are, what goals you have set ,  and how you will move towards living every day instead of passing time.

title: Best movie ever!
review: Honestly, I thought this movie was not going to be "that great" because I HAVE seen novels turned into movies and the outcome was that the movie never turned out as good as the book itself. I guess I was wrong! My friends and I watched "A Walk To Remember" last night and the audience turn-out was pretty impressive. As someone who's read the book already, I already knew what was going to happen, so when I saw one of my friends crying, I just laughed. But the ending was the best part. And for the first time ever in a movie theater, I actually cried! :)

title: Not a dry eye in the audience
review: This movie was so sad.  The packed audience I watched it with was blubbering three quarters of the way through it.  I know this is kind of a hybrid of She's all that and Here on Earth, but I really enjoyed this movie.  And no, I'm not a thirteen year old girl.  I'm a seventeen year old guy who was semi-dragged to see this by three of my lady friends.  At the beginning we were all making fun of the movie and stuff but by the end we were all silent.  A perfect date movie and one of the better teen movies of recent years.  Who'd a thought Mandy Moore could act?  And, yes, she does sing. But it's in the school musical so it's not all that outlandish.

title: The Greatest movie ever.
review: I just saw the movie for second time(i plan on seeing it many more times). I think i cried more at the second one.  This is the best movie i've ever seen, the acting was great & their was nothing wrong with the movie what so ever. I just would like to congradulate all the actors and actresses on doing a wonderful job, they really deserve it. ~Danielle

title: a beautifully made movie
review: maybe I am biased as a nicholas sparks reader  but a walk to remember was very well done and cant help  but touch the heart of a true believer in romance, I believe mandy moore and shane west were geat together in this part and with peter coyote as her father .... very believable  characters, she called him her angel, i believe she was his and saved him from himself, if u like romantic, tug at  your heart strings  movies , go see this one, and it will be "a walk to rememember , this is one ,to see  with someone , you might hold  special .... a   wonderful   story and kudos to   mandy for the part she  played and shane west too.... bravo

title: I loved this MOvie ! MAjor chick flick But good for guys 2 C!!!
review:
I really liked this Movie ! deffinetly one of my top 5! It really showed a clean believable Image of real love. Nothing fake about it !

It was a pretty clean movie also. (which i like) Nothing immoral really . just a little questionable language ( most of it is over in the beginning) It made you really feel inspired. anyway I REALLY enjoyed it ! although it was sad . bottom line.............SEE IT!!!!!!!

title: This is definately A Walk I'll Remember!
review:
My rating on this movie: 11/10 It was a sensational, uplifting film that I walked out of the theatre saying "I want to see that again!" Most movies I'll wait to see when they come to rent after seeing them in the theatre, but this one I will probably see at least once more in the theatre! It made me laugh and made me cry.

The story started out with a sigh in the opening scene and I thought "Oh God it is the teen movie from Hell!", but as it moved on I began to fall in love with it. The camera work and direction is simple and the dialogue is perfect. My goal is to make the girl that I like as happy as Landon did in the movie. I hear the book is so much better than the movie, and if that is true I am definately getting the book!

Mandy Moore was SENSATIONAL and can definately act (much better than the looks of Britney Spears' new movie CROSSROADS which looks so incredibly stupid, but I'll give it a chance as I do every movie). Shane West is also very good as the co-star and Peter Coyote delievers an EXCELLENT performance.

Please see this movie....everyone in the theater from myself to the father with his daughter next to me was in tears throughout the movie. It is uplifting and adds just enough humor to keep you interested. Take this walk...and remember it!

title: The Best Movie Ever
review: I think that A Walk To Remember is the best movie ever. I read the book long before I ever knew there was going to be a movie. I loved the book. It was a little slow at parts but overall it was a warm-hearted book. When the movie came out I read the reviews. When I saw that it was only given 1-Â½ stars I was spectacle about going to see it but I went anyway. I have to say that the critics don't know a good movie when they see one. A Walk To Remember made me laugh, made me cry, and most of all made me hope. I think that everyone should go to see this movie. I can't wait till it comes out on video so I can own it and watch it over and over.

title: This was a book?
review: Why did they label this movie A walk to remember?  This was half bad sappy movie and half Mandy Moore Concert.  I know when they make the book/movie transformation they always change a lot of things, and the book is always better.. but seriously.  The only reason this was based on a novel by Nicholas Sparks was because of the character's names.  But I do have to say, this was the best comedy I have ever seen.  "I'm sick, Landon." HAHAHA.  I couldn't stop laughing.  Maybe it was because it was poorly acted, or maybe because Mandy Moore was saying it.  I was waiting for her to break out with "Candy".  The only good part about this movie was the Jars of Clay song, "Flood".  Don't waste your money, if you wanna see a serious movie.  Spend it if you wanna laugh.  Read the book people.

title: AWESOME MOVIE
review: I wasn't expecting a PG movie to be this great, but I loved it.  We were originally going to see Orange County, but I'm glad I didn't now.  I saw it 2 times now in 2 weeks, and I can't get enough of it!  I can't wait to buy it on DVD when it comes out.  If you didn't see this movie, go see it! Gauranteed you'll love it.

title: THE MOST ROMANTIC TEEN MOVIE IN AGES
review: So many movies about teens show the immature side of kids. But A Walk to Remember is about real people, with real problems and joys and sorrows, and love - the characters just happen to been teens. Mandy Moore was most impressive in taking over a roll and not coming off like a popstar making a movie. Though new at acting, Mandy was just incredible in the role of Jamie - convincing on every level. There are many more experienced actors and actresses that could take a lesson from Mandy on how to get into the persona of a character, as opposed to just playing themselves over and over in every movie. And the music - the AWTR CD is the best movie soundtrack I've ever heard. All the songs on it blend together so well, and the song "Only Hope" is one of the most beautiful love songs I've ever heard. I expect we'll be seeing more of Mandy Moore the actress. Good job Mandy!

title: Awesome
review: I think this movie was great. I just got home from seeing it a little while ago. The whole theater was crying! I think u all should go see it...Mandy was great in it. Shane wasn't bad either. It's not about some ugly girl who gets made over like She's All that...She stayed the same.....And Landon didn't mind! I dont know any guys like that... Go see it today! Bye bye :-)

title: Very Surprisingly Good.
review: I was very shocked by how much I enjoyed this film.  After watching the previews I anticipated a very "Lovey Dovey Teen Movie," I couldn't have been more wrong.
