But Jamie is hiding the biggest secret of all from Landon, something that she decides that they can not be together, for it will cause to must pain for him and her when this secret comes to past.

title: "It All Comes Down To Who's By Your Side"
review:
A Walk to Remember

Rating: PG | for thematic elements, language and some sensual material Theatrical Release: 2002 Runtime: 102 min.

Critique: The foundation for "A Walk to Remember" is built upon hope, faith and love. The age old story of good and evil is portrayed here, yet not in a traditional style. The rebellion of Landon and his friends is introduced first. Jamie is portrayed as the preacher's daughter who sets the good example. The contrast of their characteristics is clearly defined in the movie, showing good and evil. Even though resentment is taken against their newfound relationship, they prove their love and stay together. Do you hate sappy love movies? Well this movie is anything but sappy. The care for realistic emotions between Landon and Jamie is carefully created while cheesy love is left in the can. Even though this is a romance, a small amount of comedy is added to keep the movie flowing smoothly. Jamie and Landon soon find themselves facing a serious roadblock. This problem is quite unusual for teen movies because I feel it's something that would be presented to an older audience. I can't reveal the situation since it will give away the movie, but I encourage everyone young and old to view the film. I'm glad this plot was chosen because it's something anyone could face at anytime and it should be considered more in film-making. Although "A Walk to Remember" isn't a true story, novelist Nicholas Sparks adds some similar situations in his life to the movie. The crew denies that the movie is a Christian film. However the use of faith, hope, and love develops their relationship. Without these values there wouldn't be a film because it's based on those principals. A specific religion isn't really discussed since it focuses upon a generic stance in the belief in God and the values I just mentioned. What a clever approach to make it basic don't you think? It tries not to offend by taking one side of a religion. The conclusion of the movie is wrapped up very beautifully, being based on faith and love; the values that Jamie cherishes oh so much. You're in for a great experience of faith and hope, proving that love never fails.

*Audio 8/10: There's music ranging from Cold to Switchfoot, however the film score steals the show easily. "Only Hope" is performed in it's entirety by Mandy Moore for the school play scene. It's not one of the highlights because it seems to last for an eternity. Shane West(Landon Carter) delivers a voice-over during the start of Mandy Moore's "Cry", making it a great way to end the film with a punch. There are some minor errors that could be fixed for the audio, but nothing major. Subtitles are presented in English, French and Spanish. Languages are available in English and French (Dubbed in Quebec) in Dolby Surround 5.1.

*Video: 8/10: A crisp and clear picture is presented throughout the entire film. There is some grain but you have to look close to see it. Beautiful arrays of colors are presented from the filming locations in and around Wilmington, NC. The video is offered in a letterbox widescreen format. Scene access and interactive menus are also available.

*Extras 7/10: The extras are quite nice for the film. Two commentaries are provided, the first by film director Adam Shankman, Shane West and Mandy Moore. The second is by novelist Nicholas Sparks and screenwriter Karen Janszen. A theatrical trailer, cast film highlights, and a music video are also provided. The first commentary is rather outlandish since they seem to goof off rather than giving us good details of the story as in the second commentary. Deleted scenes and a 'making of' should have been added for an in-depth analysis, but they fail to give us that. The best extra is the music video entitled "Cry" by Mandy Moore, which is based exclusively on the film.

*Since studios release a variety of DVD editions with extras: the audio, video, and extra reviews may be directed at one specific version.

title: My favourite movie in the entire universe
review:
This movie is most definitely a teen chick flick, but who cares? It's the most awesome movie in the entire universe. Shane West and Mandy Moore have really great chemistry and both act really well in the movie. Shane West especially is really really really really really good in this movie, he makes the movie for me really. I made my mom and brother watch it and although they don't like it as much, they still think it's a good movie.

And although a lot of people think this movie is religious, I completely disagree. Just because one of the main characters is Christian doesn't make it a religious movie. I'm not Christian and I still absolutely love the movie.

If you're a teenage girl who likes romance and tear jerkers and you haven't seen this movie, you are seriously missing out.

title: I was blindsided by this one
review:
I don't like teen movies and I hate sappy romances. I was cornered (by my wife) into watching this.

Fifteen minutes into the movie, we were into familiar teen movie territory. The handsome rebel, and the angelic good girl. Egad, is this 'Grease'? Where are the musical numbers!? But then, something unexpected happened. The leads broke from most formula conventions and actually started to develop into fleshed out, three dimensional characters. These kids grew into vulnerable, identifiable people driven by real motives. They drew my empathy. I cared about them. I especially liked the way they handled Moore's Christian character. These days, it's rare to see religious people portrayed as sincere and reasonable instead of self-righteous, Bible thumping caricatures.

Yes, it got a little sappy towards the end, but by that time, they had earned my affection, so I didn't really mind. Don't get me wrong, Mr. Lowdown's no wuss, but I hafta say, I got a little choked up near the end.

This movie proves my theory that even tired movies formulas can be made new by putting a spin on the way the characters are presented.

If you leave your tired cynicism on hold, you'll enjoy this one.

title: Two total opposites who fall deeply in love!
review: I recommend this movie to all teenage girls. I promise, after this movie, you will be in love with Shane West. He is a total hottie in this movie. He's the perfect bf. This movie is definitely my favorite movie. Its so romantic! Many people don't enjoy it because its pretty unrealistic. I love how unrealisticly romantic it is though. Its a major chick flick, so i don't recommend it to any guys. I've watched this movie over 8 times, and Shane west gets hotter every time! <3 He's a bad boy who changes into a charming guy for his true love. He is so perfect for this role and if Adam shankman had picked a different actor for that role, it definitely wouldn't have been nearly the same. I am so in love with Shane west and its a little depressing that a guy would never really do that. i don't regret watching it though. I love Shane west<3

title: Refreshingly told love story
review:
This film is about the unlikely first love between a reverend's daughter and a young man who is up to all sorts of mischief. After their chance meeting, their lives are changed forever.

I really liked this film. Despite the predictable story, it is told in a refreshing manner. Character development is great. Both the main characters change subtly, bit by bit, after being influenced by each other. Cinematography was good, and the cameraman's skill is already fully shown at the first scene, where the camera moves in different directions and at different speed to focus on various things that are going on in the youngsters gathering.

I particularly respect the fact that Mandy Moore is portrayed wholesomely, without having to resort to using skin to attract other boys (or the movie goers). There was even not a sex scene, which I have no complaints about. This down-to-earth girl-next-door is attractive without being sexy or glamorous. Sex does not equal love. I think it is an important message to be told to young people.

This movie is touching and I do recommend it!

title: wonderfully amazing
review: This is one of the most beautiful movies I have ever come across. The script is tight,all scenes important and each dialog meant to be listened to.The movie makes you want to love and be loved. You see some brilliant performances by Shane West and Mandy Moore. Music in the film is wonderful again.Its amazing how a very smart,handsome brat falls in love with a girl he had known, hated, mocked and made fun of since childhood.Both the boy and the girl make difference to each other's lives in beautiful ways.You'll simply love the way Landon Carter wins Jamie Sullivan's heart and how he makes her wishes come true. An absolute must for young at heart!!. A heart touching movie.

title: Fabuluous
review:
I THINK IT S A FABULUOUS MOVIE

Shane west and Mandy Moore was great.story was impressive and almost perfect.It would be a legend movie for me, if it would be attached importance to much.for example end of it ,maybe, would be more dramatic

but Although all of this I think this is a great movie and nothing can change it

AND AT LAST IT S advised that this movie is watched by me

watch and enjoy that trust me;

you won't be regretful

really trust me

title: an absolute FANTASTICCCCC movie =)
review:
Landon, whom is not doing so good in the direction he is heading in with his "cool-type" reputation, gets an opportunity to redeem himself, and make a change for the better. Jamie was/is his chance. There was a reason why Jamie specifically told Landon not to fall in love with her when she agreed to help him, and that very reason is what turns the whole story behind the movie around. It's a shocker...I couldn't believe it.

I love love loveeeee romantic movies, but this one is pretty close up next to "The Notebook". I thought this movie was great...it's a real "tear-jerker". All else said, it's a really great movie. Definitely one of my favorites, I love it.

title: the love
review: this movie is 1 of my favorites great love story great story line very emotional and very romantic..all the actors did awesome in this movie..i watch this movie often because wen i see it it moves me..i mean the popular guy falls for the plain rev runs daughter by misbehaving on property and jamie helps him through everything and falls in love with her..but she tells him not 2 fall in love cuz she knows 1 of these days shes gonna die from the cancer..Jamie's father wasn't 2 found of Landon "west"at first but after he realizes jamie changed him..his father likes him..and then he asks 2 marry jamie and then they had the summer 2gether and she failed from her unfailing faith that she gave 2 Landon..and then Landon got into medical school from Jamie's 2 do list and gives her father the quotes book back from the hospital that jamie gave him..and its been 4 years already..this movie is so sweet and brings tears 2 my eyes..great movie 2 watch with boyfriend..married couple..i highly recommend it..

title: i have no tears left
review:
We loved the film the only thing was that we are 11,13,14 years old and we haven't got any tears left because we have been crying for the whole film and a hour after the film. The saddest thing was that it was based on a true history. After crying that much we had a head ache a stomach ache and our eyes were sore. After all that pain the film was brilliant. We think that the film should have the record of the saddest film in the world. It is sadder than Titanic which we all cried over.It was very realistic and well done to every one that made it so good and all that made it possible.Well done to the writers that write such a good film and the directors that directed it so well.The film was so good i would watch it again it was worth the pain.

FROM Hilda,Ines and Lola

title: Life changing movie
review: When I first watched this movie it was late one night, around one, on the TV. I wasn't sure what it was about but I thought from the title that it would be another soppy love chick flick, I was dead wrong. This movie shocked me to the core. I expected my happy ending and unfortunately didn't get one but it was satisfying all the same. The story starts off as a typical chick flick always does, the cool guy of the school and the nerdy and geeky girl have to hang out for some reason such as she has to teach him, in this case they have to run lines together for a drama class. As they spend more and more time together they fall in love, deeply in love. The girl is deeply religious and we don't find out why until later. A few days or weeks, it isn't specified, into the relationship the girl tells the boy that she's dying. Hints are given during the film by the girls father but it isn't really recognised until now. The girl slowly starts to die from leukaemia and it's heart breaking but the boy stays by her side all the same. They get married and then she passes away. The last few lines of the movie are beautiful, they are :"Jamie saved my life. She taught me everything. About life, hope and the long journey ahead. I'll always miss her. But our love is like the wind. I can't see it, but I can feel it." The End.

title: A Movie you will remember....
review:
Everyone in this world hopes to find something or someone that will truly change their life. Amusingly, it comes at the strangest time and at the most testing circumstances. The movie is a true depiction of how a person's perspective to see others and himself changes just by falling in love. The performance of the lead characters are at its finest, considering they still have a long way to go. The unsung heroes are really the apt screenplay, awe inspiring background scores and the classical direction. This is a movie that the cast , the producers and the director can totally be proud of.

Cast and Crew,take a bow. It's your time in the limelight.

title: My feelings about the movie
review:
A Walk to Remember is one of the best romantic movie I have ever seen. Its all about love. A really very good movie for not only the teenagers, but for everyone. It shows that, love brings goodness to earth.

May be this movie hasn't Julia Roberts, Hugh Grant or such star, but it shows better, through pop singer Mandy Moore and Shane West. There is no doubt about their acting efficiency or quality. They are just- as natural as could be! The plot was really cool. Friendship, Love, Dedication- everything is used in a very passionate way. The most important thing is, it can easily touch your mind, make you emotional and wets your eyes.

title: A Walk to Remember
review: I saw the movie a WALK TO REMEMBER a few weeks ago and I must say it is one of my new favorite movies. I doubt Mandy Moore or Shane West will ever see this, but I want them to know they did an awesome, realistic job. I liked especially how Landon shows his love and affection to Jamie and respects her boundaries. I hope to have a love like that someday. I also read the book---Awesome and even sadder. Could not put down. Can't stop thinking about it. There is significant changes from the book to movie. But in general, "the spirit and Feel" of the movie is the same as the book. If you want to read or see a true love story, read or watch a Walk to Remember. In conclusion it is a sweet, innocent, compelling, riveting, tear jerking story.

title: if there has ever been a movie that made me a better man, this was it.
review: I first went to an advanced screening of this movie with a large group of women and children. I had no idea what to expect but I can promise you I was not expecting much, as a 38 year old male the prospect of seeing a Mandy Moore film did not thrill me. Wow was I surprised! This is as good a portrayal of what selfless Love between 2 people is supposed to be as anything you will ever see.Mandy Moore was fantastic. Shane West was perhaps even better in as good a performance as I have seen. Perhaps this movie did not get the respect it deserved because of the youthful cast. this whole cast should be able to look back in years to come at this movie and know they were part of something very special

title: Stunning and truly memorable
review:
I only came across this film very recently (within the last year) and was completely hooked by the storyline from my very first viewing.

Since then I have lost count of the times I have watched it, yet on every single viewing the film impresses me more and is definitely one of my favourite films. The script and monologue within the film is powerful and emotive which is greatly aided by the amazing chemistry between Shane West and Mandy Moore's characters. I cannot truly express in words how this film makes you feel, you are taken in by the story and the characters and become a part of the trials and tribulations they face in a relationship that occurs against the odds.

A refreshing film that really encompasses the true meaning of romance and the traditional values of courtship. Its impossible not to completely fall in love with the characters and the storyline.

A Walk to Remember is a simple yet powerful and extremely emotive story of love and the traditional values of romance. A truly inspiring and amazing film that you will not forget, a 'must see' film.

title: A really awesome and touching movie!
review: Once I heard a friend talking about this movie and I thought I was going to be a good movie just to spend time but I found out that it was one of the best movies ever!! Its just awesome.... Mandy Moore is such a great actress and Shane West is so handsome and great actor and in this movie he looks so sweet!.... It is a sad movie... I cried a lot especially at the end... Its so touching... I think its a movie for people of all ages... but specially for teens because its so romantic, sweet and simply beautiful... The music is also great! Mandy Moore is an awesome singer and her music is just perfect for the movie... What more can I say?... Its an awesome and beautiful movie and I invite everyone to see it but specially teenage girls like me....

title: If You Don't Like This Movie, You're An Insensitive Jerk
review:
The story is simple: a rebel boy with a broken childhood (Shane West) gets placed with a good Christian girl (Mandy Moore) and she begins to change him into a better person. Yes, the plot is really that simple.

I have seen this movie a bit more than a handful of times and would go so far as to say the film is my third favorite movie of all time (behind "Mallrats" and "Waterworld"). So if my opinion is a little biased, my sincerest apologies.

The star of this film is Shane West, who went on to be a big star on the television show "ER" and the mismanaged film "League of Extraordinary Gentlemen". I was convinced that he was a rebel, a lover and a confused little boy. He seemed very good at expressing a wide range of feelings and it was easy to identify with him. Excellent casting, especially considering at the time he was an unknown.

Mandy Moore also stars, but she is clearly following Shane's lead. With the exception of her solo scene (where she will amaze you with her vocal beauty and stunning good looks), she doesn't really do very much. She walks with her head down and talks in a monotone voice. There are times where I wasn't sure if this was bad acting or a poorly written character. But maybe you won't notice. I didn't notice until my third or fourth viewing (and I think it helps if you're watching with someone you care about). Even in her solo scene, the director seems to be unsure of what angle he wants to work with, which seems to distract from the whole. My friend Shannon also found the song a bit long, although I disagree.

Multiple viewings are required to pick up on all the subtle hints left throughout the film about the twist. You might catch some, but others you will completely miss. I guarantee.

I think the budget went almost entirely to the soundtrack. Daryl Hannah ("Kill Bill", "Blade Runner") and Peter Coyote ("Return of the Living Dead 4: Necropolis") must have worked for free, because there are something like thirty songs in this movie (including at least three by Mandy Moore, but a variety of other things like Jars of Clay and "Big Pimpin" appear). If you pay attention to just the music, you'll notice very few scenes aren't loaded with some song -- so again, is the movie selling the soundtrack or is the soundtrack selling the movie?

But anyway, yeah, watch this with someone you love. You might cry your eyes out. I did on my first viewing in the theater with my girlfriend at the time. Of course, if you're a girl, you might cry anyway. And that's cool. Guys like chicks who cry. We totally dig that. Why do you think we let you watch Lifetime? This film, like Lifetime, is a guilty pleasure -- maybe nothing Oscar-worthy, but a fun and emotional movie. Also, it makes a great precursor for the much bigger and much sadder Nicholas Sparks masterpiece, "The Notebook".

title: Great!!!
review: The greatest movie ever I saw! That movie really show us what real love is. Anyone, who has a heart would like that movie! It's says what life is, what death is, and what is a real real love! I think that love is almost impossible, it's too big and too beautiful... But I would dream about that kind of love... And everybody should. That movie is really not about something, it's about feelings. "A walk to remember" includes every feeling, every kind of pain. When you see that movie you could understand what life is. You'll see everything different than you saw it before. It's all would change. Movie says us how purposeful can be people for love. They can do everything... Everything for love. You just should believe in that love and, if you will, you'll understand what is real love, and "A walk to remember" would touch your heart... Beautiful story...:'(

title: Precious and Unforgettable
review:
This movie is one of the precious memories that I cherish having shared together with my late wife. I still vividly remember tears streaming down my face as we watched a simple seemingly predictable plot unfold into a profound statement about life and living.

Mandy Moore donned this part so very naturally, almost as if perhaps written for her from the start. It is not a musical, but she does sing a couple of times and though I probably watched this movie 3 or 4 years ago, her songs had such an impact on me, that I can still comment on them now.

Treat someone you love to an unforgettable evening by watching this together.

title: one of the best movies ever
review:
This is by far my favorite movie that i have ever seen, even the book is excellent. it is the tale about two young teenagers, Jaime Sullivan (Moore) and Landon Carter (West) and how they are put together after Landon gets into some serious trouble with the law. They come from two totally different lifestyles, Jaimes dad is a Reverend, and Landons dad is a doctor who walked out on his family.

It is a very touching love story, as many young people can relate to this plot. Jaime had Landon promise that she wouldn't fall in love with him, but he did. He took care of her and loved her right to the end.

Nicholas Sparks wrote a great book, even though it didn't follow along with the movie. Everything was very twisted, as things that happen at the end of the movie, happen at the beginning and vice versa. He is the only male author that i have ever read anything by that had a more touching theme than any female author i have read anything by. He also writes my favorite book, The Notebook. These are two amazing books and movies. (and Ryan Gosling is even Canadian)!

title: a walk to remember
review: This was a fantastic film. It was great for families especially preteens and teens. I loved it and watched it 50 times. My children loved it as well. I bought it for all my friends with children. It was a great message. I believe in the message of being who you are and not pressured to be what people expect you to be. It was an excellent performance by Shane West! It was charming and touching I cried my eyes out. I loved the all music. Mandy was great too, I liked the play scene the best because she was and sang beautifully. Yes, I knew Shane was building the telescope because of the comet Jamie mention earlier in the movie. Overall it was a 10! I loved it so much! Great job everyone!!!!

title: Flawed but touching film
review: "A Walk to Remember" will upset older viewers and some young ones, too. The film itself is excellent. It brought tears to my eyes, and justly so. My only caveat is that the original beginning of the story, set forty years ago, as it appears in Spark's book, which I read, was so different from the vulgarity of the film's modern day opening that it upset me.Also, changing the Christmas play to a spring play about gangsters also jarred me.These changes had an effect on the tone of the film and its prevailing mood which Sparks worked so hard to create in the book. Despite some other changes, the story and the acting of the two main characters was so compelling that it overcame my initial negative reaction. I would highly recommend this film, but don't read the book first. I'll never understand why film makers insist on dumbing down teenage stories with scenes that are not really typical of most of them, who are more sensitive than many Hollywood types realize.

title: Liked it
review: There are certain movie genres that traditionally don't attract me at all. Love movies usually aim to make the women identify with the female lead, and let's face it, are meant to squeeze a few tears. The story is always a little too dramatic, and you'll come to expect the stereotypes of betrayal, impossible love or tragic death. 'Love Story' is perhaps the perfect example for this, and I believed a 'cheesy' romance will never make me turn from my usual routine. I was wrong. This movie, which owes much to 'Love Story', and features teen pop-singer Mandy Moore(whose music I never listen to), virtually without any acting experience, of course guided by the script, gives life to this pure, smart, integer and delicately feminine high-school girl who mesmerized me with her stoic attitude towards destiny, and made me watch the entire movie. I couldn't hold myself from feeling a little like Shane West's character discovering her. Somewhat moved.

title: A Truly Painful Film
review: I won't dispel any specific plot points or comment on them, as I feel that the strength of this movie is not in it's plot (not to say it's plot isn't good, it is) but in it's power, it's emotion. The performances, soundtrack and direction are done to elicit the greatest possible emotion from the viewer, and it does that without breaking a sweat. It makes you feel like crying and never stopping, and yet you still feel like coming back for more (and coming from someone who doesn't let that part of myself out, that's saying something). Not to say you'll want to watch it repeatedly, but probably every couple of years (or even yearly if you have a poor memory) you'll feel compelled to revisit he movie, just make sure you have some Kleenex handy

title: this film was truly brilliant
review: Well what can i say this film was truly excellent from the beginning to the end and really captures the true meaning of love. i was a little l8 in watching this movie i only watched it like a week ago i was flicking through sky and saw it listed i thought y not check it out i mean u never know right. so anyway i watched it and i was amazed i was in tears 4 ages. it was such a beautiful film, it was so sad i thought that the acting was excellent and Mandy Moore was a gr8 actress alongside Shane west who i thought was wonderful. this may sound kinda corny and cheesy and there maybe sum of u who think oh god get a life its just a stupid movie, but this film changed me in so many ways and has opened my eyes up and yes it has changed my life. I'm only 17 so i have my whole life to live and I'm not going to take anything for granted as from now after watching this movie its made me realise that when you find sumthing gd grab on to it with both hands and never let go. my advise to those of you out there who have not yet seen this film plz plz sum point in Ur lives sooner rather then l8r WATCH IT because i guarantee you u will become a better person. this film will make you cry but also make you laff and is definitely by far the best movie I've ever seen and i can watch it over and over agen and never get bored.

title: A bit corny, and not without flaws, but...
review:
I loved it! As a 16 year old male, I have never really been into movies like this before, but last week, whilst flicking through the channels late at night I came across A Walk to Remember. (if you must know, it was the only thing on at the time, so I didn't plan in advance to watch.) Despite missing the first 20 minutes, I quickly picked up the plot and began to really enjoy it. I honestly couldn't see Jamie's illness coming (although like I said it was late at night) and from that moment on I was captivated. So much in fact, that the next day I went out and bought the DVD and the book, and proceeded to enjoy and finish both by the end of the day.

I had not heard of either Mandy Moore or Shane West before watching so you can imagine my surprise when I found out that this was Mandy's first leading role. I thought she portrayed Jamie Sullivan, the minister's daughter and all round good girl, brilliantly. She brought a certain innocence to the performance which is impossible to learn, probably on reflection due to lack of experience, which really added to my enjoyment. Shane West did an admirable job as Landon Carter, the town's bad boy whose life gets turned around when he spends a bit of time with Jamie.

The film was so good in fact that I would put on a level with the book. Usually the film never lives up to the novel it is based upon and so is often disappointing in my eyes, but that is not the case here. The soundtrack (which I now also own) adds something to the film that the book cannot have, and in particular the songs "Only hope" and "Cry" (sung by Moore) were excellent and appropriate to the scene they were in. I also think that the film portrays the character of Jamie Sullivan better as well, as in the book she is made out to be a saint who does absolutely nothing wrong and is somewhat one dimensional (almost robotic), which I thought was slightly unrealistic. She is made out to be more human with feelings in the film. (the emotional scenes were played very well by Mandy Moore, I really felt for her) However, she is made out to be slightly sarcastic in the movie, for example in the "Read my mind" scene and where she puts down Dean. ("he (God) is probably looking for your brain") I don't think that she would have had a pop at her God, if she was a really devoted Christian. The list of ambitions that Jamie has is also a nice addition.

The corny bits? Well one immediately springs to mind. What sort of person says to another person on a serious level "You have to promise not to fall in love with me"? Maybe if it was a joke, then perhaps, but you can see that she really means it. Obviously later we find out why she says it, but even Jamie, who does not have many if any friends, could not be that naive.

So why give it 10 out of 10 if it has flaws? No movie is perfect, and the impact that this movie has had on me is greater than any other. It is a truly touching story of love, the impacts that love has on people, and the obstacles that people are willing to over come in the name of love.

This is a fantastic and very moving story that I would recommend to anyone.

title: so great
review: Hai, I'm a sixteen year old girl from Belgium and yesterday night, the film was on air for the first time. And I watched it because there was nothing else on. And I just loved it. Normally, I am not so very into romantic films and I don't cry easily. But yesterday, by the time the movie was half way through, I found myself crying in my bed like a child.(I was watching in my room) It was so sad, I never really cry with a movie, sometimes on the inside but never like yesterday. During commercials, I had to took a box of handkerchiefs, and even when the movie was done, I have been crying for half an hour. I think this is the most emotional movie I've ever seen and when it's on cable again, I'm gonna watch it for sure. Really recommended

title: For everyone who yearns for their own walks to be remembered...
review: I watched the movie lot of times (at theater, at home, at my friends' house even at my aunt's house) and I always end up crying every time. Shane West (Landon Carter) and Mandy Moore (Jamie Sullivan) both gave outstanding performances to their film characters and the chemistry is perfect (awesome!). Though the film is like four years ago, way back when I was seventeen. I still believe that this film offers more than just a teen movie. More than just an ugly-duckling-Cinderella plot. More than just a teenage-courtship love story. There's more to that... Lessons not only teenagers should learn. It is for everyone who yearns for their own walks to be remembered. Humility, simplicity, forgiveness, trust, faith, miracle and true-love that might somehow change or make you think twice regarding your perception of people, of love, of faith and most especially the purpose of your life.

title: walking tear jerker
review: A walk to remember is one of my personal favorites it had both heart and hope .It can look you strait in the eye and say I am a move that will never leave your heart . Nicholas sparks wrote this story with such detail and love . Shane West take the amazing role of Landon Carter a troubled teen who just cant see what was rite in font of him. Mandy Moore takes the dramatic role of Jamie Sullivan a girl that really never grew up the way regular teens did she always terned to her faith with any problem. She makes a list of what she want to do in life , that list comes true . This movie is one of my favorite just because of its message . love with your heart not your head .I hope you'll cry just as much ad i did watching this movie it really a movie guys wont be afraid to cry with their friends.Just be like Jamie ,never let a day go by with out living it with love.

title: great film with deep thoughts and spiritual components
review:
Dear folks,

I am a German Christian and I watched this movie these days in a DVD-Copy. It not only remembered me to a wonderful stay as an exchange-student at Fairview-High-School in Boulder Colorado in 1977/78 but also gave me a great encouragement in my Christian life I am living now for about 15 years nowadays. The emphasis of an personal God, who is interested in our lives rather than in doctrines and theological hair splittings is lined out very clearly. I am very thankful to the author and the whole cast and film-crew.

God's blessings

Ralf Tschacher

title: It's the best!!!
review:
I love this movie! It's my favorite and I think it helped influence me. Right now I'm 14 and trying to act mature. Whenever I start to care about what people think, I think about Jaime and how she was able to go through school and not care. If any of you have also read the book this makes more sense. I try to be like Jaime and try to be more forgiving and understanding person because she puts me to shame! I feel so much better whenever I think about Jaime and Landon. They seem so perfect yet at the same time you know they aren't so they really opened up my eyes. My favorite part of the movie was the play. I liked how Landon finally realized that he did see Jaime differently and that he was able to change. I think that's very sweet. I love to talk about this movie so if any one wants to me about it, I'd love to talk. E-mail me at: LilScrappie14@aol.com

Read the book!!! It's fabulous!!!

title: best movie ever
review: a walk to remember is the best movie ever! i cry every time i watch it. Shane west(LUV HIM) is such a wicked awesome, not to mention HOT and Mandy Moore just makes it even better. my favorite scenes are 1. the one where they are at the cemetery and Landon gives Jamie her star-i would die if anyone did that for me. 2. when Landon brings Jamie to the state line to "stand in 2 places at once." and 3. even though it's sad, i love the scene where Jamie and Landon get married and have the love is reading. then they exchange vows for "the rest of their lives" even though Jamie doesn't have long to live. if you haven't seen a walk to remember, you are definitely missing out!!!

title: Amazing
review: This is the best "I need a good cry" movie ever. Shane West is amazing. If anyone is ever in need for a romantic movie, this is definitely the one to watch. Mandy Moore plays the good girl (again), and she does a great job with that. It does seem that she plays the good girl in all her films, even if the character isn't really the "good girl." Other characters in this movie are also cast well. Landon's dad, although a small role, is excellent. The soundtrack in the movie is also really good, which is basically because it is Mandy Moore and Switchfoot and a little Jars of Clay. I watched this movie last night for about the 100th time. This movie is recommended to anyone who likes love, romance, and tears.

title: awesome
review: this movie was the greatest movie i had ever seen.Mandy Moore has not done very good movies but when i saw this i cried so bad and i loved it so much. I'm a sophomore in high school and I'm doing a speech on why people should go see this and i think that after I'm done they will go see it. this movie touched my heart and made me want to be closer to god and be closer to people that i would not normally talk to.i have been a better person to people who don't have many friends.. this movie is an awesome way to show faith and show why you believe and how you can help other people believe..i love they way Shane West (Landon Carter) showed how much he loved Jamie(Mandy). It made me see that there are people that aren't shallow and want to be with people for who they are and not what they look like or who they hang out with...

title: Luved this movie
review: I first saw this movie just after it was released and adored it,but when I re-watched it recently I fell in love with it all over again!True it has some really sappy moments and it is almost completely predictable but it is so nice!Its a sinful pleasure as you wanna hate it but cant bring yourself to! I never really liked Mandy Moore as a singer but in this film she definitely pulls her weight as an actress!She performs beautifully(well if you excuse her showy singing in the play)! And Shane West is fantastic!Of course he has to play the stereotypical bad boy but he makes that role his own!Plus it doesn't hurt his role at all that hes drop dead gorgeous!

title: Wonderful Movie!!
review: A walk to remember is a passionate and Loving movie. My opinion of this movie is that it is excellent. All the actors do a great job expressing the love and the heartache Jaymie Sullivan and Landon Carter have for each other. This movie is definitely a chick flick. It would be a great movie for couples to watch on a Friday night date. At the same time this movie is good for families to see too. It is very optimistic and can help people through tough times. It is a movie that will never be forgotten. This movie is one of the best Iv'e seen in a long time. I'm sure that anyone who watches it will be blown away by the wonderful acting and great story line. Go and rent it because you will love it!

title: A Walk To Remember
review: A Walk To Remember is one of the best movies of the century. Mandy Moore and Shane West did an excellent job. Not only does Mandy Moore have looks but she also has talent to back it up. Mandy and Shane make a really good couple in this movie. Along with the cast I would recommend this movie to anyone, especially anyone of the teenage years. If anyone has seen this movie then you know what I'm talking about and you probably feel the same way. Mandy Moore is way better than any of the other "pop-divas" out there. Also her music in the movie is great. Overall the storyline and plot make this one of the best teen romance films ever.

title: A Shockingly Great Movie
review: I have yet to see the end of this movie, so I'm not even sure how it ends, although people have told me. But I won't give anything away. I heard about this movie through my boyfriend. He kept telling me "You have to come over and watch AWTR." And in reality, I didn't really want to watch it. But i gave in, and decided it was a way to spend time with him and make him happy. Well I just fell in love with this movie. We watched the first half, and I loved it. It was funny, sad, and very realistic. I'm getting ready to rent it, so I can watch the ending tonight. But I totally recommend this movie, well at least the first half because that's really all I can count for. But I think this is a great movie that any guy or chick will love, just as I did.

title: I hate romantic films but this is different.
review:
I watched this film with little hope of enjoying it and I was horribly wrong.

The basic synopsis is the popular boy Landon does something extremely stupid and ends up on probation at school doing various jobs such as cleaning, teaching and acting in the school play. Jamie, a girl who has always been a target for torment for him starts to become more than an eyesore.

I hate Romantic films but I cried so much watching this film my eyes were stinging.

Mandy Moore was amazing and very adorable and Shane West does a great performance as the popular boy with a better side. I recommend this movie to anyone because I'm normally only interested in horror films and yet I still sobbed at a good few scenes in this film. Definitely worth a watch!

title: it was a superb movie...
review: it was absolutely super-love movie. I have watched it several times and still would like to watch it again and again. I just love the couple and the plot and everything. Its a movie a with heart, full of heart actually.For those who were not able to watch it do so please because you will just love it as much as i did. All generations can relate to the movie especially the young generation. It would remind them that love is not just being intimate that they are crossing the borderlines already. It would remind them that love is as beautiful as it can be when its wholesome love and fun. Perseverance, patience and understanding are the innate values of the movie which we can learn on from.

title: I love this movie----and i though i'd hate it.
review:
"That movie rocked," my best friend Stephanie blurted, "and Shane West was so hot!" Because of all the chitter chat of my friends of school, I decided to rent A Walk To Remember. Judging by the sales in the box office, the reviews, and the low-key media attention this classic movie received, I was prepared to sleep during the 168 minutes of this movie.

And I did anything but.

Mandy Moore, one of my least favorite artists, and Shane West, who i had NEVER heard of before, were starring in this masterpiece. I liked the movie because of the humor, the story line, the tears, and overall the real love that was displayed. If I revealed anymore details about it, I might give away Jamie's secret..... Oops! Foot in mouth!

title: This movie is about a popular guy named Landon Carter who is with the " in crowd " and how he falls in love with the ministers daughter Jamie Sullivan
review: I personally loved this movie. I have it on DVD and i have the soundtrack.Its a heartwarming and inspirational movie. It made me cry and laugh at the same time. I think Mandy Moore and Shane West are a perfect couple and they seem like a match made in heaven. Even tho I've seen the movie a hundred times, i still love to watch it and i will still cry when i see it. No one loves this movie as much as i do. It would be a dream come true to me to meet the stars of this movie. these types of movies are my favorite and i love the song Only Hope and Someday We'll Know by Mandy Moore. I definitely recommend this movie to n e one. But u still won't love it as much as i do. TRUST ME! I LOVE A WALK TO REMEMBER!!!

title: An Amazing story
review: Oh, where to begin..When I first heard of this film, I will admit I was skeptic. But, after I read the Nicholas Spark's book, I decided to rent it..I watched it once and then I bought it..It is an incredible movie, and so emotional..Mandy Moore as Jamie Sullivan was brilliant..Mandy has that innocence look to her, and being as she is still young, I think that she was perfect as Jaime..She brought something to the role that is extremely hard to do..She was so amazing that I felt her pain and I cried with her..I felt the heartache as she told Landon of the Cancer..And then, Shane West as Landon Carter..AMAZING!! He had the look, the attitude and the voice to become bad boy Landon..He was also an emotional person and I loved that he was visibly emotional..The things that he did for her and the things that he said to her, I could feel his passion coming off the screen..There is so much more that I can say, but they give me a limit..ALl I can say is BUY THIS MOVIE!!

title: Not like the book, but I still loved it
review:
When I first heard about AWtR, my mom was reading the book. My mom, her cousins, and I all rotated books that we read and liked so it was perfect timing that I read the book just before the release of the film on DVD. I thoroughly enjoyed the book (it is one of the only books that made me cry) and was psyched that there was already a movie.

I was somewhat disappointed how they changed the time period and the reasons why Landon's father was out of the picture, and how Landon got to see Jamie in the play... heck, that the play was changed from a Christmas play to just a high school drama club effort...the production team took A lot of liberties with this story! Over-all, I still loved this movie. I loved watching the character grow, seeing how everyone changed in the film, everyone changed for Jamie. The wedding was just beautiful! I highly recommend this film!!

title: what a great movie
review: This movie is one of the best surprise i've ever had.I was so emotional when i saw it(yesterday) that i'm still like into it.Mandy Moore was such a revelation for me:As an actress, as a singer, and for her incredible beauty.The cast in general is really talented and the couple is so attaching that you feel completely involved in the story.I would advice anyone who's in need of knowing what life,love,faith...are all about, to watch this movie cause the answers are in it.It would give anyone a new vision of life in general.It gave me back the desire to fall in love.I really would like to see more productions as good as this one.watch it,you'll be surprise,it's a sure thing.

title: A movie that makes you smile, cry and feel better...
review: OK, so first let me tell, that I've read the book before I saw the film. And actually I read the book for five or more times. So I Loved it, and when I realized that blondie Mandie Moore was about to star in it, I decided, not to watch it. Than I was at home, watching TV on HBO, and they started a movie, and that was it... And I watched, and enjoyed it (except from the first five or six minutes, that was I think very badly done), and I cried on it, like a baby, although I have never cried while reading the book(only for the first time). So actually I really think, Mandy Moore was great in this movie, she was actually perfect in it. She made me laugh, made me cry and made me fall in love with her (altough I am a girl). She was magical. Shane West for Landon, I think that is also a great choice. He has this incredible talent, playing the-not-so-lovely-guys, and he made this incredible soul-metamorphosis Landon goes through not just believable, but understandable. Peter Coyote and Darryl Hannah was also good, big thumbs up for them... I really think this movie is good, and wish all the Nicholas Spark-adaptations were this good, which are they not, sadly...

title: Syrupy, schmaltzy and cliché.....but a great young cast.
review:
***May contain spoilers***

I'm very curious about those viewers giving this film a 10....and I'm also curious about viewers who genuinely cried during this film.

A cynical review would call it a mediocre version of the overdone pretty-girl-dies-a-long-and-sad-death genre like Love Story or Terms of Endearment. The film on one level is absolutely dripping with sentimentality and unrealistically poetic exchanges between the main characters. The cynic in me could not help but roll my eyes at the sheer transparent let's-make-the-audience-cry attempt by the director and screenwriter.

However...I won't trash it completely. Shane West and Mandy Moore are wonderful young actors and they shine in their roles. The DVD features a fun commentary by the director, Moore and West as they giggle and reminisce about shooting the film. And the music soundtrack is great.

Overall, not bad. If you're a 12-year old in the mood for a good cry or if you're an unfashionable Christian who has felt what it's like to be "uncool" (ie: like Mandy Moore's character), this film will delight you.

title: favorite movie
review: A walk to remember is my favorite movie. It made me cry many times. it is a touching movie that will make you smile then cry. its so heartwarming. if you haven't seen it what are you waiting for??!! i give it a A for performance. the actors nail there parts and make you think they are not acting. the movie will suck you in and you will fall in love with the characters. it gets five out of five stars you will not be disappointed when you see this movie. I have to make this ten lines and that is all i really have to say :) so ill just talk. What did other people think of the movie? your crazy if you think it was not good!! I'm sorry but thats what i think. i think a walk to remember is one of the greatest movies ever!!!

title: This Movie will make u cry.
review: The first time I read the book I cried. I read it 3 times that week. Then I saw it on TV and I cried again. I guess it reminds me of my X/Love. This movie is soo powerful even a cold hearted person would be sad on this movie. I have a thing for love. I want to find it again, and it just makes me happy that the world is falling in love. The movie and the book is the best I have ever seen or read. And plus Shane West it really HOT. But hes way too old. hes 26 and I'm 16. God this sucks. But anyways, read this book and watch the movie. It is great. And you will cry or be sad. I don't know who is reading this, and I really don't care, but you should have faith in god. Because he makes your future, he tells u what to do. "Dreams are nice, u know, but thats all they are. Love is but a sweet dream. Sometimes they come true sometimes they die." What r u willing to do to make a dream come true?

title: The most touching movie ever, and that is a tough title!
review: There have been 5 or 6 movies which I have seen twice in 24 hours, A WALK TO REMEMBER rushed through my iris three times in that span, astonishing. You are not able to get sentimental? - don't watch it! I like many genres, drama, historical, science fiction..., You name it. Only once before I was so touched, that I had to cry even on the day after and that was STAND BY ME. In my view everything was perfect. Really great actors fitting into their roles, the right words at the right time, not always predictable turnings. But most of all it was as good as real, I "believed" the story, I felt the love and the pain, enjoyed the humor and the even greater love afterwards. The brutal part for me is the extremely sad ending with a little touch of happiness. I once wrote a song, lining "...we had something others never ever have, a glimpse of heaven...", but after seeing this movie I don't know if I ever had that glimpse. Isn't a love so deep & pure as seen here the reason for life itself? At least it was for me and maybe I'll find it someday. May god help me.

title: A Must See! But NOT ON TV!!
review: This is my favorite movie of all-time! When it first came out, I saw it probably 3 times in the theaters. And once I got the DVD, I continued watching it over and over again, by myself and with my friends. We all are in love with Shane West and his character Landon Carter. He is the perfect guy and I'm still trying to find him! Anyway, my point is, I would definitely recommend AWTR to all girls of all ages. You will all fall in love with Landon, I guarantee it!! Also, anyone who loves romantic movies with heartwarming moments should absolutely see this movie. But PLEASE, if you plan on seeing it...DO NOT...I repeat...DO NOT watch it on network television. HBO, Cinemax, etc. are fine. But I just watched its network premiere on the WB, and I must admit I was very disappointed. Many parts were left out or cut short which took away from the important moments throughout the film. It was edited poorly as well, and those who only see it in this manner will not get the full effect of this amazing movie. If you're not going to buy AWTR, which I strongly recommend...hehe..., please rent it or watch it on HBO or a channel like that. This is a great film with a touching message and should be enjoyed by all!

title: ADULT NOVEL IS TRANSFORMED INTO TEEN FLICK
review: Although "A Walk to Remember" revolves around the developing relationship between two teens in their Senior year of high school in a small North Carolina town, it's doubtful that when Nicholas Sparks wrote his novel he anticipated it would be adapted to the screen as a movie marketed to the same age group as his protagonists. It's as unlikely that the crowd drawn to this film by the presence of Mandy Moore ever read the book on which it's based as it is that those adults who made it a bestseller will enjoy it very much. For one of those reasons only Hollywood screenwriters seem to understand, the plot has been altered to make Landon a delinquent forced to participate in the spring play as part of the community service required of him; in the book, he was guilt-free and his motivation to perform in the traditional Christmas pageant was of a far more personal nature. Furthermore, as portrayed by the attractive and confident Moore, Jamie is far from the "Plain Jane" described by Sparks, and her miscasting impacts a major plot point involving Landon's bewilderment as he finds himself slowly falling in love with a nondescript and inexperienced girl. The tragedy they face will bring teen girls to tears and no doubt cause their dates to squirm. Recommended for ages fourteen through eighteen; adult fans of the novel should avoid disappointment and stay away.

title: !!!Spoiler Alert!!!
review:
two hours waste of time!!! i've never seen such a melodramatic teenie-movie in my life. expecting a joyous chickflick, the only reason i didn't switch off TV was that i wanted to see mandy moore dying... the plot is so simple that anyone will figure after only 5ive minutes. but i never thought they would exaggerate the "love story" that much!!! OK, the teens are fallen for each other and think it might be true love but who didn't think it was true and the one and only love when being a 16-year-old teen although it broke up few month later?! nevertheless i tortured myself another one and a half hours more seeing all those romantic clichés of proofs of love and found myself shedding a tear the moment Jamie and Landon got married *shameonme* well, although i tried not to like the movie and forget about it i could help watching it a second time few days later referring it to my sister!

for all you who want to watch a movie without being intellectually stimulated and just lean back and once again go through the overwhelming feelings of first love... C-

title: Not-so-great chick-flick
review: I would have to say I have nothing against chick flicks in general, only that this one comes out as too cheesy and predictable tear jerker.  In fact, when I saw this movie with two friends (both males, I've spent the entire length of the film 'guessing' the plotline with one of them, which was rather amusing. Sadly, we were right on more then 90% of our guesses. The other guy said it is a good movie to go with a girlfriend to (providing she likes this sort of things).

title: Sparked my heart !
review: Never have I seen such a touching movie .. for some guys, it may be hard to say, but I have no shame in saying that this movie touched me in ways I didn't think was possible. Before seeing this movie, I got dumped by a girl ( yes I got played ) but after watching it, it amended my heart back together and man, I realized how bad my Ex is. This movie slapped me across the face, and showed me what I - really - want and expect from a girl. Love doesn't blot out under some half naked - 5 inches thick make up - honk if you love me - girl ! When I come across girls like that, I simply smirk now.. which is a good thing. Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore) sets out a great example for any girl out there (exaggerated, i know) and leaves any guy wondering ; Can I chance on something so good? I haven't experienced it yet, but I'm sure this is the kind of movie that leave lovers embraced at the end..

title: Sparked my heart !
review: Never have I seen such a touching movie .. for some guys, it may be hard to say, but I have no shame in saying that this movie touched me in ways I didnt think was possible. Before seeing this movie, I got dumped by a girl ( yes I got played ) but after watching it, it amended my heart back together and man, I realized how bad my Ex is. This movie slapped me across the face, and showed me what I - really - want and expect from a girl. Love doesnt blot out under some half naked - 5 inches thick make up - honk if you love me - girl ! When I come across girls like that, I simply smirk now.. which is a good thing. Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore) sets out a great example for any girl out there (exaggerated, i know) and leaves any guy wondering ; Can I chance on something so good? title: WOW...
review: No comments, just watch it and be surprised because that the greatest movie ever, I mean, it is so beatiful it will change the way you are, because it changed me, I mean, I was totally upside down and I watched it and the way people in the movie are changed my life, no kidding.

title: No Regular Teen or Love Story
review: This is a very fine story of a love story of someone falling for a sick person but does not know it. They learn it and still stay with them. Not a movie that you should call a teen love story but it could happen to anyone. So anyone should at least like or love the story. I am not some young person that likes it because of Mandy Moore. I am over 35 years old and a man that likes many types of movies and music. I keep watching it and find myself crying.

title: They hit and COMPLETELY missed it.
review:
WARNING: Spoilers for those who decide to see the movie and have not as of yet (although I would recommend otherwise).

This was undoubtedly one of the worst movies I have ever seen. The basic plot (quirky girl who knows how to live life to the fullest meets shallow boy who doesn't know how to live, they fall in love, she dies) is all right, but it had too many flaws to make it into a movie worth seeing.

It had its good parts. The acting was good in the movie; Shane West did a fine job and Mandy Moore was all right (although she should stick to singing, in my personal opinion). The messages and ideas that paralleled the plot were sweet, although could have been presented better. However, its many flaws shadow its good parts to no extent.

Firstly, and most importantly, the characters weren't loveable. In order to connect with a movie and enjoy it to the fullest, you must first love the characters and empathize with them. I had no empathy whatsoever when I watched this movie. I like the idea of a quirky but wise girl teaching a boy who doesn't know how to live (although "Stargirl" by Jerry Spinelli really sold the idea), but Moore's character was a little too quirky and unlovable; the same goes for West's character. Not only were they unlovable, but West's character remained inconsistent throughout the entire movie- he goes from badass punk teenager to wise, educated, and kind man with no flaws whatsoever. The only flaws I would have preferred to see in this movie were simple personality flaws in West's character, Brandon, that remained consistent through the movie.

Secondly, the plot had serious flaws that were not acceptable. Brandon is banished to do the school play, auditions and is terrible at it, and yet lands the lead? Too unbelievable. He turns to Moore's character, Jamie, a girl he absolutely despises for assistance in rehearsing for the play. Given time that would have allowed Jamie and Brandon to get to know and respect each other, this would have been acceptable. However, this happens so quickly it's simply not believable at all. Which brings me to my third point.

Things move too quickly in the movie to make sense. I like the concept of falling in love so fast and so suddenly, you don't know what to do with yourself (Love in the Time of Cholera, anyone?). The way it's presented, however, is in a manner that leaves the audience stranded and confused, even yet more unable to love the characters.

I could go on and on, but let me just sum it up: it had a nice concept and the potential to be an amazing film, but it completely missed the target. It makes an attempt at having depth and insight, but does the two concepts no justice. If you're into sappy teenage stories that happen to be CRAP, then watch it. But I'd recommend using the film's message about living life to fullest and use the two hours you WOULD spend watching this god-awful movie doing something a little more productive.

title: typical. (SPOILERS!)
review:
When I saw this movie, I was looking forward to a good chick flick and spending 2 hours drooling over Shane West. I got to the theatre and it was so crowded that I had to sit on the steps. All of the people in the theatre were really the same as me, waiting for a great movie to cry at the end of...enough about me though. I already knew the movie would end with someone dying. However, the movie made no reference that Mandy Moore was going to be sick....until that scene "I'm sorry, I can't see you anymore." My first reaction, well it must be because of her father. But then I decided to listen to the reason - "I have leukemia". Someone in the theatre yelled out "WHAT A LOAD OF BULLSH**!!!" I mean, honestly. There are like 250 movies that end this way. The acting was awful. Although I admit it was really sweet when Landon did all of those things for Jaime... it just wasn't great acting and there was no suspense. Love movies have to have these things.

5/10

-R

title: Powerful witness
review: From a Christian perspective, this is the best movie I have ever seen. Born again, spirit-filled Christians are portrayed the way they really are. Too often, Hollywood typecasts us as small-minded, shallow, two-faced people who have no joy. What a breath of fresh air. To the producers, thankyou. To Hollywood, do your research and keep stuff like this coming.

title: AWESOMETALLICALISTICAL BABY!
review:
I've seen 'A Walk to Remember' possibly a thousand times, and every single time i watch it, it brings tears to my eyes. 'A Walk to Remember' is the best movie, apart from 'Moulin Rouge!', that i've EVER seen. Mandy Moore is a fabulous actress and i'm look forward to her next movie and hopefully it'll be just as wonderful as this one. From the very beginning i could tell that Mandy Moore and Shane west were going to have some chemestry...that's what i look for in movies.

I absolutely loved this movie and i hope you love it too.

title: A modern classic, the power of love.
review:
I have seen A Walk to Remember about three times now, and I find something new about it each time. Before I saw the movie, I had low expectations. Most people would imagine the movie would be something of an abomination since it stars a teen-idol pop singer, as did I. To my surprise, the movie turned out very well, and remains one of my favorite movies.

The third time I saw the movie, I really became engaged in the plot development and dialogues, picking up alot of information. This is what I've discovered: The movie is basically an exploration into the power of love as a motivating and life-changing force. Not only will you see a change in Landon, but you will see him change relationships with the people around him as Jamie changes his own life. He becomes more supportive of his mother, he creates a bond with his father(who is divorced) that wasn't previously made, he creates a new identity with his friends after the fight at the cafeteria, which actually puts him closer to his friends after they discover what Landon has gone through, and he eventually becomes a shining star in Jamie's father's eyes.

The soundtrack is also very good with Mandy Moore's "Only Hope" and "It's gonna be Love", "Someday We'll Know", "Cry", and New Radical's "Mother We Just Can't Get Enough". The song placements are near perfect in creating the right mood, especially with "Mother We Just Can't Get Enough". This will be one of the most special movies you will ever see, it ranks up there with Chasing Amy and Love Story. Go watch it now!

title: A predictable film but cute...
review:
*contains some spoilers*

First off Mandy Moore and Shane West had chemistry. I admit that. The storyline is pretty predictable though. Cute high school guy falls for dorky school girl. Teeny-bopper storyline with a slight twist because Mandy Moore's character has leukemia. The part that I don't like is that we don't actually get to see her character die. What's up with that? Plus I think they could have gone a little more in depth about the whole leukemia thing. Like what treatment did she try? Why didn't she try chemo? (I'm supposing she didn't since she still had her hair unless that was wig.) Anyway I liked the songs in this movie though and they didn't annoy me like those damn songs in Crossroads. Over okay movie although predictable. Definitely a chick flick.

title: very special
review: this movie caught me, i've seen it a few times now, and i'm still touched. It makes me think about today's state of love, (hard to find) will some girl see my love sometimes? the first movie to watch with your girl is definately this one! When will it be played in the Netherlands?

title: A mixed bag, but overall a good movie
review:
I doubt anyone will read this but anyway-

The storyline was predictable but excusably for those few moments where you just want to melt. The screen play itself was not too great. There individual lines were a bit cliched. I mean, "you have to promise not to fall in love with me." is a bit unreal. Acting wise it varies. Shane West (BATON ROUGE!) was rather good in my opinion and really led the cast. Mandy Moore... well, Mandy did better than I expected - but I wasn't expecting much. She needed more life more joy in the beginning. I realize she is sick but they make her so serious and boring. She doesn't giggle and grin and do stuff a normal person would do. I realize also that she is very conservative but conservative people can have a good laugh too! Still, about halfway through she starts to improve. Everyone else is ok but I liked Lauren German who played the exgirlfriend especially. She did a nice job of giving that character just the right amount of significance. You thought about her often, but not too often. CONCLUSION- a good movie.

PS- if there are any guys out there who look and act like landon carter-get in touch with me immediately

-Maggie

title: One of the cheesiest movies I've ever seen,.. but
review:
I thought it was great! Cheesy the entire way through, ESPECIALLY the end. But I enjoyed myself the entire time. There is nothing wrong with a little Cheese!

Mandy Moore was excellent in her debut performance, as was most of the cast. Though I really think that Moore made this movie shine!

8/10 stars

Check it out!!

title: This is the BEST movie ever!!!
review: To those who say this movie is stupid, I have two words for you; "yea right." This is SO different from other movies such as NOT ANOTHER TEEN MOVIE, which said that a girl looked ugly in a pony tail.  They're not saying that Jamie is ugly, but different.  This movie has such an inspirational meaning to it and is not too dramatic.  Brittany Spears only wishes that she could have made this movie, but if she did, it would have sucked.  This movie could not have been better because, to me, it was everything that I could have asked for in a movie.  I am not the prettiest girl in school; if anything, I'm the ugliest.  But that doesn't matter to me anymore.  This movie taught me about having faith; not just religiously, but having faith in yourself and the people around you.  This was the best movie ever and nothing can top it.  Just have faith, and know who will really stand by your side!

title: Uh huh
review: Well, this reminded me of Heaven and Earth or something and LeeLee S did two betters after that. This film gets a ? from me. What is it really? Hm, I don't want to knock it or rate it, just leave it as it is until I see another better film. See ya.

title: Popular school jerk and good'o nerdy Mandy falls in love.
review:
Oh my god, is this another teen movie? A typical popular guy goes out with a supposably "nerdy"(at least take away all her makeup) girl and all of a sudden they fall in love with each other. Hmm, what a shocker! Can't those writers think of something different for a change? Almost every problem is resolved in the movie like a 30 minute T.V show. C'mon! Can it get any cornier? Yes it can...

----- SPOILER ALERT -----

When Jamie Sullivan (Mandy Moore) and Landon Carter (Shane West) finally ends up dating and things are going fine for them Jamie confesses she has cancer. Psh, give me a break! They just couldn't think of anything else could they? Hell, she should of just said "I'm actually a guy." That would of made the story more interesting! Jeez! Or at least she should of gotten shot or something which would been more dramatic and would of made some Anti-Mandy fans happy.(Just kidding) Why was she so healthy in the beginning and then all of a sudden she just becomes really sick after she confesses? Can this movie get any more lame? Of course, why stop now? What happens next? Believe it or not they get married and yet again she looks healthy then.

----- SPOILER END -----

Thankfully Mandy Moore's acting wasn't as horrible as the movie. Mandy, you're 2 for 2... being in bad movies, Princess Diaries and now this. It's also really hard to believe Mandy as a "nerdy" nice girl when she played a popular evil cheerleader in her previous movie.

Another thought, Why is Mandy listening to her own music in her car during the movie? I thought that was weird. And at one point during the movie, Mandy sang for like 5 minutes straight! What is this Glitter?!

Very unoriginal, unemotional, corny movie.

Overall Rating: 5/10

title: A walk to bypass completely!!
review:
I have just had the misfortune to see this film.

Mandy Moore and Shane West (the two leads) were at the premiere in Melbourne last night, and told us that they had fun making the movie and hoped that we have as much fun watching it. I have to say that it was fun to watch it, but not for the reasons Ms Moore was hoping for, I'm sure. It's a great film to sit back and take the mickey out of!

Given the cast, you'd think this movie is aimed at 12/13 year old girls (and I assure you that 75% of the audience last night were in that demographic). I would suggest that you not take young kiddies, as there are some *ahem* adult themes that I didn't think were appropriate for them to see.

The story was predictable, so much so that I was predicting 15 minutes in advance what was going to happen. There was no real drive in the story, it just plodded along.

To be fair, there were some good funny/poignant moments in the film, but they were only fleeting scenes. This is a "wait till it comes out on video" film (and even then I'd seriously consider giving it a swerve).

title: Read the book first
review: This was a fairly good movie, the acting was suprisingly good. However if you read the book you will be a little dissapointed. The play they do in the movie is not the same one that is written in the book. Also a few parts are changed around and the chemistry between the characters is better in the book. Mandy Moores (Jaime's) performace is really really good. If you liked the book go see the movie...

title: Don't get your hopes up ...
review:
Don't get your hopes up about this movie, especially if you've read the book before going to see it. I had read the book long before I knew it would be made into a movie and the book was totally awesome! I went to the premiere tonight and the story is nowhere near as good as the book. I heard that Nicholas Sparks didn't give consent on the script, but the writer(s) still strayed far from the original story. The movies is *very loosely* based on the book -- I believe only the characters' names are the same in both. Don't be fooled: the movie isn't set in the 50s as the book is, but rather the 90s. The plot is not as smooth-flowing as it is in the novel. I would recommend a visit to the local library than to the local theater.

As for the acting, I think that Shane West did quite well as Landon, although Mandy Moore was not as convincing to me as Jamie. Peter Coyote did as best as he could as Reverand Sullivan, but the character was to be much older and more indifferent; not as mean to his daughter or to her new love. And I have to say that the ending was bad as well. They should have stuck with the original ending ... I won't give it away. The movie was good because it was sweet and romantic and a good movie to watch .... but compared to the book, it stunk!! Nicholas Sparks's book will have you laughing and crying all at the same time .... The movie does not.

title: This movie was the best movie ever!
review: This movie was the best movie ever! Though it didn't follow the book every part, it made the book come alive on the screen. The actors were well chosen, and the plot was well carried out. I saw this with my fiance, and it made the movie even better. This movie is a definate tear jerker! A 10+ movie!!!!!!!!!

title: NO!
review: Horrible.  My girlfriend and I saw it and she said it was bad because it seemed so fake and unreal, like it couldn't happen in real life.  For those who want to see something that seems fantasy-like, go see it.  For those who want a little bit of reality in their movies, make a run from the ticket booth when this movie is the choice.

title: You're sure this isn't a remake of a Pat Boone movie?
review: Amiable diversion for the first half-hour or so, with the rotten high school kids being nasty to one another. And it's all disarmingly tame, like one of those '50s teen B-movies where the juvenile-delinquent boy is reformed by the gawky girl. There's the high school play, the first kiss, the lunchroom hierarchy; all that's missing is the soda shop. (Don't these kids have cell phones? Don't they spend endless hours instant-messaging one another?) Then it goes all Hallmark and soft-focus, heavy-handedly folds in religion, and springs its unsurprising surprise about its heroine (and Mandy Moore, especially in the early scenes, is quirky and interesting and probably too good for this material). Finally it staggers to a gooey conclusion, by which time virtually every character has forgiven every other character for everything. You don't have to be too much of a cynic to question that. Maybe some very impressionable teenage girls will respond to this Nutrasweet dish; I'm not so sure about the rest of us. It's like Ned Flanders' kids' idea of a date movie.

title: Not Bad...
review: It's kind of hard to write a review on this movie because there's only so much that I can say without ruining the entire plot for everyone who hasn't seen it, but I'll try my best not to do so. Anyway, I had read the novel 'A Walk to Remember' in which this movie was based on a few years ago and I was kind of disappointed to see that the film didn't stay very true to the book. There were ALOT of differences, almost too many, so if you're one of those people who like it when movies stay true to their adoptive novels then you might not like this one. I however did enjoy the film very much; it was cheesy at times but it had a very touching and memorable storyline along with some pretty fine acting if I do say so myself. Mandy Moore is a beautiful girl and it was VERY hard to make her role as the school outcast seem believable (it kinda worked), and Shane West did pretty good as his role of the bad guy turned good. The last half-hour of this movie is quite depressing; I don't think there was a dry eye in the theatre as the final scenes were very touching and sad. Overall I'd say it was a pretty good movie and I do recommend it to those who enjoy mushy romantic stuff. If you're not a fan of romance then you probably shouldn't waste your time seeing this one. Kudos to the entire cast and crew of "A Walk to Remember" for doing a superb job!

title: This movie is great!!!
review: This is one of those movies that you'll remember for a lifetime. I just saw the movie like 5 min. ago, it was great. The classic story of love is mastered in this movie based on the book by Nicholas Sparks. When Shane West cried I had to cry.... Guys crying are my weak point. I couldn't help myself. Shane West and Mandy Moore make this story so believable you feel for all the characters. Especially that the movie states it true... that love is a leap of faith. My friends and I could have made an ocean with all our tears!! This is the greatest movie!!!! And one of my  favorites!!!
